loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Merly, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además de sociable y muy amable, es separada, vive en compañía de su padre, madre hermana y su hija de 3 años de edad, cómodamente instalados en la casa de sus padres. La actividad que tiene Merly es la venta de comida como desayunos, menús, así  como también da pensión a los trabajadores de una empresa de gas y un aserradero, iniciándose hace 2 años de a poco por solicitud de pensión de la empresa de gas, para después de 01 año tamben brindar ese servicio al aserradero, contando con el apoyo de su mama en la preparación y atención de sus clientes. Le gusta mucho su negocio pues le agrada la cocina y preparar nuevos tipos de comidas llegando a sorprender a sus clientes. Desea mas adelante ampliar su negocio y abrir un restaurante en alguna zona céntrica de la ciudad donde pueda llegara a ser muy conocida en la ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la  institución MFP, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevo soles desea comprar utensilios para la cocina, así como mesas y sillas para ampliar y mejorar su negocio y de esa manera dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Merly, 31, is a hard-working, dynamic woman who is also very sociable and kind.  She is divorced and lives with her father, mother, sister and 3-year-old daughter in her parents home.  Merly sells food such as breakfasts and set menus, as well as meals for the workers of a gas company and a sawmill.  She started two years ago at the request of the gas company and a year later began providing meals to the sawmill.  Her mother helps with the food preparation and customer service.  She enjoys her work because she likes to cook and prepare new kinds of food to surprise her customers.  In the future she would like to expand her business and open a restaurant in a central part of the city where she could become very popular.  This is her second loan through the MFP institution.  She hopes to receive a small loan so she can meet her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time as done previously.  She likes her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive.  The 2,000 PEN loan will be used to buy utensils for the kitchen, as well as tables and chairs to expand and improve her business.  In this way she can improve customer service.

loans.use: To buy utensils, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Susana Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna es una mujer casada, su esposo es minero y juntos tienen dos pequeños niños, uno de 3 años y el mayor de 8, todos ellos viven en la ciudad de Camaná, ubicada al sur del país, lugar que disfruta a diario del Océano Pacífico, debido a que se encuentra a pocos metros de Camaná. Reyna es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que disfruta escuchar música durante sus tiempos libres; como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Reyna más disfruta es el “Lomo Saltado”.	

A Reyna le hubiese gustado estudiar para poder convertirse en una costurera, pero debido a distintas situaciones ella no pudo lograrlo y es por eso que desea que cuando sus hijos sean grandes, pueda brindarles lo necesario para que estudien lo que deseen. En la actualidad Reyna, entusiasmada por su esposo, se dedica a la venta de golosinas en una de las calles de Camaná, en donde trabaja aproximadamente 10 horas diarias, esto le permite poder tener entre 28 y 30 clientes a su vez esto le genera un ingreso diario de S/.50 y si hay mayor afluencia de público ella puede ganar hasta S/.70. Ella piensa que tiene buen número de clientes porque brinda un buen trato a sus clientes y es muy rápida en la atención de los pedidos.

Gracias al préstamo Kiva, Reyna podrá comprar más golosinas a un menor precio y una mayor variedad de sus productos. Ella piensa que esta oportunidad la ayudará mucho ya que sus clientes siempre están solicitándole más y nuevos productos. Con el incremento que logre en sus ventas desea poder comprarse otro triciclo y también llenarlo de golosinas para sus ventas, esta idea de negocio le permitirá poder generar los ingresos necesarios para poder comprar un terreno donde pueda construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Reyna is married with two children, ages three and eight. Her husband is a miner. They live together in the city of Camaná, located in the south of the country. This region is blessed by the Pacific Ocean, which is quite close to Camaná. Reyna is a hard-working woman who enjoys listening to music in her free time. It is well-known that Peru has the most delicious food in the world, and one of Reyna's favourite dishes is "Lomo Saltado".
Reyna would have liked to study and become a seamstress, but due to a series of events she was unable to do so. For this reason, she wants to be able to offer her children everything they need so that they can study whatever they want. Reyna, thanks to her husband's encouragement, sells candy on one of the streets of Camaná. She works approximately ten hours a day, and she has about 28 to 30 customers a day. This generates her a daily income of 50 Nuevo Soles. If there are more people around she might earn up to 70 Nuevo Soles. She feels that she has a good customer base because she treats them well and she provides fast service.
Thanks to this loan from Kiva, Reyna will be able to buy more candy at a better price, and have a greater variety of products. She thinks that this opportunity will help her greatly, since her customers are always asking for more products and for new products. With this increase in her sales, she wants to buy another stall to fill with candy for sale. This will allow her to generate the necessary income in order to buy a plot of land to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy candies to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from the village of San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Virginia is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Virginia manages a coconut plantation. Virginia has been in her business for 15 years and earns 12,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2009, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Virginia is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 38 años de edad convive con Wilfredo de 40 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hermosas criaturas. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Olga está feliz con el trabajo que realiza, ella se dedica al cultivo de café y plátano con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Juntamente con su esposo, quien es el que siempre la apoya constantemente con los trabajos del campo, pero en ocasiones sale a trabajar como acerrador del que también obtienen un ingreso económico. Durante la temporada de cosecha contrata personales para que le puedan facilitar en la extracción de sus productos. En futuro Olga desea abrir una tienda donde pueda vender  sus productos de primera necesidad. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará una congeladora.
texts.en:
Olga is 38 years old and lives with her partner, 40-year-old Wilfredo.  The couple have two beautiful children.  They live together in their own home which is located in Pichari district.  Olga is happy with the work that she carries out.  She grows coffee and bananas and puts in a lot of hard work and commitment.  She works together with her husband who always supports her with her farming work but also sometimes goes out to work as a lumberjack which makes him additional income.  During harvest time, Olga hires staff so that she can gather in her produce more easily.  In the future, she would like to open a store where she can sell basic household products.

This will be Olga's second loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will use the 3,000 soles to buy a freezer.

loans.use: to buy a freezer so that she can set up a grocery store

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She has one additional dependent. She lives in Kampala, Uganda where she sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in  this business for eight years and works six days a week. 

Milly is requesting for loan for 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenges are increasing prices of charcoal and seasonality. Her goal is to educate her children to university level. 

Milly lives in her own house with access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Batzaya

texts.en:
Borrower Ms. Batzaya is a married lady who lives with her husband and son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. She supports her family by operating a home supplies stall business at the local indoor market of Ulaanbaatar city. 

Batzaya is a very ambitious lady who desires to build a new house in her yard, so she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary construction materials. Her aim is to finish her house and live with her family happily.

loans.use: to build a house during this warm season

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a rural smallholder farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. He does poultry and crop farming to provide basic needs for his family. The key lesson he has taken away from many years of crop farming is the importance of using certified agricultural farm inputs.

John is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.

With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase John’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.en:
Juanita is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. She has had her business for 14 years ago and it allows her to support to her family. For example she has 3 children who are studying. The older is studying the second semester of Chemical Engineer\'s program. Juanita wants to offer all to her children an education that allows them to continue their own life and to be an honest and hard-working people. She has a grocery store and a novelties store.

Juanita requires of $1000 USD to purchase merchandise that allows her to increase the capacity of her business. She hopes this next Christmas season her sales will increase. She just wants to continue supporting to her family and hopes to return the loan in a term of 6 months. She and her family thank your support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Juanita es una persona muy amable, amistosa y trabajadora; hace 14 años que tiene su negocio y este le ha permitido apoyar en todo momento a su familia. Por ejemplo tiene 3 hijos, los cuales se están estudiando y el mas grande de ellos se encuentra estudiando el 2 semestre de la carrera de Ingeniero Químico. Juanita quiere ofrecerles a todos sus hijos una educación que les permita continuar en la vida y ser personas honestas y trabajadoras. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes y otra tienda de novedades.

Juanita requiere de $ 1000 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita de esta manera aumentar la capacidad de su negocio, espera que esta próxima temporada navideña sus ventas se incrementen. Juanita solo quiere continuar apoyando a su familia por lo que espera regresar el préstamo en un término de 6 meses. Ella y su familia agraden tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is a hairdresser with 25 years of experience. Larisa is a widow with two sons. Her sons are grown up and live with their own families. Larisa lives with her mother. She loves to take care of her two grandchildren. 

She is very popular hairdresser in town but she hesitated a lot before deciding to take out a loan. The main factor for her decision to receive a loan is the upcoming season for weddings. During spring and summer time many weddings are conducted in Tajikistan. From previous years Larisa knows that there will be many brides that will come to her to make beautiful hair styles. She would like to offer them different hair styles and other products to use. She knows suppliers she worked with before and they informed her that buying products in bigger volume would be less expensive.

loans.use: Purchase of hairdressing and coloring supplies

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Four years ago Eulalia used her small savings to start up a business selling fish. Every day, she hawks fish like bass and perch through her neighborhood from 7:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night. She would like a loan to buy more fish and to outfit a small restaurant in her home, which has unfinished floors. Eulalia used to have a restaurant but was forced to close it when she lost her lease. To open the restaurant she needs to fix her industrial stove and purchase pots and pans, as well as a few tables and plastic chairs. Eulalia is 45 and has 5 children, 3 of whom are dependent on her and attend school. She raises them by herself as her partner abandoned her some time ago. With this loan she can realize her dream of reopening her restaurant and provide for her family's livelihood.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Eulalia tiene negocio de venta de pesca desde hace 4 años. Se inicio en este negocio con ahorros propios. Ella transporta su producto en un balde y recorre pie los diferentes sectores por donde vive todos los días de la semana desde las 7: AM a 10: PM. Ofreciéndoles variedad de tipos de pescado como: Corvinas, Picudo, Mojarras y otros.

Desea el crédito para poder invertir en compra de mas pescado su demanda se ha incrementado. Eulalia tenía antes un restaurante que por motivo de adecuación de local fue cancelado su contrato de arrendamiento y tuvo que dejar ese negocio. Eulalia quiere activar ese negocio en su casa y necesita mas dinero para poder comprar ollas, arreglar cocina industrial, compra un par de mesas y sillas plásticas.

Eulalia tiene 46 años 5 hijos de los que solo están a cargo 3 que estudian. Eulalia los mantiene a sus hijos sola su compañero la abandono hace tiempo. Desea que sea considerada para un crédito y así poder cumplir su anhelo de poner su restaurante. De esta manera generara mas ingresos y podrá seguir adecuado su vivienda que esta con piso de tierra.

loans.use: To buy fish and outfit a small restaurant.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old and has a small shop for car and vehicle spare parts. He has a big family: his wife, four children, and his mother live together. He wants to get $1200 to paint his shop and bring more goods for his shop. He wants to increase his income and develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Paint shop and purchase more goods

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
"Due to the lack of money, I have not been able to install proper drainage in my bathroom. The conditions are becoming unbearable for me and my family. I would also like to install some flooring to stop the humidity. I'm requesting $900 USD to install proper drainage and flooring."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

“Debido a la falta de dinero no he podido meter el drenaje en el baño de mi casa pero las condiciones de higienes ya no son favorables para mi familia así también me gustaría poner el piso para evitar humedad” $ 900.00 dlls para la instalación del drenaje en el baño y poner el piso”.

loans.use: To install drainage and flooring in the bathroom

loans.name: Enma Diana

texts.es:
Enma I. is a hardworking mother of two children. Together with her husband, she works daily with the goal of bringing a better quality of life and a good education to her two small children. She and her family live in her mother in law's house. Enma decided to open a small shop in the house to help contribute economically, while still being able to manage the work around the house without problems.

The business is growing. However, the main goal of this family is to get their own home. They want to fix up a small area in the house where they can open a retaurant serving regional cuisine, permitting them to save money for their children's education. This is why they want to increase the number of products they sell in their shop, so they can increase their income and get closer to realizing their goals. With your generous support we can help this family achieve their dreams

Enma I., es una laboriosa madre de dos niños, que junto a su esposo trabaja diariamente con el afán de poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación a sus pequeños vástagos. Ella y su familia viven en la casa de su suegra, en la que Enma ideó abrir una pequeña bodega con la cual apoyaría económicamente a su querido esposo y a la vez realizaría las tareas de su hogar con efectividad y sin ningún problema. El negocio marcha adecuadamente, sin embargo la gran meta que tiene esta familia es conseguir una casa propia para cobijarse con libertad, armonía y con el propósito de acondicionar un pequeño espacio para aperturar un restaurante de comida regional que les permita ahorrar dinero para la educación de sus hijos. Por esta razón desea incrementar la cantidad de productos de su bodega a través de una mayor inversión para iniciar la construcción de sus sueños. Ayudemos a que esta familia logre sus anhelos con vuestro generoso aporte.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE EVERY DAY ITEMS NEEDED TO STOCK HER SMALL SHOP, ENABLING HER AND HER HUSBAND TO ONE DAY PURCHASE A HOME OF THEIR OWN, AND SAVE FOR THEIR CHILDREN'S EDUCATION.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rosanna Francisca

texts.en: Rosanna is a friendly entrepreneur who wants to open her own beauty slaon for the women and girls of Palavé, a comunity of San Cristobal.  She will be twenty-six years old tomorrow and is ready to celebrate with her two children and her loyal customers. Rosanna has been running a nail salon for four years.  She offers services such as manicures, pedicures, nail polish, drawing on nails, nail repair and more.  She explains that she constantly has to invest in materials such as acrylic, artificial nails, varnish, nail scissors, and nailfiles. She also says that she has a well established clientele, and Rosanna would like funds to expand her business.  With the loan requested, she will purchase a new nail polish machine so she can hire one more girl so she can care for more than one customer at a time.The entrepreneur mentions that she hopes her business will be successful enough so that she will attract more customers and hire at least five more employees.

loans.use: Loan will be used to open a beauty salon, purchase a new nail polish machine, and hire one employee .

loans.name: Banda B7 C Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Esther K..  She is currently a tailor and is requesting a loan to expand business.  Esther is 38 years old and is divorced.   She has 2 children ranging age 10 and 12 and her children go to school.  Each week, Esther makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to build a house  Esther has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time. Esther is joined in her small group by Betty N., Jenifer K., Cissy K., and Teresa K..  Betty N. owns a grocery and wants to increase stock.  Jenifer K. is currently operating a salon and wants a loan to expand business.  Cissy K. operates a business of shoes and wants to add in inventory.  Teresa K. owns a canteen and is requesting a loan to buy a fridge.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine and expand business

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is single woman. She has a tailoring business she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

In the past, Happy has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Camp Kuku 2008-3 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Lucia J.. She is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Lucia is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is a security guard. She has 4 children ranging from age 12 to 18, and her children go to school.

Each week, Lucia makes approximately 315 sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to continue to send her children to school.

Lucia is joined in her small group by Juan M., Victoria K., Victoria D., and Agnes K.. Juan M. has a business in selling breads. Victoria K. is also currently operating a business selling breads. Victoria D. operates a business selling vegetables. Agnes K. is currently in the business of selling flour. Each entrepreneur wants to expand her business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in his farm land

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Thanks to the support he received with the first loan, José was able to obtain his work vehicle, thus providing wellbeing for his beloved family. He would like to create a safe place in which his young children can grow up without any difficulties. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can repair his work vehicle because he has decided to increase his income. He hopes that after much hard work, he will be able to obtain a space on which to build his home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

José, gracias al apoyo de un primer préstamo ha podido adquirir su herramienta de trabajo para otorgarle bienestar a su querida familia, tiene deseos de establecerse en un lugar seguro para que sus pequeños dos hijos se desarrollen sin inconvenientes. Por esa razón solicita un préstamo para reparar su herramienta de trabajo ya que ha decidido mejorar sus ingresos con esfuerzo y adquirir un espacio para construir su hogar.

loans.use: Repair work vehicle

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala S., 54, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience selling bananas and fruit in her business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 520 Tala (~216 USD).

SPBD loans are Kalala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her husband is a fisherman and he also helps the most in family needs.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock her small business of selling undergarments in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is 27 years old and separated. She lives with her two children; Jhon, 2 years old and Lizbeth, 9 months old. As a child, she learned to knit from her mother, who taught her this art. Thanks to this, today Ana can support her family and provide for their economic needs. Ana is constantly knitting; whatever she is doing, she always has knitting needles in her hands. She has been knitting since she was nine years old to help support the family. Ana likes to knit and it also allows her to take care of her small baby. She can knit while she watches the baby sleep.

This mother wants to help her two young children get ahead and to become professionals.

With the loan she is requesting, she will buy more wool and produce more clothing. If possible, she will buy a knitting machine and in the future she will have a workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ana tiene 27 años se separó de su pareja y ahora vive con sus dos hijos; Jhon de 2 y Lizbeth de 9 meses de nacida. Desde muy niña aprendió a tejer de su madre, la cual le enseñó ese arte, gracias a ella hoy en día Ana puede mantener a su familia y brindarle el sustento económico que tanto necesitan.No hay momento en el cual Ana se separe de su tejido, ya que haga lo que haga, siempre está con las agujas de tejer en las manos, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace nueve años, como sustento principal de su familia.A Ana le gusta tejer, ya que además le permite atender a su pequeña bebe que requiere cuidados, ella puede tejer mientras vela su sueño, es por eso que no encuentra dificultad en hacerlo.

Esta madre, quiere sacar adelante a sus dos hijos pequeños, a los cuales quiere ver profesionales.

Con el dinero que solicita comprará más lana y producirá más prendas, y si es posible, comprar una maquina de tejer, para que en el futuro pueda tener un taller.

loans.use: Buy wool for making clothing and a machine for knitting.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer emprendedora, el negocio que tiene actualmente lo manejaba su esposo pero en un viaje de Reynosa hacia Linares tuvo un accidente y falleció en el 2001 por lo que desde entonces ella tomo la responsabilidad del negocio y continuar con las ventas una de sus hijas la mas pequeña es la que le ayuda a instalar el puesto de ropa y a estar con ella al pendiente de los clientes y es la que la acompaña a surtir la ropa a Reynosa, de esto hace aproximadamente 7 años como siempre le habían gustado las ventas no batallo para acoplarse y en la actualidad ya mucha gente la conoce en los diferentes mercados de las colonias y le va muy bien, incluso tiene gente que le compra a plazos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $925 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder darle rotación a la ropa.
texts.en:
Teresa is an enterprising woman. She used to manage her current business with her husband, but on a trip from Reynosa to Linares he had an accident and passed away in 2001. Due to his death, Teresa assumed responsibility of the business and continuing with the sales. One of her daughters, the youngest, helped her install the clothing stand, attends to clients and accompanies her on her supply trips to Reynosa. For the last 7 years she has enjoyed sales and has not resisted joining in. Currently, many people in the various markets know Teresa and things are going well for her. She has clients who buy from her in installments. Teresa needs a $925 loan which she will repay in 6 months to purchase merchandise so that she can rotate the cloths she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Lukia Nakiranda’S Group

texts.en:
Lukia is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 46-year-old married woman with 5 children, aged between 29 and 21. Three of her children go to school. Lukia doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She is a very responsible member within her group. She resides in and owns a 3-room house, where she is staying with 4 people. They have electricity but no piped water at home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Lukia sells bricks at her home. She buys these blocks from different areas and uses a lorry to bring them to her home. She sells to all categories of people, both wholesale and retail.

Her main challenges are water, thieves, and defaulters. Lukia works 7 days a week and has been with MCDT for 9 years, servicing her eighteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business and aspires to build rental rooms.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Alovuddin

texts.ru: Давлятов Аловуддин учитель средней школы . Возраст 52 лет. Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Работает в школе и параллельно занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает и перепродает. Данным бизнесом занимается уже 10 лет. Эта деятельность специфична для сельской местности, поэтому он имеет все необходимые условия для бизнеса. Сейчас для увеличения поголовья скота хочет получить кредит и купить дополнительно двух молодых бычков. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Alovuddin D. is a high school teacher. He is 52 years old, is married and has six children. Alovuddin works in a school and also raises livestock. He purchases calves, fattens them up and resells them. He has been in this business for 10 years. This business is a good fit for a rural area and he has everything necessary to run it. Alovuddin would like to take out a loan in order to increase his livestock count and to purchase two additional calves. He will pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie has been managing a small store in their village since 2001. She is married to Teofilo who owns a passenger tricycle. They have two children aged six and seven who are currently in school.

Her income from her store is still inadequate to support the family's daily expenses so she would like a loan amounting to Php 5,000 to buy additional products like rice, cooking oil, noodles, and canned goods for her store. By adding more items in her store she will help provide for the family's daily needs and saving for the education of their children.  She also dreams that her store will become a grocery store someday.
	
She said that “God has mercy to those who work hard for their future” which is why Lailanie and her husband are both working hard for their family’s future.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Empecemos (“Let’s get started”) Village Bank.  Marina is a 61-year-old widow with eight children. Marina travels to regional markets two to three times per week, where she sells clothing, dry goods and vegetables. She buys grains, potatoes, and other products to sell in stores. Marina is requesting a loan to buy slips, aprons, and dry goods. Marina dreams that her youngest daughter will find a stable job and of expanding her business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos.
Marina es viuda, tiene 61 años y 8 hijos, Marina viaja a las ferias D. la región 2 a 3 veces por semana, en donD. venD. ropa, abarrotes, verduras y D. las ferias compra cereales, papa, productos que luego venD. en las tiendas.
Marina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. fustanes, mandiles, abarrotes.
Los sueños D. Marina son que su hija ultima tenga un trabajo estable y aumentar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy slips, aprons and dry goods

loans.name: Koem

texts.en: N., aged 60, lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she has a plot of land in her village to cultivate different kinds of vegetables. She currently plants morning glories, Chinese kale, and cabbages, and she can make around $3 from her cultivating. She is widowed and has four children; all four of them are single. Two of her children are employed as domestic building workers. In view of the fact that vegetable planting is N.'s main source of income, she would like to request a loan of $600 to purchase a little more farmland for planting vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a little more farmland

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en: Ronke is married with four children. She is 40 years old. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She needs a loan of N50000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es: Noemí cumplió 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja cerca de 7 años, quien es el padre de sus dos hijos, actualmente habitan en una casa alquilada. Desde que formó su propia familia incursionó en la venta de ropa, por recomendación de su esposo, ahora se siente contenta por realizar este trabajo y más aun por contar con el apoyo de su pareja. Cada cierto tiempo viaja a la capital para comprar los nuevos modelos de prendas de vestir, al regresar se encarga de venderlos durante tres días a la semana, va a los pueblos más lejanos, donde tiene clientes y deja las prendas al crédito, cobrándoles cada fin de semana. Esta dinámica de trabajo le resultó muy rentable, sólo que ahora tiene una pequeña dificultad; de no contar con capital suficiente para aumentar su mercadería según los pedidos que le hacen. Noemí tiene anhelos de progresar y hacer que su negocio crezca, con el tiempo abrirá un bazar en la ciudad, que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Desde un inicio estuvo interesada en la conformación de este nuevo banco comunal, del cual ahora es presidenta. Y como es nuevo, todos vienen solicitando su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para la compra mercadería, la cual le servirá para incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Noemi is 25 years old and lives with her partner of 7 years who is also the father of her children. They currently live in a rental house. Ever since she formed her own family she has been selling clothing, under the recommendation of her husband, and now she is very happy with this job and her ability to count on the support of her partner. Every so often she travels to the capital to buy new clothing styles. Upon returning home, she sells clothing three days a week in very remote towns where she has customers. She lets them buy clothing on credit, charging them every weekend. This work dynamic is very profitable for her but she has a slight problem now. She does not have sufficient capital to increase her stock of merchandise to keep up with demand. Noemi wishes to progress and expand her business so she can improve her family’s quality of life. With time she will open a bazaar in the city. From the beginning she was interested in the formation of this new communal bank, of which she is now the president. And because it is new, everyone comes to apply for their first loan through Microfinanzas PRISMA. The loan that she is applying for is for the purchase of new merchandise which will help her increase her capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of Merchandise Stock

loans.name: Viridiana

texts.es: La señora Viridiana O. y su esposo el señor Rene Edagardo Peralta tienen dos pequeños hijos a los cuales les quieren darlo mejor. Están solicitando un préstamo para terminar los acabados del cuarto de sus niños pero no cuentan con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que les va a realizar la mejora. Solicitan el préstamo para poder terminar el recamara y así sus hijas tengas su espacio mejor.
texts.en:
Ms. Viridiana O. and her husband Mr. Rene Edagardo Peralta have two small children they would like the best for. They are applying for a loan so they can finish a bedroom for their children. They do not have the money necessary to buy the materials or to pay the person who will do the labor. They are applying for this loan to be able to finish the bedroom so their children have a better space.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acabados del interior de la vivienda

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah N. is the mother of three children and she is able pay for their education with money she saved from her last loan. She is 44 years old and has been in the business of farming and selling what she grows for eight years. She also sells goods for other farmers in the area. A few things she sells are matooke, cassava, maize and beans. She now owns a home that she built from the proceeds of her previous loans and she also has cows for milk. She and the other members of her loan group are excited to further grow their businesses and they are grateful for your support.

loans.use: To invest in farming

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Remi is 47 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and also makes popcorn with a popcorn machine. She is requesting the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Josefa Herlinda

texts.es:
Doña Josefa Herlinda C. T.  cuenta con 49  años de edad, es casada se dedica a la Artesanía en Confección de Playeras  cuenta con un pequeño taller  junto a su esposo conjuntamente con sus 4 hijos, la actividad a la que se dedica, lleva 8 años de elaborar y se encuentra en el Paraje Chicha clan municipio y  departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar dos máquinas industriales y así poder facilitar mejor su trabajo y poder cubrir la demanda de sus
Clientes como también poder generar más empleos en su comunidad. Y mejorar sus ingresos y darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Josefa Herlinda C. T. is 49 years old, married and makes a living as an artisan making sneakers. She has a small shop along with her husband, with whom she has had four children. She has been dedicated to her craft for eight years in the Paraje Chicha commune in the Totonicapán region of Guatemala. Currently, her customers' demands have grown, but her current economic condition is not sufficient to meet them, which is why she is turning to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR to help her increase her capital. She is requesting a loan with the goal of purchasing two industrial sewing machines to better facilitate her work so she can meet her customers' demands and also generate more jobs in her community. This will increase her earnings and give her family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: 3 De Junio Group

texts.en:
This committee formed with the reunion of various neighbors in the city of Villa Elisa. All of the participants of the committee have developed their own independent business activities, the majority of them in sales. The members form a very stable and organized group, as they have been together for more than two years.

All of the participants of the committee are mothers that work in various fields in order to strengthen their household economies and to develop their businesses in a sustainable way. They hope to experience continuous growth with the help of permanent financial assistance. 

1. Maria Cristina D. -- Small grocery store
2. Lisandra S. -- Food sales
3. Delia M. -- Food sales
4. Adela C. -- Small grocery store
5. Maxima I. -- Dressmaker
6. Pablina G. -- Convenience store
7. Gelicita R. -- Hair salon
8. Norma L. -- General sales
9. Maria Victoria L. -- Fruit sales
10. Laura C. -- Charcoal sales
11. Magda Raquel N. -- Beverage sales
12. Nilda F. -- Fast food sales
13. Sandra N. M. -- Clothing sales
14. Benigna M. -- Cosmetics sales
15. Pelagia C. A. -- Diner
16. Maria C. B. -- Clothing sales
17. Maria Veronica T. -- Fruit sales

loans.use: To be invested in each member’s respective business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is a 48-year-old mother to five children, almost all of whom are already of legal age. She is optimistic about the battle against poverty. She hails from the island village of Kinagatan in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2006 with full of determination to cut the string of poverty that hinders her way to success. She invested her loan in the resale business. For her fifth loan, she proposes the amount of 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her resale business. She will purchase 3 sacks of rice, 3 gallons of cooking oil, and 10 chairs made of bamboo.

She is looking forward to expanding her business and being able to resell in the nearby markets, to be able to let her youngest child finish college, and to have savings for emergency purposes.

loans.use: To buy 3 sacks of rice, 3 gallons of gasoline, and 10 bamboo chairs for her resale business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce K. is a 52-year-old widow with four children. She lives in Mikindani, Mombasa where she owns rental houses. She has been a landlady for two years. She is also a trained counselor and offers her services to residents of Mikindani. This will be Joyce's first loan from KADET. With the money from the loan, she plans refurbish her rental houses and purchase a water pump in order to improve the living conditions and water supply of her tenants. In future she hopes to build better and more decent rental houses for her clients through subsequent loans from KADET. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To refurbish her rental houses and to purchase a water pump

loans.name: United Tamensu Group

texts.en:
Here are Lucy J., Kadiatu B. and Kalima B.. They call their group "United Tamemsu." This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are borrowing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses so that sales and profit will increase. Consequently, their standard of living will also improve. They will be in a better position to look after themselves and children; in terms of feeding, clothing, sending them to school and providing them with medical care incase they fall sick.

Lucy J. is the leader of this group. Lucy is now thirty-two years of age. She is married to a businessman and they have three children. Two of her children are in primary schools and one is still young. Lucy sells cigarettes, matches, mints, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years. With this loan, she will be able to add more items to her cigarette stall.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Fem Viv Group

texts.en:
The “Fem Viv” or “Make me Live” Group is a made of twenty male and female entrepreneurs, half of which are taking out a second loan at this time, the others will be receiving their loan at another time. After successfully repaying their 1st loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their 2nd loan. Their businesses range from food sales, to used clothes and sandals to live animal and meat sales.  Brevilus A. is a representative of the group. He is married with seven children who are between the ages 14 and 3 years old.
Aristid sells and butchers various animals including goats, cows, and pigs. He buys from the more rural areas where the animals can be found at a lower price and he sells in the various surrounding local markets. The 1st loan was a “blessing” according to Aristid because it made paying the school for the five of his children in school easier. He hopes to be able to employ a person to help with the animal transport, he often does by foot, in the near future and to grow his business to a stronger level, enabling him to better support his family.  On behalf of Brevilus, Fe’m Viv, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: animals, rope, shoes, butchering tools

loans.name: Khusen

texts.en:
D. Khusen is 42 years old and married. Thanks to his efforts to get ahead and his positive attitude in the community, he is now a well-known and respected merchant in his area. Previously Khusen had been a farm hand, working in the fields for various people. With his hard work he was able to purchase land and cultivate vegetables such as potato, onion, carrot and etc. His wife sells his harvest at the market and during their activity in this kind of business, his products have become very popular among buyers.

At the same time Khusen raises cattle and sells them. Now Khusen requests a loan so he will be better able to serve his customers and differentiate himself from the competition. He only wants to continue growing his business and to be able to improve the quality of life for his family. With your help, Khusen can get ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing bags for saving his crops and the cattle

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia R. D. R. D. 46 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad junto a su esposo que trabaja como agricultor y sus dos hijos estudiantes. Rosa posee su negocio ubicado  en su domicilio donD. tiene instalado un molino y una pequeña tienda que carece D. variedad D. productos y es por lo cual solicita este crédito, ya que desea surtir su negocio con variedad D. mercadería que le permita generar ventas y ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia R. D. R. is 46 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband, who is a farmer, and their two school-aged children. Rosa manages a business out of her home where she operates a grain mill and runs a small grocery store that carries different products.

She is requesting a loan because she desires to restock her business with a variety of merchandise. This will help her generate sales and income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business with more merchandise

loans.name: Adiya

texts.en: Adiya B. is 46 years old and lives with his mother in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. He and his mother live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. B. operates a consumer products trading business in his town. He sells a variety of household goods out of a stall at the local market. To supplement his income, he also sells items purchased from China, warm hats and scarves, during the fall and winter months. B. started his business in 2000 after previously operating a hat-making business. Since starting his consumer goods business, B. has gained much experience as a businessman and has built a stable operation. For the future, his dream is to own and operate a trading center featuring many different types of businesses. He is requesting a $1400 loan to purchase hats and scarfs to sell this coming winter. Increase inventory means increased revenue for Adiya.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell in winter

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita tiene 56 años, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos y actualmente vive con una de sus hijas.

Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de comida, este negocio lo tiene al frente de su casa, donde cuenta con un pequeño kiosco. Aquí Emerita brinda desayunos, jugos, almuerzo y bebidas, le pareció oportuno este negocio debido a estar ubicada cerca de un mercado y a una empresa petrolera, teniendo como principales consumidores a los trabajadores de dicha empresa.
Para la atención de los clientes tiene el apoyo de su hija y lo que más le gusta es preparar bien los alimentos que ofrece a sus clientes, para que se sientan satisfechos de su buena sazón. 
Para el futuro le gustaría tener un restaurante especializado en platos en base a pollo a la brasa, muy tradicionales en el país y son llamados “pollerías”.

Con MFP ya tiene 3 créditos y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros y compañeras son sinceros, no tienen problemas y sobre todo, se apoyan mucho. Con el dinero que ahora solicita invertirá en la compra de ingredientes y utensilios necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Emerita is 56 years old, single with 3 children and at the present she lives with one of her daughters.

For 6 years she has been selling food, the business is located in front of her house where she has a small stand. Here Emerita offers breakfasts, juices, lunches, and beverages. She thought it was a good business as it is located close to a market and an oil company where the workers are her main customers. Her daughter supports her serving the clients and what she likes the most is to cook the food for her customers to make them feel satisfied because of her good seasoning. For the future she would like to have a restaurant, called "pollerías", which specializes in dishes made with grilled chicken, traditional dishes in the country.

She has had 3 loans with MFP and she likes to work with her community bank as all her partners are sincere, have no problems, and above all, support each other. With the money requested she will invest in buying ingredients and the necessary kitchenware to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Zonorov

texts.en:
B. operates a small boot-making shop in her town with the help of her husband. She worked in a shoe factory for five years and gained much experience and skill in her trade. She specializes in making warm winter boots for herders, so the winter season is especially busy for her. B. started her boot-making business in 2005 and has managed it successfully over the years. She is a very hardworking and open-minded businesswoman and always looks for ways to grow and expand her business. Her success has enabled her to build a house for her family and improve their quality of life.

Zonorov B. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. Her oldest daughter and son, ages 11 and 9, currently attend a local secondary school. Her youngest two sons are both in kindergarten.

B. has many plans for the future. She hopes to soon expand her production line by producing summer work and dress shoes. She hopes diversifying her products will increase her overall sales and stabilize her income throughout the year. As demand continues to increase for her boots, B. needs to expand her production capacity and purchase new machinery. She hopes that one day she will be able to provide quality boots to customers throughout her province. B. is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase two shoe-making machines and different types of leather for her shoe-making business.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase two shoe-making machines and leather

loans.name: Justa Alicia

texts.es:
La Señora Justa Alicia S. P. es trabajadora de una Empresa de transporte y servicios múltiples “terminal Costa atlántica” que se ubica en el mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua, la capital de Nicaragua.
Tiene 5 años de trabajar como cajera en esta empresa.

Ella tiene 32 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos en edad escolar, una niña de 12 años y su hijo menor de 6 años que ahora en Diciembre sale Promocionado de Preescolar. Su esposo trabaja en la Fuerza Naval del Ejército de Nicaragua desde hace 9 años como Jefe de Corbata.
Ella tiene un buen record crediticio en nuestra institución y está agradecida con CEPRODEL, ya que estos préstamos le han permitido invertir en la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Justa Alicia S. P., 32, works for a transportation and multiple services company called "Terminal Costa Atlántica” which is located in Managua's Iván Montenegro market. She has worked as a cashier for this company for five years. She is married and has two, school-age, children; a girl 12, and a son, 6, who this December will graduate from pre-school. Her husband is in the Nicaraguan navy and has been a chief on a corvette for the last 9 years. She has a good credit history with our institution and is grateful to CEPRODEL because these loans have allowed her to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol M. is currently in the business of selling used shoes in a market. She is requesting a loan to stock more new and used shoes to sell.  

Achol is 37 years old and married to a soldier. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more new and used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Victoria Ridina

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Victoria es soltera, tiene 59 años y 6 hijos, Victoria vende comida típica en su casa ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos con la ayuda de su hija.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, papa, carne.
Los sueños de Victoria son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, aumentar y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. She is 59, single, and has six children. Victoria sells typical foods in her house, which is in the center of the city. She does this on Saturdays and Sundays with help from her daughter. Victoria needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy corn, potatoes, and meat. Victoria’s dreams are to educate her children so that they become professionals and to increase and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, potatoes, and meat

loans.name: 24 De Septiembre Group

texts.es: El grupo “”24 de Septiembre” esta representado por la señora Lia y conformado por 11 miembros todos residentes del barrio la cuchilla por lo que se conocen bien y confían unos a otros. Todos los integrantes del grupo tienen sus negocios propios como la venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de pan, empanadas y el transporte publico de pasajeros. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias siempre están en constante cambio de mercadería debido a ella es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento ya que les servirá para el incremento de sus capital de trabajo y para incrementar sus mercaderías de modo que puedan competir en el mercado de la oferta y la demanda; en cuanto a los otros rubros el destino del financiamiento será la adquisición de insumos, herramientas de trabajo y para la reparación de sus vehículos. En su gran mayoría las socias ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad de crédito solidario con instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que saben manejar los fondos otorgados para beneficio e incremento de sus negocios que son el pilar fundamental para el sustento de sus hogares
texts.en:
The September 24th Group is led by Sra. Lia and consists of eleven members who live in the neighborhood of La Cuchilla. They all know each other well and trust one another. All of the members of the group have their own businesses in which they sell food, clothing, cosmetics, bread, and empanadas. One member provides public transportation services. In order to deal with the competitive environment, the members are constantly turning over merchandise. For this reason, they are in need of financing so that they can increase their operating capital and acquire more merchandise which will enable them to compete in the market and keep pace with demand. Other members will use the funding to purchase supplies, acquire equipment, and repair their vehicles. The majority of the members have already participated in solidarity loans with other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They know how to manage their funds in order to benefit and expand their businesses, which are the cornerstones behind maintaining their households.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to six children.  Currently, only one is still in school and the rest are independent. She lives together with her husband and her last child in a family house.  Esi operates a cold store and sells frozen chicken, fishes and meat for the past two years. She procures fresh fishes and chicken from big time cold store operators at the fishing habour at wholesale volumes and retail to her customers. She sells her products to households and food vendors. She seeks the loan to support her business to purchase stock in bulk.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances.

loans.use: To purchase frozen fishes and chicken in bulk.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Mrs. Huon H. and her husband, Mr. Chem Pheap (pictured alone because his wife wasn't available at the time), live in a village located in Battambang Province, where they grow rice and vegetables to sell in the market, earning about 3 or $4 per day. The couple has two children who are going to school and dependent on their parents' income. 

Huon H. works very hard every day to sustain the family and is now asking for a loan of $500 which will enable her to hire a cultivating machine to plow the farmland, on which she plants different types of crops for extra profit.

loans.use: To hire a cultivating machine.

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Bendición de Dios II está conformado por tres exenciónales féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Juana M. V. una señora humilde, esforzada y emprendedora  ella inicio con la venta de cosméticos por que su esposo quien era mayorista y le ayudo a trabajar en este comercio. Esto le ayudo mucho porque empezó a valerse por sí misma y ayudar económicamente en la casa.

Mientras Karla María comercializa accesorios para celular y  la señora Tamara García desde 1993 inicio con un taller de costura y vende cosméticos por catalogo ya sea de Avon, la Zermat y Voget. Ellas invertirán el crédito en la compra de mercaderías para sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The “Bendición de Dios II” group is made up of three wonderful hard working women. One of these women is Juana M. V., a humble, strong and enterprising lady. She began by selling cosmetics because her husband is a wholesaler and could help her work in this business. This helped her a lot because she began to value herself and could contribute to the household finances. Karla María sells cellular phone accessories and, in 1993, Mrs. Tamara García started up a sewing workshop and also sells cosmetics such as Avon, Zermat and Voget from a catalogue. They will use the loan to buy merchandize for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Janeth Jakeline

texts.es:
Janeth V. es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su rica cultura, sus tradiciones, sus iglesias y su Centro Histórico, nuestra socia es una persona alegre y carismática. Tiene como profesión Tecnóloga Medica en rehabilitación respiratoria la  cual ejerce solo cuando se le presenta una emergencia ya que  se dedicó  a la picantería de su madre  de jueves a domingo y el horario depende de la cantidad de pedidos que tenga para entregar. 

Janeth es soltera tiene 40 años de edad  vive con sus padres en su casa  propia donde ayuda económicamente en los gastos del hogar, su papá por su avanzada edad solo ayuda en el cuidado de sus nietos que quedaron huerfanos porque su  madre  falleció  hace ocho años producto de un cáncer y entre los abuelos y la tía buscan sacarlos adelante.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y con el dinero del crédito  va a comprar arroz, azúcar, papas, aceite, etc. para la preparación de su exquisita comida  y un poco para solventar algunos gastos de su casa,  tiene como meta arreglar poco a poco  la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Janeth is a member of the Yanuncay communal bank and lives in the suburbs of the city of Cuenca. This city is characterized by its rich culture, its traditions, its churches, and its historical center. Our associate is a happy charismatic person. She is a respiratory medical technician by profession, but is called upon only during emergencies, since she has dedicated herself to taking care of her mother's errands and other needs from Thursdays to Sundays and her schedule depends on how many request she must fill. Janeth is single. She is 40 years old and lives with her parents in their home, whom she helps with the household expenses. Her father, because of his age, is only able to help with the care of his grandchildren. They were orphaned when their mother passed away eight years ago due to cancer. She and their grandparents do everything they can to help them get ahead. She is in her second cycle and she will use the money from this loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc, in order to prepare delicious food and also use a bit of the money to pay some household expenses. Her goal is to fix up her parents' home little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old single man living with his two parents. In 2008, he opened an internet café and an amusement center where he receives the village guys who come to have a nice time in his shop. He opened this kind of business after seeing a need for such services in the region. And his plan was good, because his new business has a good demand from his clients. 

Today, Mahmoud is asking to borrow $1,000 to ameliorate his business level and bring new games to attract more clients.

loans.use: To buy new games

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es:
Juan Enrique Z. es una persona humilde y trabajadora que con esfuerzo propio ha logrado salir adelante junto a su familia donde él es el sostén del hogar y que gracias a su actividad de productor ganadero ha sabido darle una educación a sus hijos ya que el solo logro llegar hasta segundo grado de primaria.
Este crédito es para la compra de vacas paridas y así el poder aumentar su hato ganadero y su producción de leche la cual el vende y con esto darle mayor seguridad a su familia
texts.en:
Juan Enrique Z. es una persona humilde y trabajadora que con esfuerzo propio ha logrado salir adelante junto a su familia donde él es el sostén del hogar y que gracias a su actividad de productor ganadero ha sabido darle una educación a sus hijos ya que el solo logro llegar hasta segundo grado de primaria. Este crédito es para la compra de vacas paridas y así el poder aumentar su hato ganadero y su producción de leche la cual el vende y con esto darle mayor seguridad a su familia

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de 3 vacas paridas

loans.name: Agne Lissethe

texts.es: Agne es una joven emprendedora, de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de siete años, su negocio es una pulpería que logro poner hace varios años, inicio este negocio con la venta de pan, café, golosinas hasta que logro captar cliente y comenzó a invertir. Vive junto con su mama quien la ha  apoyado siempre, su meta es lograr mejorar la vivienda ya que aun le falta el repello a las paredes y las divisiones a si como embaldosar para una mejor higiene en su hogar como dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con este préstamo invertirá en productos de consumo diario como: pollo, carne, huevo, queso, granos básicos, productos enlatados, golosinas, gaseosas para hacer más competitivo su negocio. Lo que mas desea en un futuro es poder hacerla en distribuidora e ir ahorrando para hacer su propia casa.
texts.en:
Agne, 30, is a young entrepreneur; she is a single mother of a 7-year-old son. She set up a grocery store several years ago selling bread, coffee and snacks; once she started to acquire regular customers she started to invest more in it. She lives with her mother who has always supported her efforts; her goal is to improve their dwelling because the exterior and interior walls are still unsealed and the floors need to be tiled for better hygiene in the home and to provide better customer service. She will use this loan to buy stock merchandise items like: chicken, meat, eggs, cheese, basic grains, canned goods, snacks and soft-drinks in order to be more competitive. What she most desires for the future is to convert her store into a distribution site and to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, snacks, meat, chicken and canned goods.

loans.name: Kron

texts.en:
Mrs. Kron N. is 59 years old and lives in Chrak Chi Koam village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phorn Phum, are farmers who own two hectares of land on which they cultivate rice.

In support of this farm, Mrs. Kron N. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her field. 

This couple has three children; two are workers in the casino club while the youngest one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her field

loans.name: Saidati

texts.en:
Saidati is 56 years old, married, with 5 children who are between 11 and 25 years old.  Saidati is commonly known in the business of selling women's clothes and the hours of her business are from 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Although Saidati has spent a long time in this business, her capital is still too low to allow her to expand meaningfully.  To put an end to this situation, Saidati needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  This loan will hopefully allow her to increase her sales as well as profits.  With these profits, Saidati will continue paying the school fees of her children and providing enough food for them.  In addition, she will start saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: buying additional women's clothing for sale

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly F. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 2, Brgy. Inayaun, Cauayan , Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a carinderia (mini-restaurant) and a general store. 

Her husband Napoleon, who is 62 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who range in age from 19 to 38 years old. 

Melly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,000 PHP, thus bettering the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th loan cycle, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase fresh meat and vegetable for her fast-food eatery so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her youngest child's schooling. Melly F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchasing fresh meat and vegetables for mini-restaurant

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco L. is from the village of Resthouse, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 48 years old. Francisco is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Francisco owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as sardines, eggs, cooking oil, vinegar, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Francisco joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Francisco from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es: Salvadora tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, con mucho esfuerzo esta señora ha logrado tener su propio medio de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, es una persona muy responsable y se encuentra muy contenta de hablar con sus clientes pues todos los días se siente bendecida por tener los clientes que tiene en la actualidad, ya que con el paso del tiempo ha obtenido la experiencia requerida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como faldas, pantalones, camisetas y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Salvadora has worked hard to make her way in life. She has one son and is a very responsible person. For more than 2 years she has sold new and used clothing and she truly enjoys talking with her customers. Every day she feels blessed to have such great customers and to have developed the experience necessary to work with them. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise such as skirts, trousers, t-shirts, and underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tutungukye Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
Very hard working, M. Moses has been operating an agro-produce sales business from Omukagyera, Ibanda for a period of 10 years. With nostalgia, this happily married father of two children recalls how his business basked in high profit returns at its onset. Times have changed, however, as the business now is in diminishing returns, earning him 150,000 Ugandan shillings in sharp contrast to previous earnings due to seasonal changes.

Moses is no exception herein in terms of doing business. What he is looking forward to now is the prospect of enhancing his business by buying fertilizer and improving the production of beans and maize which he grows most. He has other income generating activities like a bar and a butcher shop. With this loan, he will improve his production and can afford business expansion. His revenue will increase and also he can make himself more able to meet his day-to-day life and family necessities.

loans.use: buying fertilizers to improve production

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: El Sr. Juan José N. C.   él  se desempeña  como Conserje en el Colegio público “CERMA”, tiene  tres años de trabajar para esta institución, tiene dos niños en edad escolar, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan José N. C. has been employed as a caretaker at “CERMA” Public School for three years. He’s married and has two school age children. He has had three CEPRODEL loans that he’s used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit to him in that they have improved his and his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For zinc metal sheeting and tubing and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Revelita

texts.en:
Revelita I. is from the village of Flores. She is 55 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Revelita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Revelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Revelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Revelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Revelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Morenica Del Rocío

texts.es:
La Señora. Morenica T. es socia del banco comunal Eugenio Espejo, vive en la comunidad de Narancay Bajo a unos 10 minutos  de la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, muchos encuentran en la ciudad un trabajo en fábricas, construcción etc., también han migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo.

Nuestra socia tiene 35 años, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y estudia en la universidad, su segundo hijo está en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en la escuela, con su trabajo y sacrificio ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Morenica trabaja hace 7 meses como niñera, labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. En su casa tiene un pequeño kiosco el mismo que atiende desde las cinco y media del día hasta las nueve de la noche, cuando se encuentra en el trabajo sus hijos le ayudan a la atención, los fines de semana se dedica a la preparación de comida rápida.

Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de gaseosas, cervezas, confitería etc. para su kiosco.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Morenica is a member of the Eugenio Espejo communal bank and lives in the community of Narancay Bajo, some 10 minutes from the city of Cuenca. Here people practice agriculture and raise livestock.  Many are in the city now, working in factories, at construction, etc.  Or they have migrated to various places around the world in search of better opportunities for work.
