Her 1st son works and also studies in the university; her 2nd son is still in school, and her last son is also in school.  With her work and sacrifice, Morenica has managed to build her own house.

Morenica has worked for the last 7 months as a nanny, working from Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule.  In her house she has a small kiosk that she attends from 5:30pm until 9:00 at night.  While she is at work, her children attend to customers.  On weekends, she prepares fast food.

This is her 3rd loan from her communal bank, and she will use it to buy soft drinks, beer, sweets, etc., for her kiosk.

Morenica's goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: BUYING SOFT DRINKS, BEER, CANDY, ETC, FOR HER KIOSK

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing: blouses, t-shirts, skirts, and men's shorts

loans.name: Nouhoum

texts.fr:
Âgé de 35 ans, Monsieur Nouhoum D. est marié et père de 4 enfants (2garçons et 2 filles). Il réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers péripheriques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et forgeron de catégorie sociale, il s’est vite initié à cette activité familiale depuis très jeune à savoir celle de la forge. Il achète l’aluminium à Bamako pour les transformer en objets de toutes sortes (Marmites, théières, assiettes, cuillères, etc).
Nanti d’une grande expérience et d’une bonne notoriété, il fait l’objet d’une sollicitation sans pareille des clients compte tenu de la qualité de ses services. Aujourd’hui, compte tenu de peu de moyens dont il dispose, il se voit incapable de satisfaire la demande qui est de plus en plus forte. Ainsi, il intégra l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’un an, il a bénéficié d’un premier prêt très bien remboursé. C’est donc dans le cadre de toujours mieux relancer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter qu’il sollicite un deuxième prêt pour acheter, 950kg d’aluminium et quelques matériels supplémentaires.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA. Les bénéfices qu’il générera de l’exercice de cette activité lui permettront de rembourser son prêt et faire face aux besoins de sa famille, ensuite investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
35 years of age, Mr. Nouhoum D. is married and the father of four (two boys and two girls). He lives in a traditional large extended family in Hamdallaye, a peripheral area of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative district of Mali).

Not having had the chance to attend school and coming from a family of blacksmiths, he quickly learned this family trade early on and became a blacksmith as well. He purchases aluminum in Bamako in order to make various objects out of it (pots, tea kettles, plates, spoons etc).
With his long experience and good business reputation, he is very much in demand as clients appreciate the high quality of his service. At present, given his limited means, he is unable to satisfy the growing customer demand. He joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution  over a year ago and already obtained a loan, perfectly repaid.  And so, in order to continue growing his business and better satisfy the growing demand, he is seeking a second loan to purchase 950 kg [approx. 2100 lbs] of aluminum and some additional materials.

With this loan, he plans to achieve a monthly revenue of 300,000 West African Francs. The revenues from this activity will allow him to repay his loan and provide for his family’s needs as well as reinvest the remaining funds into this business.

loans.use: Purchasing aluminum and additional materials

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en:
Rasheeda lives in a small city called Kot Radha Kishan which is located in Punjab Pakistan and famous for its agriculture and dairy industry. She lives there in a 2 room brick house with her family in the area named Kot Mianiaan. She came here after her marriage many years ago. She is 52 years old married to N. D.. They  have 2 sons. Due to financial reasons she is unable to educate her children. Both sons are in their teens and don't work.  

Her husband has a business selling hair oil. He has a small shop in the market. He not only sells hair oil from his shop but also supplies different hair salons and other shops by taking orders from them. He has been doing this business for the past 8 years and is the only breadwinner in the family. 

Rasheeda herself is a housewife, stays at home and does her household works.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy hair oil in large quantity for reselling. This will help him fulfill larger orders on time and generate more sales.  Rasheeda is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position which will result in better financial conditions of her family. 

She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has built a good credit history and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy hair oil for reselling

loans.name: Raineria

texts.en:
Raineria P. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Raineria is separated from her spouse and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Raineria owns & operates a business butchering and selling pork in the market. She is also engaging in a pork & chicken kebab (or a la cart) business. Raineria has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Raineria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Raineria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Raineria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Raineria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba M. is from the village of Rizal West San Isidro. She is 39 years old. Melba is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Melba owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melba has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Melba joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melba has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melba is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Melba from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes F. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Pangobilian, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a food market business.  Her husband Carlos, who is 58 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 30 to 34 years old. Lourdes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lourdes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 17,000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to buy meat and vegetables for her food market so she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Lourdes F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operation of her food market

loans.name: Jessica Milagros

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 25 años de edad, soltera, vive en casa de sus padres.  Ella y su familia residen en Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a elaborar artesanía.  La cliente cuenta que realiza esta actividad desde que tenía 10 años de edad, y por F. los pedidos se incrementan.  Con la trayectoria que tiene en la elaboración de estos productos, en la actualidad cuenta con una clientela fidelizada que desea obtener cada vez más productos de diferentes diseños.

Jessica necesita comprar insumos para elaborar más artesanias para después comercializarlos y satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene en la actualidad.  Es por ello que ha creido conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1600 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa, el cual sería el segundo crédito en la institución.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 25-year-old single woman who lives with her parents. She and her family live in Chiclayo, the capital city of the department of Lambayeque.

She works making handicrafts. Her customers say that she has been doing this work since she was ten years old. Around holidays, the number of orders increases. Given her long career making these products, she currently has a loyal group of customers. These customers always want more new products with different designs.

Jessica needs to purchase materials in order to make more handicrafts in order to then sell them and satisfy the large demand she is experiencing. This is why she has requested a loan of 1,600 Peruvian nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa. This will be her second loan through this institution.

loans.use: Purchase of materials in order to make more handicrafts.

loans.name: Maria Emiliana

texts.es: La señorita María Emiliana G. G. se dedica a la actividad de venta de zapatos y sandalias tiene un puesto ubicado en la calle Independencia Ica su local es alquilado hace varios años. La solicitante es soltera no tiene carga familiar le ayuda con los gastos familiares a sus padres, está solicitando el crédito para comprar mercadería para la campaña escolar , se propone otorgarle el crédito ya que tiene experiencia acrediticia con otro entidades bancarias la cual está pagando puntualmente.
texts.en: María Emiliana G. G. sells shoes and slippers from a rented location on Independencia Street.  She is single with no family obligations, but helps her parents with the family expenses.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy merchandise for the coming school year.  We propose granting her the loan because she has a good credit history and she has always made her payments on time.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, who is 44-years old and married, supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a farming enterprise. A resident of Narra, Palawan, Nida has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable, and now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000.

Nida is requesting her second loan for PHP 10,000 to purchase more stocks to sell. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
For over seven years, Mwanasha has been selling cloth materials, bed sheets, and khangas (fabric for traditional wrap-around dresses) from door to door. She started the business to have a form of employment and income for the family. She sells to her local neighbours and passersby. Mwanasha faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation of materials to her place of operation. 

With this loan, she will purchase bed sheets, khangas and second-hand clothes to increase her inventory of products to sell and so increase her earnings. Her dream is to be able to establish a shop to sell her products.

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets, fabrics, and second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dolores Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 15 y  13 años de edad que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es taxista.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y joyería de plata, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja sola todos los días más que todo por las mañanas ya que sus hijos estudian a esa hora y es cuando aprovecha para realizar sus ventas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. La ropa compra en Guayaquil y las joyas le envían desde Cuenca.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, cadenas, pulseras, aretes, entre otras prendas. Ella fue unas de las fundadoras del banco pero luego se retiro y regreso en este ciclo y espera quedarse mucho tiempo.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the Circunvalación [ring road] area of the city of Manta, the Nuevo Proyecto [New Project] communal bank meets every two weeks. The city of Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists during all seasons of the year. On the shores of the Pacific Ocean, it is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas. 

In this place, we meet Dolores, who is 39 years old and married. She and her husband have two children, aged 15 and 13, who are in secondary school. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Dolores works in retail trade, selling clothing and silver jewelry. She sells her merchandise door to door, and she also sells from her home, where she has a little store. She works alone every day, above all in the mornings, since her children are in school at that time, and she takes advantage of this to carry out her sales. She offers credit to her customers and collects payments each week. She buys the clothing in Guayaquil, and the jewelry is sent to her from Cuenca.

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, blouses, necklaces, bracelets, and earrings, among other articles. Dolores was one of the bank's founders, but later she left it; she has returned for this loan cycle and hopes to remain for a long time. 

Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, necklaces, bracelets, earrings, etc.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 25 years and is single. Jerome sells cooking oil, water, tomato source, juice, cassava flour, rice etc. His business is well- organized. He is open from 5am until 8pm every day and has five year's of experience in his business.

Jerome has requested a loan from kiva lenders in order to purchase more goods. With this profits, Jerome will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as cooking oil, tomato souce, water, juice etc.

loans.name: Cielo De Jesús

texts.es:
Después de sufrir la muerte de su único hijo, Cielo de Jesús O. A. de 60 años decidió seguir adelante y luchar por solventarse, pues su hijo era el que se hacía cargo de los gastos del hogar. 

Cielo dice todavía con una expresión de tristeza en el rostro que los golpes de la vida son los que también impulsan a seguir adelante, pues ahora su legumbrería es su única fuente de ingresos y es la que le permite mantenerse en pie. 

Actualmente, Cielo necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido, específicamente en artículos de la canasta familiar y legumbres, así incrementará su inventario y logrará incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
After suffering the death of her only child, Cielo de Jesús O. A., aged 60, decided to forge ahead and struggle to support herself, since her son was the one who supported the household. 

Cielo says, still with a look of sadness on her face, that the blows that life has given her have also driven her to keep on going. Now her vegetable store is her only source of income that lets her keep on standing. 

At present, Cielo needs a loan to buy a variety of products, specifically, items for the family shopping basket and vegetables. In this way, she will increase her inventory and her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables and family shopping basket products

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: La señora Lupe tiene unas habitaciones las cuales las alquila y genera ingresos; su esposo es empleado público. El crédito lo requiere para comprar: material de construcción ya que construirá una nueva habitación en obra fina. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Sopocahi en la ciudad de La Paz;  es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006, con un excelente historial de pagos.
texts.en: Lupe has some rooms that she rents out for a profit. Her husband is a public employee. She needs the loan to buy: construction materials as she will be building a new room to a high standard. She lives in her own house which is in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz. She is married and has 5 children. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2006, and she has an excellent repayment history.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for a new room in her home.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Lory works hard to support her family. She has a recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling soft drinks. Lory is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy recycled materials to sell in volume for her recycled materials business.

Lory has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to sell in volume.

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 4  est composé de femmes mariées du village de MORIBILA KAFONO dans l’ex cercle de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
HAWA, debout au milieu, compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, au grand marché de Kimparana ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail , au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 45 000 à 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: The group BENKADI 4 is composed of married women from the village of MORIBILA KAFONO, in the Cercle of SAN, Region of SÉGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women live in traditional families, and they average 40 years of age and at least six children each. The group members grow peanuts. Concerned about making their plantations profitable, they decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After properly repaying the previous loans, they are now on their fourth farm loan. HAWA, standing in the middle in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, sundry supplies and equipment, and inputs for farming. These items are purchased at the main market of Kimparana City. Following the off-season, the harvested crops are stocked for a certain time, so that they gain value, and then are sold at the retail level and for cash at the main market of Kimparana and at surrounding markets. The customers generally come from large cities. After selling their produce, the group members each plan on making a profit of 45,000 to 70,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan interest and to cover typical family expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and tools

loans.name: Susana Celia

texts.es:
Susana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco” ubicado en Centro Poblado Sanquira, distrito de Yunguyo, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo.  Cuenta con estudios de primaria.
Trabaja con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace dos años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales caseros.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de granos de la Región como chuño, habas y quinua.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprará ocho arrobas de chuño, nos cuenta que lo compra en Bolivia y lo vende en Yunguyo. En el negocio la ayuda su esposo, quien también trabaja en construcción civil.
Su sueño es mejorar y seguir con el mismo negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, el ahorro y sus ganancias.
texts.en: Susana is a member of the "San Juan de Tahuaco" community bank in Sanquira, district and province of Yunguyo, department of Puno, Peru. She is 26 years old, married and has a son. She has an elementary-school education. She has worked with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past two years. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to invest in her business selling pets. Currently, she makes a living selling regional grains, such as potato flour, beans and quinoa. With this new loan of 500 soles, she plans to buy eight large sacks of potato flour. She tells us that she buys the product in Bolivia and sells it in Yunguyo. Her husband helps her with the business and also works in construction. Susana's biggest dream is to improve and continue with her business. She likes her community bank for the meetings, the savings and her profits.

loans.use: to purchase eight large sacks of potato flour.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 31 years old and has two school aged children. 

She is a farmer working in the Philippines and she earns PHP 8,000 per month. Myrna grows rice at their farm and has been doing it for almost six years.

Myrna is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase the needed agricultural inputs like fertilizers and pesticides. 

In the future, Myrna hopes to have a plenty of harvest in order to have more income to be used in financing the education of their children and satisfying their daily basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs like fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goods for her store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a seamstress who is married to a farmer as well as a teacher at Elmina. Ama has a child. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy materials, zippers, buttons and others to make clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials, zippers, buttons and others to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gangragchaa

texts.en:
Gangragchaa, who is 30 years old, lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hentii Province, Mongolia. His one son attends kindergarden, while the younger one does not yet go to school.

Gangragchaa purchases wool from the countryside, reselling it at the town market, a business he started with his brother in 2009. Having gained much experience, he now owns a truck and sells the wool privately. He purchases one kilogram of wool at the price of 500 MNT and sells at 780 MNT. His business turnover capital is 2,400,000 MNT, and his monthly sales amount to 4,000,000 MNT.

An energetic and responsible man who says, "My business is my sole source of income and finance and I want to expand it, own my own land and build my own house,"Gangragchaa is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more wool to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more wool.

loans.name: Cenobia

texts.es: Cenobia tiene 66 años, está casada con Miguel D. 66 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito D. Pichari. Cenobia, es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, cuyas características heredó D. sus padres. el negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. productos hecho D. plásticos como: platos descartables, baldes, bolsas D. toda medida y tinas. En un inicio no le fue bien en este negocio, pues aún no contaba con mucha clientela, pero poco a poco logró ganarse comprarse. Hoy es muy conocida, y siempre tiene salida D. sus productos. Ella no se dedica sola en este oficio, pues su esposo e hijos la ayudan en la atención y venta. En un futuro próximo desea ampliar su tienda para exhibir más productos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ratifica una vez más su compromiso D. pago puntualmente. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprará más productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Cenobia is 66 years old.  She is married to Miguel, aged 66, with whom she has six children.  They live together in their own house, which is located in the district of Pichari.

Cenobia is a responsible and hard-working woman, characteristics that she inherited from her parents.  The business she works in is selling products maD. from plastic, such as disposable plates, buckets, bags of every size, and tubs.  At the beginning, things didn't go too well with this business and she didn't have many customers.  However, bit by bit, she managed to gain them.  Today she is very well-known and always sells out of her products.  She doesn't work alone in this, as her husband and children help her with service and sales.

In the near future, she wants to grow her store to show more products.  This is her second loan with MFP, and she again makes her promise to pay punctually.  With the 3,000 Soles she is asking for, she will buy more products for stocking up her store.

loans.use: to buy more plastic products.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina works hard to support six children. She is married and has a business growing and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Evelina requested a loan of 3,100 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Evelina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Víctor Jhonny

texts.es:
Víctor Jhonny tiene 29 años, vive en Union Libre vive con la compañera y los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos de seis, y cuatro años de edad.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Víctor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para  la compra de semillas, insumos fertilizantes , urea, abonos, veneno para la maleza  para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. 
Su sueño es comprarse una casa nueva y superarse.

Le gusta hacer deporte en especial practicar el ciclismo y el indor.
texts.en:
Víctor Jhonny is 29 years old. He lives with his partner and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province. He has two children of 6 and 4 years of age. 
The 'San José de los Amarillos' community bank is located in Amarillos community, in Ventanas canton. The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice. 
Víctor is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys his products in the Murillo shopping area and sells his products in the same place. 
Víctor is requesting this loan to buy seeds, various fertilizers, and weedkiller for his crops. The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs. He faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant diseases, and changes in the weather. 
His dream is to own a new house and to get ahead. 
Víctor likes to play sport, particularly indoor soccer and cycling.

loans.use: to buy seeds, various fertilizers, urea, abonos, and weedkiller.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married and has one child. She sells cloth and utensils at Elmina, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is a welder. Beatrice assists her partner to take good care of their home. She will use the loan to purchase more utensils to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Afzaala's Group

texts.en:
Afzaala is a 43-year-old married woman. Her husband has a job, but his income is not enough to afford the living expenses of the whole family so he also does clothes sewing work and is a tailor master. Afzaala also does clothes sewing work at her home. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders every month. Afzaala is the mother of three daughters, all of whom are studying as well as learning the art of embroidery. They are earning from their skills and contributing to the family financially. 

Afzaala has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy a new sewing machine. He will also hire a worker, which will allow him to finish the client orders on time and increase his sales and profits. Eid (a Muslim occasion) is coming and Afzaala is very confident that her husband will be able to earn great profits at Eid by making an investment in his business. He has been operating his business for the past fifteen years and Afzaala is very confident about his success.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine for tailoring business.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is married and has five siblings. She is 57 years old and lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Luzminda owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting crops to earn a living. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more fertilizer for their farm. Luzminda has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for almost a year. In the future, she plans to buy a lot in order to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La socia Maritza continua con su negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, la socia compra al por mayor materiales para construir como cemento, arenas, ormigon, ladrillos, piedras, cascajo entre muchos otros materiales, la socia tiene 8 años en este negocio, ella desea seguir creciendo y tiene ya sus contratas de materiales ella es muy cotizada en la zona y desea en esta ocación invertir el prestamo para amortizar la compra de materiales que le llegan en camión en la siguiente semana, ella cuanta con un monto y requiere para aumentar a su capital de trabajo el prestamo requerido. Ls socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, ormigon, arena, ladrillos. la socia desea en un futuro cercano poder jubilarse y seguir con la compra y venta de materiales porque ya le gusto el negocio y no quiere fallar a sus clientes.
texts.en: Maritza continues with her business selling building materials and supplies.  She buys building materials like cement, sand, concrete, bricks, stone and gravel, among many others at wholesale.  She’s been in this business 8 years and wants to continue growing.  She already has contracts for materials.  She’s highly sought after in the zone and wants on this occasion to invest the loan to pay off the delivery of materials that will arrive by truck next week.  She has a certain amount available but needs to increase her working capital with the required loan.  She is requesting the loan to invest in building materials like cement, concrete, sand and bricks.  In the near future, she’d like to retire and continue with the building supplies business because she’s gotten to like the business and does not want to fail her customers.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 35-year-old married woman. She has no children. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan, for two and a half years. 

Joice has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish for sale. She will use the extra income to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Kotognontala  L’Entente Group

texts.fr:
KOTOGNONTALA est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les condiments de toutes sortes, habillements et propriétaire d’un salon de coiffure. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Korotoumou est un membre du groupe KOTOGNONTALA, accroupi  à gauche  habillée en wax jaune raillé de noir. Elle fait la coiffure et la vente de mèche de toute sorte elle est très sollicitée car elle a du tallent pour son activité. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  15 cartons de mèches  à Bamako. Elle à son salon de coiffure en face du marché de Hamdallaye. Sa clientèle est exclusivement constituée de femmes. 
Tandis que les membres du groupe KOTOGNONTALA comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Korotoumou  compte réaliser 160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares. 
NB : Ténin  est en voyages pour des funérailles au moment de la prise de la photo donc est absente de la photo
texts.en:
Kotognontala is a group of women from Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 35 years of age, are married and have at least four children each. This group of women trade in a variety of products, including all types of condiment and clothing, and one of them is the owner of a hairdressing salon. In order to grow their businesses, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program two years ago. They are now on their third group loan and all the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Korotoumou is a member of the Kotognontala group, crouching on the left of the photo and dressed in a yellow dress with black stripes. She is a hairdresser and sells all sorts of hair extensions; she is in great demand since she is very talented at her job. She is planning to use her loan to buy 15 cartons of hair extensions at Bamako. She has her hairdressing salon opposite Hamdallaye market. Her customer base is exclusively female. 

While the other members of the Kotognontala group are expecting to make an average profit of 140,000FCFA during the course of this loan cycle, Korotoumou is expecting to make 160,000FCFA. They are going to use part of their income to repay their loans and part to cover their household expenses. They would like to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they can have sufficient stocks.

N.B. Ténin had gone away for a funeral at the moment the photo was taken so is not in it.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana   tiene como actividad la venta de fruta en diferentes ferias y mercados de la ciudad de El Alto,  esta  actividad la desarrolla todos los días de la semana, ella es una persona  muy trabajadora, su familia esta compuesta por su esposo, quien también trabaja como maestro constructor en diferentes lugares y sus seis hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, la Sra. Juana y su esposo trabajan duro para la manutención de sus hijos,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción para la ampliación de su vivienda con la compra materiales de construcción para así de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia, brindándoles comodidad.
texts.en: Juana has a business selling fruit in different markets in the city of El Alto.  She is a very  hardworking person who works in this business every day of the week.  Her family is made up of her husband, who works as a master builder at different work sites, and 6 children who are all school-aged.  Juana and her husband work hard to support their children.  She will use this loan to buy construction materials that will be used to expand her house.  With the purchase of these construction materials, Juana will be able to improve her family's quality of life by providing them with greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to expand her house

loans.name: Rahana

texts.en:
Rahana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Rahana has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from dried fish vending.

Rahana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to buy farmland in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Carlos tiene 31 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de  la cual tiene dos hijos, él nació en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Carlos se dedica hacer mantenimiento de carros. En esta oportunidad Carlos requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea desea comprar ropa y alimentación para sus hijos y otras cosas que necesita en su casa.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) community bank is made up of responsible and hard-working people who provide for their families.  Most of the members live in the city of Cusco and this is where they carry out their business activities.  Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world - Machu Picchu.

Carlos is 31 years old and lives with his common-law wife.  The couple have two children.  Carlos was born in Cusco province, in Cusco department.  He lives in the beautiful city in which he was born.  Carlos works as a car mechanic.  On this occasion, he needs a loan for personal use, to buy clothes and food for his children and other things that they need at home.

loans.use: to buy clothes and food for his children

loans.name: Nora Anabel

texts.es: Nora Anabel  de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su tío y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de fruta y verdura, tomates, cebollas, chiles, plátanos, en el mercado municipal de la zona, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, tiene mucha clientela pues vende la mercadería mas fresca, de calidad y a los mejores precios, además el servicio es el mejor Nora se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad; es una mujer soñadora, dedicada a su trabajo siempre está a la expectativa de las oportunidades que lo lleven a triunfar en un futuro más próspero; desde hace algún tiempo Nora quiere hacer crecer el negocio,  invirtiendo más en insumos pero no posee del capital suficiente, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar fruta y verdura por mayor. Nora Anabel es muy responsable, honesta, con una moral intachable y tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá cancelar el financiamiento y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: fruta y verdura por mayor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: In Maria’s shop at Toamua you can find pork cakes, German buns and doughnuts. Her family size is really big and by having a shop she is able to satisfy their needs and wants. A hundred tala profit is made weekly and is used to buy more stock for the shop, and of course for her SPBD loan repayments. Maria also manages to save some money which she can turn to in times of great financial need.

loans.use: To purchase cement, canned fish, canned beef, sodas, gas stove, etc.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is living with her husband because she got married a few months ago. Her husband has a gas shop. His wife took her 4th cycle group loan and her husband bought new canisters of gas and attracted a lot of clients. He hopes that he can expand this business more and so his wife wants to take anther loan so that her husband can enlarge his shop and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy new canisters of gas

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long P. is a 54 year-old widow and mother of five children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She sells roast beef along the road side in her community where she generates around $6/day in revenue. Two of her children work as security guards, and their salaries provide income for the family.  The rest of her children are married and live with their own families. In order to maximize her income and to meet her clients' needs, Long P. needs more untensils, beef, and some equipment for her booth.  She is requesting the loan to help her buy these items.

loans.use: Needs more utensils, beef and new some equipment to meet her clients needs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan, 48 years old, and his wife, 47, were married 11 years ago and have a 12-year-old son who is studying in the 6th grade of primary school.

Juan works selling goods of many kinds but primarily sells furniture. He started working thirty years ago selling bags and did this until he could earn the capital to start a business selling furniture. With time he was able to purchase 2 trucks and 2 motorcycles that today help him with his daily work. Juan said with pride that, although he could only study until the 6th grade, today he is a successful merchant who makes a good income and can support his family with his sales.

With this loan Juan hopes to be able to buy more merchandise in order to meet the demand of his customers, and to further expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture, mattresses, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir P. is married and has an 8-year-old son. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine, where Vladimir works as a taxi driver. He has been in business for 8 years, and this is the only source of income for his family. His current daily income is about $30-40. Vladimir’s father, who is retired from his previous work, is actively helping his son with the business – both father and son work together as taxi drivers.

Vladimir wants to install liquefied gas equipment in his car to reduce his running costs, which is why he is requesting a loan of $1200. Vladimir willingly works day and night because he understands that he is the head of his family and the only breadwinner. He likes his job and having financial independence and believes that private entrepreneurship is by far a better option then working as a hired employee. Vladimir is planning to invest his profits into remodeling his home, where he has just finished some construction work.

loans.use: To modify fuel system for taxi

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.en: Abdukarim A. has been an active client of Microinvest since 2004.  Abdukarim lives in Mastchoh, Tajikstan and is married  with three children. The main direction of his private business are commercial sales in the bazaar  Having many interesting ideas for new business ventures requires a loan to support the future of his children, who would like to continue working  in the family business.

loans.use: to ensure the future of his children

loans.name: Teodomira's Group

texts.en:
Teodomira, Alicia, and Rafhael are members of the community bank “Palmeras”.  They have been members for 12, 12, and 1 year respectively.
In their community bank they have learned to be better business people by saving and being punctual.  Their bank has also taught them about solidarity and working together. Alicia told us that going to the meetings and completing the tasks gives her a sense of accomplishment and dignity.  
Teodomira is 60 years old and has three children.  She sells meat which she has done all of her life. She learned this business from her parents.  
Alicia is 42 years old and has four daughters aged 12, 10, 6, and 3.  She sells grocery items at various open-air markets.  She did not finish school and started this business out of necessity.  She hopes that her children will not have to work so hard.  
On the other hand Rapfael has two children.  He rents traditional clothing for use in folkloric dances and festivals.  He learned how to make clothing from his mother who is a respected artisan.  Before starting his business he worked for a bigger company, but is much happier being his own boss.
Teodomira, Alicia, and Rafhael need loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, 1400 soles, respectively to expand their business.  Teodomira needs to buy cows, chickens and other live animals.  Alicia hopes to expand her business by buying beans, rice, and sugar.  Rafhael wants to buy raw materials such as cloth, and thread as well as traditional hats in order to prepare for the up coming carnival.
Their dreams are all that their children can be professionals and not have to work in the conditions that their parents had to.

loans.use: Teodomira, Alicia, and Rafhael need loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, 1400 soles, respectively to expand their business.  Teodomira needs to buy cows, chickens and other live animals.  Alicia hopes to expand her business by buying beans, rice, and sugar.  Rafhael wants to buy raw materials such as cloth, and thread as well as traditional hats in order to prepare for the up coming carnival.

loans.name: Awa Yombe

texts.en: Madame D. has requested a loan to buy products to replenish and expand her small boutique. She sells a variety of products and now she would like to supply goods that are being more demanded. For the moment she would like to buy shoes, clothing, perfume, body creams, etc. Awa Yombe has been a good client of Caurie's for several years and already paied back another loan. Madame D. uses profits from her business to enrich the family and home environment and pay for school fees. This loan is for 6months with 1 payment made at the end of the loan.

loans.use: Funds to replenish and grow her boutique's business.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en: Sabira is from Kaćuni, a small place near Busovača. She was born in 1964 and has a 23 year old child.  Her husband does season work and he can earn about 200 KM monthly. They are doing agriculture, too. When her husband does not have a job, they sell milk and milk products. Sabira took this loan in the amount of 1000 KM and she is going to invest in buying stock and animal nutrition. Her intention is to expand her business and enlarge the number of poultry.

loans.use: Buying a stock and animal nutrition.

loans.name: Šemsa

texts.en: Šemsa, born in 1965, has two children, ages 11 and 12.  Her husband receives a monthly pension of 280,00KM, and the provision of nursing care earns the family an additional 500,00KM per month. In order to increase household income and expand the products she offers, Šemsa is requesting a loan of $500 to buy new column molds to produce a variety of decorating forms.

loans.use: To buy column molds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improvements to his business location.

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es:
My name is Marta Isabel G. Hernández, and I am a businesswoman. I started my business more than 10 years ago, selling children’s clothing in street markets in the towns around San Pedro Sacatepèquez where I live. My husband worked alongside me in the business, but as we have six children, we didn’t earn enough money just doing that. After a lot of effort, we managed to rent a stall in the market, and for the last year I have been selling frequently used products. I am asking for a loan so that I can invest in products that the customers demand and that I need to stock so as to increase my customer base. I am very happy as I have gradually seen my business grow. However, my dream is to finish paying for the market stall so that it is finally mine. Then I can enlarge it, and with the income from that, I can provide better education for my children--of the six, only 2 are in school--but I want all of them to go to school and do well.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Soy Marta Isabel G. Hernández, soy comerciante. Inicie mi negocio vendiendo ropa para niños desde hace màs de 10 años, de forma ambulante en diferentes pueblos cercanos a San Pedro Sacatepèquez que es donde yo vivo, en el negocio nos ayudábamos con mi esposo, pero como ya tenemos 6 hijos y el dinero no es suficiente, con mucho esfuerzo empezamos a abonar un local en el mercado donde desde hace ya mas de un año vendo productos de consumo diario por lo que el crédito que solicito es para poder invertir en productos que los clientes piden y que necesito surtir para ganar más cliente, estoy muy contenta ya que poco a poco he visto crecer mi negocio. Pero mi sueño es terminar de pagar el local y que sea definitivamente mìo, y poder engrandecerlo y que pueda con ello ayudar a mejorar la educación de mis hijos ya que de los 6, solo 2 están estudiando pero quiero que todos vayan a la escuela y que se superen.

loans.use: To purchase frequently used products to sell in my store

loans.name: Toeafe

texts.en:
Toeafe Tiata, 50, is married and has 2 children. She has run a Bingo business for 3 years. She sells to the villagers 3 days per week.

Toeafe is requesting a loan to purchase jetpots, Bingo stamps, and a Bingo machine for her business. She had one previous loan from SPBD. She expects to earn about 250 Tala (about 104 USD) profit per week. SPBD loans are Toeafe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase jetpots, Bingo stamps, and a Bingo machine

loans.name: Thi Dong

texts.vi:
Mrs T. Thi Dong, 52 years old, has seven children, two of whom are still living with her. Using the first loan of 2 millions VND, her family invested in buying scraps, which generated a stable income and opened up a business prospect for her family. With the experiences accumulated through the years, she has been increasingly successful in this business and obtaining higher income. Besides buying and selling scraps she also raises livestock and performs agricultural tasks, so her family's monthly income is 5,000,000VND (about 333USD). She would like to borrow 19,000,000VND (1,150.00USD) to invest further in her business to improve her family's economy.
Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Đông năm nay 52 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 7 người con đều đã trưởng thành và có 2 con hiện đang sống cùng anh chị. Với số vốn vay 2 triệu đồng từ vòng 1, gia đình chị đã  đầu tư vào thu mua phế liệu .Dự án đã cho thu nhập ổn định và mở ra một hướng phát triển kinh tế mới cho gia đình.  Với kinh nghiệm đã được tích luỹ  nhiều năm trong việc thu mua phế liệu  nên gia hiện nay nên dự án tăng thu nhập của gia đình chị có rất nhiều thuận lợi và cho thu nhập ngày càng cao. Ngoài thu mua phế liệu gia đình chị còn  chăn nuôi và trồng trọt thêm, thu nhập của gia đình đạt 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Chị mong muốn được vay thêm 19.000.000đ để đầu tư vào thu mua phế liệu phát triển kinh tế gia đình.

loans.use: Buying scrap materials

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora is 42, is single, and lives alone. She has worked different jobs all of her life since she was very young since her family had scarce economic resources. Flora currently works selling candy and all types of sweets as a traveling street vendor on the main streets of her town. Since she has always worked, it's not difficult for her now. What is difficult is feeling lonely sometimes, such as when she arrives home and there is no one to talk to. Flora strives to have a decent life and to secure her old age.

With the money from this loan, she wants to purchase merchandise and a stand. With time, she would like to have a little store where she can offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Flora tiene 42 años, es soltera y vive sola. Ha trabajado durante toda su vida en diferentes labores, desde muy niña, ya que su familia era de bajos recursos económicos.Flora se dedica actualmente a vender golosinas y todo tipo de dulces de forma ambulatoria en las principales calles de su localidad, ya que ella siempre trabajó duro durante toda su vida, hoy no se le hace difícil, lo difícil es sentirse sola, algunas veces, cuando llega a casa y no hay con quien hablar. Flora se esfuerza para tener una vida digna y asegurar su vejes.

Con el dinero del préstamo quiere comprar mercadería, tener un puesto y con el tiempo una tiendita, donde poder ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and purchase a stand so she can stop selling as a traveling street vendor

loans.name: César

texts.es:
El señor César Genez tiene 27 años, vive en pareja con la señora Delci Lucia Brizuela, tienen un hijo menor de 3 años de edad. Tienen casa propia en el barrio San Vicente, con las comodidades necesarios para el hogar.

El cliente se dedica a la pescadería, compra – venta pescado. Posee infraestructuras para realizar sus actividades, equipos de pesca, congeladores.

Aparte de esta actividad realiza la actividad de granja, cría de animales menores como ovejas, cabras, cerdos y animales de corral). Esta en el ramo mas de 6 años en el rubro y el crédito que solicito es para comprar ovejas para reproducir. El cliente es una persona muy conocida de la zona, tiene varios años en el rubro. El cliente tiene como finalidad el de poder superarse día a día y brindarle más comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. César Genez is 27 years old, he lives with his wife Delci Lucia Brizuela, they have a young 3 year old son. They have their own home in the San Vicente neighborhood, with all the basic necessities in their home. The client buys and sells fish. He owns a local to run this business with fishing equipment and refrigerators. In addition to this business he farms, raising small animals such as sheep, goats, pigs and other corral animals. He has been doing this for more than 6 years and is well-known in the area as he has many years experience. The client has a goal of being able to improve himself every day and provide more comforts for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep, goats, and pigs.

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
I. baji, the wife of M.I., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has lived for the last 20 years. She completed her education through the 5th standard grade. She has one son who is in the 2nd standard grade. 

I. baji’s husband drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has been in this profession for the past 15 years. I. baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

I. baji is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband so that he able to earn more profit and meet the needs of her family.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Shamim baji and Rani baji want loans to buy seasonal fruits to resell. Latifan baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Kimsroy

texts.en: Mrs. Kimsroy T. is a 43-year-old widow and now lives in Trapaing Ampil village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a fish seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. However, she faces an obstacle because she currently cannot sell far from her house. Therefore, Mrs. Kimsroy T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She has four children who are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her business.

loans.name: May Annelieze

texts.en:
Mrs. May Annelieze D., is  42 years old, married, and blessed with 4 children. Her husband is an auditor in MHARS General hospital, Ozamiz City. As of now 2 of her children are studying in college as Nursing Student and the other 2 are elementary pupils. 
 
Even though her husband has a permanent job, she needs extra income because of economic crisis and 2 of her children are college students. That’s why she decided to engage in Ready-to-Wear (RTW) Clothes retailing. Since her capital to her business is not sufficient she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative because she heard from her neighbor that the cooperative is offering livelihood programs and microfinancing services.

The PMPC became a great help to her business because she was able to put up additional capital to her RTW Business. She is a member in good standing in  Sampaguita Center, Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional RTW clothes for sale.

Mrs. D. plans to have an additional quality stocks of RTW clothes for her business and enable her college students finish their studies.

loans.use: Purchase additional ready to wear clothes

loans.name: Ariel Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime se dedica a la elaboración de cuadernos, trabaja con su esposa y sus hijos ya que con este negocio solventan todos los gastos de su familia
Su domicilio y taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz..
Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente i es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
El crédito será destinado será destinado para la compra de materia prima, (papel por resmas y carton).
texts.en:
Jaime makes notebooks. He works with his wife and children and with this business they meet their family expenses. His home and workshop are located in the Alto Obrajes neighborhood of La Paz city. This is the fifth loan with Impro, and his history qualifies him as a “1 client” which means he has a good payment history on his loan. The loan will be used to buy materials (reams of paper and cardboard).

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza has been a fruit and coconut seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $550. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fruits and coconuts for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Aziza is 27 years old, married, and has three children aged 11, 7 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and coconuts for her bussiness.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, son mari est à la retraite et ils habitent dans le quartier d’adidogomé dans la ville de lomé. Elle a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, comme son mari est à la retraite, elle l’aide avec ce qu’elle gagne comme bénéfice dans les charges du foyer. Actuellement son stock est insuffisant pour couvrir les charges du foyer c’est pour cela qu’elle demande à wages un crédit pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of two children. Her husband is retired, and they live in the Adidogomé district in the city of Lomé. Her income-generating work involves commerce in grocery items. Because her husband is retired, she helps him with household expenses with what profits she earns. Currently, her inventory is insufficient to cover household expenses. That’s why she’s asking WAGES for a loan, so as to acquire supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Maribell

texts.es: La señora Maribell tiene 48 años de edad,  reside en laureles sur en la ciudad de Managua, ella se desempeña como maestra en un instituto desde hace doce años, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, comenzó a trabajar cuando se graduó, lo cual da las gracias a sus padres por la oportunidad que le dieron. Con el préstamo que esta haciendo en Afodenic es su sexta solicitud las cuales han sido de mucho beneficio por que ha mejorado su vivienda y ha dado a sus hijos un mejor techo. Con este nuevo préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto tras de la casa para tener una mejor privacidad, lo cual da las gracias a la institución por sus metas alcanzadas.
texts.en:
Maribell is 48 years old. She lives in Laureles Sur in the city of Managua. For the past 12 years she has worked as a schoolteacher. She has two children who are students. She began working after she graduated and is thankful to her parents for giving her that opportunity. This is her sixth loan from Afodenic; the loans have been very beneficial to her as she has been able to make home improvements and provide a roof over her children´s heads. With this new loan she is going to buy construction materials to build a room onto her house for more privacy, and she is grateful to Afodenic for being able to reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a room.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Mrs. Gloria A. is a 53 year old widow who lives with her two children. She makes bamboo furniture, and is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more materials. She dreams that her grandchildren will finish their studies with the help of her business and the loan assistance from Paglaum. Her hopes and aspirations are to have a successful bamboo furniture business and to upgrade her house to a concrete structure one day. She is a member of Paglaum MPC's PDP-LP program.

loans.use: To purchase of materials needed for making bamboo furniture

loans.name: Tuulituka Group

texts.en: Josephine is a 47 year old woman with 6 kids.  Her kids range from ages 11 to 15. Her youngest child is currently in a private primary school and her oldest child is a teacher.  Josephine also cares for 4 additional children, two grandchildren and one niece and one nephew. Josephine has been supporting her family with her pharmacy. She has been running her pharmacy with the help of one other person, for about 10 years now. She says that her success comes from her ability to connect with customers. Josephine is requesting a loan of 2 million USH.  This loan will help her to restock medicines in her shop, buy more food and medicine. pay school fees for her children, and generally help her family. Josephine dreams that some day at her pharmacy she will have all the medicines that her customers could ever ask for. For her family, she dreams that all her children to finish school and get good jobs.

loans.use: To restock medicines, and pay school fees.

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.en:
M. Đặng Thị (1002060042) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To making a living, M. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. M. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. M. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to expand shelter for her livestock. This will be the 8th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business

loans.use: used to expand shelter for her livestock

loans.name: Mikaela Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento tiene una antiguedad D. D. 6 ciclos (mas o menos 3 años D. vida), esta conformado por señoras D. un mismo bario "La Chimba". La señora Maribel , es la presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento "MIKAELA" D. la Agencia "PANAMERICANA", ella trabaja vendiendo artefactos a credito  en su barrio. La señora Susana S. C.. es la socia mas antigua en el grupo ella esta  como Tesorera del Banco, ella es muy trabajadora en su  negocio, ella venD. cosmeticos D. toda marca y camina bastante ofreciendo y cobrando. La señora Barbara tambien es una socia antigua del grupo y ella esta ocupando el cargo D. secretaria del Banco, su actividad es D. vender comida en el centro D. la ciudad tiene 3 hijos y su esposo es chofer.
texts.en:
The Bank of Beginnings has an old group of 6 loan cycles (more or less 3 years of existence). It is maD. up of women from a single neighbourhood, “La Chimba” (“The Pigtail”). Señora Maribel is the president of the Bank of Beginnings “MIKAELA”, from the Agency “PANAMERICANA”. She works selling items on credit in her neighbourhood. Señora Susana S. C. is the eldest member of the group. She is the treasurer of the Bank. She is very hard-working in her business. She sells cosmetics of all brands and she walks a fair distance offering and earning. Señora Barbara is also an elderly member of the group, and she serves in the position of secretary of the Bank. Her work is selling food in the city center. She has three children and her husband is a driver.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
LILIANA S. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS NAZARENAS” vive en el Distrito de Camporverde, tiene 40 años, 5 hijos y uno de ellos es menor de edad, su esposo es agricultor y mototaxista.

El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual lo invirtió en víveres para preparar sus comidas y luego venderlos en la plazuela del distrito.
Hasta la fecha ella continua vendiendo comida en la plazuela.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara respuestos para repararar su moto taxi y también comprara víveres y platos para la venta de sus comidas.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los 4 años que viene trabajando el cual le ha permitido implementar su negocio,  es una ayuda interesante que me ha permitido seguir adelante remarcó. Y hoy se siente capaz de administrar más su dinero.
texts.en:
LILIANA S. A. is a member of the “LAS NAZARENAS” Microfinance Institute. She is a 40-year-old woman who lives in the Campoverde district and has 5 children, one of whom is under age. Her husband is a farmer and motorcycle taxi driver.

She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan from Manuela Ramos in purchasing food to prepare her meals that she later sold in the district’s small square. To this date, she still sells meals in the small square.

With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle taxi. She will also purchase food and plates for her food business.

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the past 4 years that she has been a member because this institute has allowed her to start her own business. She stated that it has been of great help to her, and has permitted her to keep moving forward. Now she feels that she is capable of managing her money better.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo L. is a bread vendor at Buenavista, Santiago City, Isabela. Every morning he roams their village to sell his bread using his motorcycle. Wanting to improve his business and eventually have his own bakeshop, Rolando is really working hard everyday. He says that even though sometimes he feels tired, he still continues to sell for the future of his two children. Because of this, he wants to borrow PHP4,000 from Kiva lenders to purchase more bread that he can sell every morning.

His wife, Yvett, on the other hand, is working as a call center agent in Manila. Though his wife is not staying with them because of her work, he always sees to it that they have communication. Rolando also shares that he and his wife are willing to sacrifice for the benefit of their children.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia M. E.  tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes desde hace un año, local lo tiene en su misma casa; con un cuarto que fue construyendo con ahorros propios ya que antes solo trabajaba su esposo pero ahora con su negocio quiere aportar a los gastos familiares. La señora Leticia quiere comprar mercancía nueva para que el cliente se vaya satisfecho y no vaya a buscar a otro lugar ya que las tiendas están muy retiradas.
texts.en:
Leticia M. E. has been selling groceries for one year. Using her savings, she added a room to her house to create space for her store. Her husband was previously the sole breadwinner, but she wanted to start this business so that she could contribute toward the family expenses.

Sra. Leticia plans to buy new merchandise because she wants to satisfy her customers since they are not willing to go elsewhere because other stores are too far to travel.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Jema is a member of the semtema A borrower group in Kihesa,Morogoro,she is 41 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 23,19, and 12 years.

 Jema started her own food business selling tomatoes,anion 10 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 24000 Tanzania shillings.
 
This is jema`s fist loan from BRAC _Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tomatoes,anions.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Jema hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,potatoes,anion

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson tiene 22 años, es joven muy consiente, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea dar una buena y tranquila vejez. Brindando servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro, Wilson ayuda en los gastos del hogar a su familia, sabe que tiene una gran responsabilidad con sus padres, puesto que siente que ellos ya hicieron su parte y que ahora es su turno de corresponder todo el cariño que le dieron. Él es muy amable con sus clientes y siempre los recibe con una sonrisa en los labios y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros. Lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que estar todo el día fuera de casa en busca de clientes, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Para el futuro espera reunir el dinero necesario para comprar otro motocarro. Este es el primer préstamo de Wilson con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere crearle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual participa activamente y es un socio muy querido. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que con el paso del tiempo se han ido desgastando.
texts.en:
Wilson is 22 years of age and a very agreeable young man. He lives at home with his parents and wants to provide them with a nice peaceful retirement. In order to help with the family expenses, Wilson provides passenger transport services in his motorcar. Since his parents did their part in supporting him, it’s now his turn to reciprocate the affection they have given him. He is very sociable with his customers and always greets them with a smile on his face. What he likes most about his job is having conversations with his passengers. He has been in business for 5 years and believes the most difficult part of his work is spending all day looking for customers. He knows that this is part of the job, so he does it anyway. In the future, he hopes to save enough money to buy another motorcar.

This is Wilson’s first loan with MFP. He hopes to make his payments on time because he does not want to cause problems for his Communal Bank, where he is an active and beloved member. With his loan of 800 soles, he plans to buy new tires for his motorcar because the existing ones have worn out over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for his motorcar

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
N. Irene is a 49-year-old lady and married with four children. All are grownups and married with their own children. However, Irene helps to take care of four orphaned grand children.

For nine years, Irene has run a business in Bugembe, Budumbuli East selling charcoal, pancakes, cassava and Irish potato chips and, because of this, she is well known by almost everyone there. Out of her business, she makes 45,000/= as weekly profits and this is mostly attributed to her good customer care and the availability of loans to enable her to increase her capital. She hopes to start up another business selling maize flour and this will enable her buy her own lot and build a house.

Irene needs a loan to be able to buy more charcoal to increase her stock. She is such a friendly and determined person with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for increased sales

loans.name: Nustriana

texts.en:
Nustriana P., from the village of Cabungaan Clarin, is 73 years old, married, and the mother of five adult-aged children. To make a living, Nustriana owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap , toothpaste, sugar and snacks in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.
