loans.use: Julia, Maria, and Juana need loans of 900, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, pasta, tuna fish, milk, beer, soft drinks, and bicycle repair parts.

loans.name: Sadika

texts.en: Sadika was born  in 1965 and she lives with her husband in Vitez. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 1 200 KM. They sell agriculture and milk products in order to increase their monthly incomes. They can earn about 400 KM monthly. Sadika will use this loan in the amount of 1200 KM  for buying nylon for her greenhouse. She wants to expand the business and build a bigger greenhouse in the future.

loans.use: Buying nylon for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Mr. Demetrio A. is married to Mrs. Dalia Primitiva Samudio. They have two underage children together.

He is a barber who from a young age helped his father, who was also a barber. He started his business with the help of his parents, and his hair salon has been in business for 15 years now. He counts on the support of his wife, who is also a hairdresser. They are both moving their business forward, and it has been growing day by day.

Demetrio has managed to gain many customers thanks to his service. He would like to improve his salon, starting with a new styling station and mirror which he will purchase with the help of the loan he is currently requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Demetrio A. esta casado con la señora Dalia Primitiva Samudio, tiene dos hijos menores de edad.

El es peluquero, desde muy pequeño ha ayudado a su padre que también era peluquero. El monto su negocio con el apoyo de sus padres y ya van 15 años que su peluquería esta en funcionamiento. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, ya que también es peluquera, ambos llevan adelante dicho negocio y día a día va creciendo de a poco.

Demetrio ha logrado hacerse de muchos clientes gracias al buen servicio que ofrece. El desea mejorar su local, empezando por un mueble nuevo con espejo que desea adquirirlo con la ayuda del crédito que solicita.

loans.use: Purchase of styling station with mirror

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es:
Jorge Amando inherited his freight business from his father, and has been working in the business for the last 20 years. He has been successful thanks to his good customer base. Jorge is a single father and takes care of his 17 year old son. He will use the loan of $150, which he will repay in 5 months, to invest in his business. With your support he can continue to grow his business and care for his son.

Jorge Armando, heredo de su papa la concesión para realizar fletes, negocio al cual se ha dedicado durante 20 años, se ha mantenido en el negocio gracias a su cartera amplia de clientes, es padre soltero y mantiene a su hijo de 17 años.

Ahora solicita un crédito por $150 que pagara en 5 meses para tener capital de trabajo y continuar con su negocio de mudanzas y fletes. Con tu apoyo Jorge seguirá progresando.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HIS FREIGHT BUSINESS

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
MicroInvest has been working with Mrs. Zarrina K. since 2008. She is a reliable entrepreneur who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. She lives in the Asht region and she is married, with 2 children. Her husband went to the Russian Federation to take a well-paying job. Mrs. K. works on a collective farm but her main business is raising livestock. She has 2 cows and 10 years’ experience in the livestock business. She has the appropriate skills and good knowledge of livestock care.

Mrs. K. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 US to purchase special milk handling equipment.

loans.use: To purchase special milk handling equipment

loans.name: Vao

texts.en: Vao L., 50, is married with six children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells her crops to the villagers and public two days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD, and she expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~180 USD). SPBD loans are Vao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to purchase supplies for her plantation.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides, barbed wire, nails, and other supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Veronica's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 40 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children aged 19, 17 and 10 and also takes care of 3 other children aged 19, 17 and 10. She became a clothes seller in 2003. She works everyday from 7am to 12pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Veronica has previously taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now requests a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with charcoal and handbag sales, clothes sales, chips and snack sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine T.. She is 28 and married with three children. She is a business woman in Makeni City, where she works as a petty-trader selling market food. She has been in this business for the past five years now.

Josephine realized that with a loan her business would grow at a faster rate because she wouldn't depend on the little profit she makes. She thus approached SMT to solicit a loan for her from Kiva for Le 3,000,000.00.

loans.use: To expand her business selling market food.

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma Delia inició el negocio porque anteriormente se dedicaba al hogar y se decidió a poner un negocio para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos; y ella deseaba obtener ingresos para pagara los gastos escolares de sus 4 hijos. Comenzó hace 4 años puso una papelería como un negocio que le diera ingresos para los gastos de la casa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo ella podrá seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Alma Delia started her business because she used to only stay at home but then she decided to start a business to give her children a better quality of life. She wanted to obtain an income to cover the schooling expeditures for her 4 children. About 4 years agos she set up an school supply store as a small business to provide her some money to cover the household expenses.

She requires a loan in the amount of $475 US, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months. The funds will be used to purchase merchandise. With your support she will continue moving forward.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mrs. Yong Y. is 40 years old and single and she is a farmer in Krodas Village in Kampong Cham Province. She now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate, so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to amend her field. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Susette

texts.en:
Susette A. is a 29-year-old married woman blessed with three children. She is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PDP-LP) and belongs to Lovely 1 Center in cluster 7 presently residing at Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis, Ocidental. She took out a loan for a small sari-sari store project. Every day she gained P300, but this was not enough for the daily basic needs of her family and for the education of her three children.

She also has secondary project, which is a cocolumber, located at Calamba, Misamis, Occidental. This project was managed by her husband but did not succeed due to the low demand for these supplies. Presently, her husband drives a private dump truck earning P200 per day. It’s a big help in their family but still insufficient for their basic necessities.  

Susette is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to provide additional capital for her sari-sari store, particularly for the purchase of assorted canned goods, spices, toiletries, rice and many other items. This additional capital will surely have a return of at least 300 per day.

Susette has a simple dream for her family: to become a successful business woman in her sari-sari store, for her children to finish their studies, and to have a happy family.

loans.use: Purchase of Assorted Grocery Items

loans.name: Namasuba H- Ndagire Salome Group

texts.en:
Salome N. is 27 years old. She is a hardworking single mother of three children, who are between the ages of four and seven. She is also a loving guardian to her two brothers who came into her care after the death of their parents.

Using money saved from selling charcoal, Salome opened up a cosmetics shop two years ago. She created the shop by partitioning part of her residence in Namasuba. She sells perfumes, hair additions, hair relaxers, and lotions, among other things. These sales earn her a minimum profit of UGX 60,000 per week. Besides, she also sells safe piped-water to households in her locality at the rate of UGX 50 per jerrican.

She would therefore use the loan to purchase cosmetics, like Movit relaxer and treatment, TCB Naturals, botanical marrow, mayonnaise treatment, Venus, and Dark & Lovely, among others. This added inventory will allow her to meet the rising demands of customers and also compete favourably in the market. She has an ambition to open up a ladies' boutique and also ensure those entrusted into her care go through their education successfully at all levels.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and hair products in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Guapuru Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Guapurú",  presentan  un  nexo consanguíneo entre la familia Aguilar céspedes y D. afinidad  ninguno.  El banco comunal esta constituido con socias participantes que viven en la zona y se conocen entre si, la mayoría D. ellas desempeñan su actividades económicas, como vendedoras ambulantes. Las socias realizan diferentes actividades económicas,  como venta D. ropa,  zapatos, joyas, y los  socios participantes prestan servicios D. albañilería y el otro como mecánico. Pese a la competencia existente las socias siempre saben como salir adelante en sus puestos D. venta. El crédito financiado esta destinado para el incremento D. mercadería, comprar material  y compra D. herramientas para desempeñar mejor su trabajo. Una mayoría D. las socias ya trabajaron bajo esta modalidad en anteriores ciclos y algunos miembros conocen el trabajo en grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank “Guapurú” have a blood link between the family Aguilar Céspedes, and no affiliations. The community bank is maD. up of participants who live in the area and who are known to each other. Most of them work in economic activies, like in open market sales. The members do different jobs, like selling clothing, shoes, jewelry, and the members give services to the blacksmith and others as a mechanic. Due to their existing competencies the members know they will improve their lives with their kiosks. This loan is destined to increase merchandise, to buy materials and to buy tools in order to better do their work. Most of the have had loans in previous groups and some members know the work of solidarity groups.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Maisha Bora Group

texts.en:
Khadija is a tailor and painter in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She has done this work for four years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40, working every day for 14 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tailoring and painting materials for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business and save money for future use. Khadija is 26 years old and married.

Khadija will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Asaa, Sada H., Chiku, Sichana and Sada S.. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring and painting materials for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja hace 11 años y medio, es madre de 2 hijos con los que vive en su casa. Sus padres fueron agricultores y ella heredó sus tierras de cultivo con la responsabilidad del labrado de la tierra, siendo su única fuente para generarse ingresos económicos y para el sostenimiento de su familia. En consecuencia Norma se levanta cerca de las 5 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos para que a las 8 de la mañana pueda llevar su ganado al campo y así le alcanze el tiempo para llevar el almuerzo a su esposo, el cual trabaja en la chacra, ayudándolo, con la siembra de habas, papas y maíz. Pero algunas veces se le presentan dificultades; como la rancha (plaga que se ocasiona por la exesiva lluvia, ocasionando que el gusano afecte directamente el fruto), por ello tiene que estar verificando constantemente sus cultivos y de ese modo tratar de contrarrestar los males que acechan su chacra y así salvar sus cosechas. A Norma le agrada la agricultura aunque no siempre gane tanto como se lo propone, sus planes a corto y largo plazo están basados en las ganancias de su producción. Norma tiene el cargo de vocal en el banco comunal al que pertenece, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es para comprar abono, nitratos y demás pesticidas para contrarrestar al gusano que asecha su chacra de habas y así logre obtener su producto en buen estado para que sea atractivo para la venta.
texts.en:
Norma is 28 years old and has lived with her husband for 11.5 years. She is the mother of two children who live in her home. Her parents were farmers and she inherited their land along with the responsibility to work that land, being the only her only source to generate income for herself and support her family. Consequently Norma gets up around 5 in the morning to prepare meals so that at 8 in the morning she can take her cattle to pasture and in this way have enough time to take her husband lunch. He works on the farm, helping with the planting of beans, potatoes, and corn. But sometimes they have difficulty; as when the mold from excessive rain causes the worms to affect the crop, so he has to be constantly checking his crops and in this way attempt to prevent the pestilences that can affect the farm and in this way save his crops. Normal likes farming even though she doesn’t always earn as much money as she hopes. Her short term and long term plans are based on her earnings from her crop production. Norma has the spokesperson position in her communal bank. This is her second loan with MFP and in all this time she has demonstrated great responsibility with her payments. The money she seeks is to buy fertilizer, nitrates, and other pesticides to counteract the worm that affects her bean crop and in this way be able to have her products be good quality and attractive for its sale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria tiene 44 años, vive en la casa que consiguió con mucho sacrifico y trabajando mucho, es soltera y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Lleva 9 años en el negocio de la producción de helados y hasta ahora todo le ha ido muy bien,  fabrica los helados para luego distribuirlos por las tiendas donde tiene contratos, sus helado son rápidamente comprados por los clientes, ya que tienen un sabor muy agradable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la libertad que tiene, ya que puede encargarse de su negocio y a la vez de su hogar, pero lo que no le gusta es soportar el frío que le hace cada vez que los prepara. Gregoria desea tener en el futuro su propia heladería donde pueda vender sus helados ella misma, sabe que el camino a sus metas es muy duro, pero está dispuesta a afrontarlo. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos siempre ha sido muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy activa. Gregoria invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la compra de los ingredientes para la elaboración de sus helados.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 44 years old. She lives in the house she was able to get through much sacrifice and hard work. She is single, and what she wants most of all is to be worry free when she reaches her old age. She has been in the business of making ice cream for 9 years. Up until now everything has gone very well. She makes ice cream to distribute to the stores where she has contracts. The customers buy her ice cream quickly because it tastes so good. What she likes best about her work is the freedom she has. She is able to see to her business, and at the same time she can take care of her home. What she does not like is how cold she gets every time she makes the ice cream. In the future, Gregoria would like to have her own ice cream parlor where she could sell her ice cream. She knows that the road to achieving her goals is difficult, but she is determined to meet the challenge. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has always made her payments on time, and she expects to be able to do the same with this loan as well. She is very active in her community bank. With this loan Gregoria will buy ingredients to make her ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Mrs. Alfreda A. of Miputak, Dipolog City is a very responsible mother and as member of the coop. She is 55 years old, but is still struggling with the challenges of life. During her three years of membership in Paglaum, she has already borrowed and actively repaid three loans.

Because her dream is to make her hog-raising business a successful one, she has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy piglets. Today she is helping her husband a lot to earn an income.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares has been working as a car repairman since 1996. Fares is a 47-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Fares has requested a loan of $2500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Fares decided on this business because he wanted to use his experience and he also wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on improving his shop.

loans.use: To purchase tools for a garage

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.en:
Hằng Đặng Thị is 55 years old and lives in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four adult-aged children. Hằng earns a living by owning and operating a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The primary source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Hằng has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Hằng joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so that she could help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Hằng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and, eventually, to sell.

Hằng is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Hằng plans to use the additional revenue she expects to be generated from the business to improve and expand her business ventures.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jesus Humberto

texts.es:
Jesús Humberto y su esposa son persona que están pensando en el patrimonio de sus hijos. Esta familia le gusta salir junta y sobre todo entre ellos jugar en la parte de atrás de su vivienda. El préstamo que le otorguen lo utilizaran para reforzar ese lazo familiar, ellos quieren levantar la barda atrás de su casa y poner protección para cuando sus hijos estén jugando afuera. También desean aprovecharlo para poner techo para que ninguna inclemencia del tiempo les impida jugar.
Ellos se dedican a vender artículos de belleza por catalogo y trabajan en maquiladora los dos.
texts.en:
Jesús Humberto and his wife are always thinking about the patrimony that they will be leaving their children. This family enjoys going out together, and above all they enjoy playing together in their backyard. The loan that they are requesting will be used to reinforce this family bond; they would like to erect a fence in their backyard to protect their children when they are playing outside. They also hope to take advantage of the loan by adding an awning so that not even inclement weather can impede their play. They dedicate themselves to sale of beauty products through catalogs and also work in a maquiladora (a border assembly factory).

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a fence and awning.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Bancomunal  Avancemos Juntas
Sandra es conviviente tiene 32 años, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 4 años que estudian en la escuela estatal.
Sandra estudio para asistenta dental, no lo ejerció por que tiene que cuidar a sus hijos  los dos sufren de asma y necesitan cuidados ,  empezó vendiendo productos de belleza por catalogo y con las ganancias logro comprarse un moto-car de segunda, que lo ha dado en alquiler.  
Desde que Sandra esta en Finca ha podido superarse económicamente como persona, puede aporta para la economía de su hogar, esto ha ayudado a su matrimonio. 
Sandra necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles, para repara la moto-car que tiene.
El sueño de Sandra es  tener una flota  de moto- car.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the community bank “Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas”. She is 32 years old and has two children who are 12 and 4 years old and attend a public school. Sandra studied to be a dental assistant, but didn’t work on the field because she had to take care of her children since both have asthma and need special care. She began selling cosmetics by catalog and with the profits she bought a secondhand moto-car, which she rents.

Because of “Finca” Sandra was able to improve financially personally, and can provide for the household which has helped her marriage. Sandra is asking for a loan of $350 to repair her motor-car.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a moto-car

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene P. is a 40-year old married woman. She has five children and unfortunately, the twin babies inside her womb were aborted just recently for reasons she don't know. It was a indeed a heartbreak for Marlene and her husband, Jimmy, because they did not know that the six month fetus inside her womb were twins. Because of poverty and no enough nutritious food taken, she might have not given them proper nurture. However, Marlene had to move on with her life and her dreams for her other five children. She recently applied for a loan in ASHI amounting to PhP 48,000 in order to purchase a motorcycle in installment basis having a downpayment of Php20,000 and sidecar in cash payment of Php30,000 for her tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar attached to it) for her husband to drive. 

Tricycle is one of the main means of transportation of people coming in and out of the village all throughout the municipality. Marlene's husband has been driving a tricycle for hire owned by other people for 20 years now. This is Marlene's daily source of income since her farming business which was her primary business since the beginning of her membership in ASHI, can only generate income every four months. With the increasing need of her family finances her husband and their farming business can hardly sustain, they have to increase their income. Having their own tricycle to be driven by her husband, the whole of his daily earnings will go to the family because he doesn't have to pay for the tricycle rental. 

Having been a very good member of ASHI in the past nine years, showing a very good performance in payment, attendance and business, there would be no doubt that Marlene will be able to do better with her present loan applied. Her dreams of giving her children better education and better life motivates her to move on and make good in her business.

loans.use: a motorcycle and sidecar (to be attached to the motorcycle).

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is 28 years old and single with no children. She lives with her family members. She is a baker and prepares pastries like cake, and she also sells fruits like watermelon, in bulk. In spite of the challenges she faces, she manages to meet her customers' expectations with her pastries. She has customers who buy from her in bulk. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can make more profit and save part for the future. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stocking and selling charcoal

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando es un joven soltero muy noble, vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos, es el penúltimo hijo. Años atrás se fue a Lima (capital del país) en busca de progreso, pero no le fue bien, por lo que optó por regresar a su tierra natal (San Juan, centro poblado menor del distrito de Huasahuasi en Junín). Desde el año pasado se propuso sembrar papa en las chacras de sus padres, pues esa tierra les ha dado muy buenos frutos, tanto de papa para consumo, como papa para semilla. En su primera cosecha le ha ido muy bien, cada saco de papa lo vendió entre 50 a 60 soles, de ese modo logró acumular muy buenas ganancias, por ello es que se siente muy motivado en seguir sembrando con el apoyo de su padre, ya no sólo papa, sino también arvejas, por ser un producto, también muy rentable. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas de manera muy puntual para seguir contando con próximos préstamos. También desea empezar ahorrar en su banco comunal, que es otra de las cosas que más le entusiasman. El dinero que solicita en esta oportunidad será invertido en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de papas.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Lyanda Kilwake

texts.en:
Lyanda is 47 years old, married and blessed with five children who are all studying. He has been in agriculture for the past ten years now, and his farm is located in Regeya in Eldoret.

Lyanda A. was introduced to KADET by a member after wanting to expand his business but lacking the resources. He intends to buy feed for his livestock with his loan. His future looks bright as he seems to be making profits, not losses.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET at: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy feed for his livestock

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Mrs. Hazel G. is from Montilla, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She is 37 years old and is married with seven children of school age.

Due to abject poverty, she joined Project Dungganon in 1991 and started her salted-peanuts and “balut" business in their community (a balot or balut is a fertilized duck or chicken egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell). Then, a year later, she ventured into making peanut butter and delivered it to her regular clients.

However, Mrs. G. realized that their monthly income was not sufficient for her family. She came up with the idea of making a cart so that she could go around town selling her products such as the peanut butter, salted peanuts and a little of her RTW (ready-to-wear clothes). It proved to be a brilliant idea.

Now, she is planning to expand her business and make another mobile store to sell her wares in their community. Mrs. G. is proposing PHP 14,000 for her 15th loan. 


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en: Eusebio Pador, Jr. is from the village of Sugarland, Valencia City. He is 53 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Eusebio owns and operates a business providing space for rent to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Eusebio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to complete his stocks.

loans.name: Mrs. Shiphat Chea  Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of ten people located in Khmot village in Kandal province.  All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Shiphat C. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.  Aside from this plantation, she is a teacher and makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Shiphat C. is 60 years-old and a widow with two children who are employed in a garment factory. Although they try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support the family and they cannot build a kitchen. In order to build the kitchen, Mrs. Shiphat C. is asking for a loan.

loans.use: To build a kitchen.

loans.name: Madres Unidas De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
MADRES UNIDAS DE YANACOTO

Esta alcancía comunal se inició hace 3 años, son 11 personas quienes integran los cuales son microempresarios muy trabajadores, buscan a través de sus negocios mejorar su condición de vida económica a fin de darles a los suyos lo mejor cada día. Así tenemos el caso de María Rita: Tengo 52 años, casada y madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, me inicié como microempresaria más de quince años porque veía que el sueldo de mi esposo no era lo suficiente para mejorar nuestra casita de esteras y calaminas, como también comprar algunas cosas para el hogar. Vendía kerosene en mi casa, daba pensión, limpiaba en casas, luego hacía gelatinas, chupetes de frutas; siempre tuve el apoyo de mi esposo.
Llegó el tiempo que decidí plantar una pequeña tiendita para ello compré media y un cuarto de cada cosita (arroz, azúcar, huevos, fideos, papa, aceite, leche, detergente u otros) invertía las ganancias en implementar cada vez más mi negocio. Hoy en día mi bodeda es una de las más surtida de la zona donde vivo, esto me ayudó a construir de material noble mi casa, ayudar a mi madre, darle educación superior (policía) a mi hijo y solventar en algunos gastos. Requiero del préstamo para adquirir mercadería en detergente, arroz, azúcar y esta manera seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Madres Unidas de Yanacoto This communal bank started three years ago. There are 11 members. They are very hard-working small business owners who look to improve the condition of their economic lives through their businesses. They do this to give their families the best every day. Here is María Rita’s case. I am 52, married, and have two adult children. I started as a small businesswoman over 15 years ago because I saw that my husband’s salary was not enough to improve our house made of reeds and corrugated metal or to buy things for the house. I sold kerosene from my house, I boarded people, I cleaned houses, and I then sold gelatin and fruit lollipops. I always had my husband’s support. The time came when I decided to establish a small store. To do this I bought a little bit of each thing (rice, sugar, eggs, noodles, potatoes, oil, milk, detergent, and others). I invested the earnings each time in setting up the store more. Now, my store is one of the best stocked in the area where I live. This helped me build my house from strong material, help my mother, give my son a post high school education (police), and pay other expenses. I need the loan to get merchandise like detergent, rice, and sugar. This way I will keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries

loans.name: Gelly

texts.en: Gelly B. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is years old. Gelly is widowed and has three young children. To make a living, Gelly runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Gelly has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities. In 2008, Gelly joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gelly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Gelly is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Gelly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is a twenty-six year old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Gifty works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Gifty sells door-to-door and by the roadside in her community. She procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby communities. Gifty has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure maize in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Sonia es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Sonia tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado que esta ubicado en una calle concurrida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 3 personas.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, fideo.
Sonia sueña con tener un local propio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Firmeza Communal Bank. She is 38 years old, married and has three children. Sonia has a restaurant in a rented location, located on a busy street, where she works daily along with three other people. Sonia needs a 2000 soles ($700) loan so that she can buy rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and noodles. In the future she would like to own the location for her restaurant and wants her children to get college educations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and noodles

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y 03 hijas, 01 que aun dependen de ella. La Socia presenta primaria completa.

Ramona, es una mujer con ganas de seguir adelante, se considera una mujer luchadora y eficiente, lleva 06 años dedicándose a la venta de dulces como: Mazamorras de maíz morado, arroz con leche, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos decidió implementarse mas en el negocio, sus ventas los realiza a partir de las 10:30 am. Y sale por las calles, el mercado a ofrecer ricos dulces. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró, maíz morado en kilos, azúcar y algunos utensilios, nos cuenta que le va muy bien y tiene buena acogida, por el rico sabor de sus dulces. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio.

Con este crédito de S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para preparar sus dulces  como: Maíz morado, arroz y azúcar en kilos, manzanas y piñas, canela molida y otros ingredientes, para dar un rico sabor, en cuestión de utensilios comprará vasos y cucharitas de plástico.
 
Ramona, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sueños y metas, así como a otras mujeres que  quieren crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ramona belongs to the "Las Brisas" ("The Breezes") communal bank, in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, Department of San Martín. She is 44 years old and married, and she has 3 daughters, one of whom is still dependent on her. She has completed an elementary school education. Ramona is a woman with the desire to get ahead, and she is known as a determined and efficient person. For the past 6 years, she has worked selling sweets, such as arroz con leche (rice pudding) and mazamorras, a pudding made from purple corn. Since she saw that she could generate a good income this way, she decided to devote more of her time to the business. She sells her products starting at 10:30 a.m., going out onto the streets and to the market to offer her delicious sweets. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian new soles, she purchased purple corn by the kilo, as well as sugar and some utensils. She tells us that her business is going very well and it is quite popular, thanks to the delicious flavor of her sweets. She is currently continuing with the same business. With this loan for 2,500 Peruvian new soles, she will buy supplies to prepare her sweets, such as purple corn, rice and sugar by the kilo, as well as apples, pineapples, ground cinnamon and other ingredients to provide delicious flavor. She will also buy some utensils such as plastic cups and spoons. Ramona feels like a satisfied woman, happy with what she has achieved. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for helping her fulfill her goals and dreams, as well as for helping other women who want to grow and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients to prepare rice pudding and mazamorras

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph P. is from the village of Canta-an, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. He is 24 years old. Joseph is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Joseph owns & operates a service-based community transport business. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Joseph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. Joseph is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Joseph from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Mr. Ban Meach Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ban M. is a chief in wedding parties and his wife, Mrs. Pho Khiev, is a farmer with 2 hectares of land. She grows rice to sell to support her famiL.. He is the father of a child who helps to do the farming. No matter how hard they try to work, they cannot earn enough income because their field has infertile soil and it's time to plow. Thus, Mr. Ban M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. With the rest of the loan, he would like to hire some farmers to plow the rice field. 

Mr. Ban M. is village bank president who has been selected by all the members. Nineteen people are in this village bank, who all live in Phnum Lonteah village in TaK. province. They will use the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Martínez de Oviedo tiene 59 años tiene un hijo de 30 años que trabaja y viven en el barrio Los Calamares al suroccidente de Cartagena de Indias.  
Ella vende pescado y con su conyuge tiene una carpintería, dos razones por las cuales aplica a un crédito por valor de $2.000.000, para comprar una cantidad suficiente de pescado para venderlo en la semana santa y madera para elaborar muebles solicitados.  
Inició su negocio en el año 2001 cuando adquirió un congelador y empezó a trabajar con $200.000 de ahorros, que logró guardando en una alcancía moneda a moneda. Se inclinó por la venta de este producto sin experiencia y con dificultades de salud de su madre y con el agravante de un hijo desaparecido.  Gradualmente logró sacar adelante este negocio y también  respaldar a su cónyuge en la carpintería, quien conoce ese oficio, por eso decidió hacer un crédito a la Fundación  y fortalecer paralelamente las dos actividades que se han ampliado, en especial la carpintería que aunque tiene dos años de estar funcionando, es en la actualidad el negocio familiar principal, .
Este es su séptimo crédito con la Fundación inició con $1,200,000 y ha llegado a recibir  hasta  $2.800.00, vive agradecida con esta organización porque le ha respaldado  simultáneamente estos dos negocios familiares y con ellos ha podido crecer desde su primer crédito, mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda y hasta ayudar a su hijo quien ya formó su familia.
Ella sueña con que su carpintería crezca y poder dedicarse plenamente a  ella, porque en la actualidad complementa este trabajo y  el de vender pescado, con su actividad de trabajar en un hotel, con el que obtiene unos ingresos adicionales, pero ella reconoce que esto ocurrirá cuando la carpintería genere el dinero suficiente para sostener plenamente su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Martínez de Oviedo is 59 years old and has a 30 year old son who works. They lives in the neighborhood of Las Calamares in the southwestern section of Cartagena de Indias.

She sells fish while her husband works as a carpenter. Therefore, she has two reasons why she is applying for a loan worth 2,000,000 COP. She plans to buy a sufficient quantity of fish to sell during Holy Week as well as wood to make furniture requested by her husband’s customers.

Ana started her business in 2001 when she bought a freezer. She began with 200,000 COP of savings, which she accumulated coin by coin and kept in a piggy bank. Ana was determined to sell her products even though she had no experience and had to deal with her mother’s health problems and a child who left home. Slowly she was able to move forward with her business and also support her husband with his carpentry, since he is well-known for his trade. Ana decided to apply for a loan from the Foundation in order to strengthen both businesses at the same time by expanding them, especially the carpentry business since it had been in operation already for two years. It is now the primary family business.

This is Ana’s seventh loan with the Foundation. She began with a loan of 1,200,000 COP and has received as much as 2,800,000 COP. Ana is grateful to the organization because it has helped to simultaneously support two family businesses that have grown since receiving the first loan. This has also improved her conditions at home and helped her son who has now started his own family.

Ana hopes that the carpentry business will grow so that she can work with it full-time. At the moment, she supplements this work by selling fish and with a job working at a hotel to earn additional income. She recognizes that her goal will be achieved when the carpentry business generates enough income to fully support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood for her carpentry business & enough fish to sell during Holy Week

loans.name: Keleya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Keleya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Sirimou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des céréales, du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois. Les céréales constituent l’activité dominante de certains membres du groupe tels Djenebou F..
Ces femmes du groupe Keleya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents.
Quant à l’utilisation de ce nouveau prêt, Djenebou F. compte acheter, des sacs de céréales dans le village et environs. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Tingolé et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women from the Keleya group are all married, they average 38 years of age and three children each. They live in traditional extended families in Sirimou, sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship and sell cereals, firewood and wood charcoal. The cereals are the main activity of some members of the group as it is for Djenebou F.. The women from the Keleya group are on their fourth solidarity loan after having fully reimbursed the four previous ones. As for the use of this new loan, Djenebou F. is planning on buying bags of cereals in the village and its surroundings. She sells locally, at the Tingolé market and at the neighboring fairs. She sells for cash and on credit to a customer base that is men and women. She is planning on making a monthly profit of 30,000 Francs CFA, which will be used for the family daily expenses. The rest will be reinvested in the retail activities.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Johana

texts.es:
Johana es socia del Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta que significa Bella Flor en quechua.
Johana es soltera, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Johana se dedica a la confección, bordados de correas, carteras, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de personas que le brindan el servicio de bordado.
Johana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas e hilos.
Johana sueña con mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Johana, 22, is a member of the Sumacc Huayta (Beautiful Flower in Quechua) communal bank. She is single and has a son. She manufactures embroidered sashes and purses; she employs helpers for the embroidery work. Johana needs a 1500 sol loan to buy fabric and thread. Johana dreams with improving her business and providing a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante.
Zenaida es casada, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, Zenaida viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, quesos, productos que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho de casa en casa.
Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos y cereales.
Los sueños de Zenaida son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Zenaida is a member of the Radiant Sun village bank. She is married, 47 years old, with 4 children. She travels to various markets in the region to buy cereals, cheese, and other products which she sells in the city of Ayacucho from door to door. She needs a $225 loan to buy more cheese and cereals. Her dream is for her children to become professionals in their careers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese and cereals

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy D. is from the village of Lurogan, Valencia City. She is 52 years old. Mercy is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Mercy owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Mercy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Enye Mahooden Group

texts.en:
Janet is currently the group leader of “Enye Mahooden' (translated as 'not by might') Trust Bank Group made up of 8 members. Janet is clearly a hard worker. She is a 53-year-old woman who is a hairdresser and also sells bales of used clothes to customers in her community. 

Janet has been operating her businesses for 4 years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to invest the loan in buying hair pomade and creams to revive her beauty salon and expend the rest to purchase bales of assorted used clothes to serve her customers. Used clothes are most patronized since brand-new ones are expensive for the majority of low-income people. This has created a market for women like Janet.

Janet is divorced and she is the mother of one child who is 13 years old. Janet’s dreams include owning a kiosk to sell ice creams and ice and selling 'kenkey' (balls of fermented maize dough) to generate additional income to support her child’s education to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To purchase hair creams and used clothes

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man but has no child. He has been operating his electrical business and fixing sockets for four years. With Ksh 20,000 he wants to purchase electrical panels, circuit breakers and sockets. He operates from door to door to his neighbors and works on new buildings.

Mohamed’s main challenge is theft. He hopes that someday he will work in a very competitive environment and earn more money.

Mohamed decided to join Yehu so as to obtain a loan to boost his business. He owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His monthly expenses include electricity.

loans.use: To purchase electrical panels, circuit breakers and sockets

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald R. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 27 years old. Ronald is married. To make a living, Ronald raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ronald has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ronald joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ronald has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Ronald is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Ronald from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Family expenses

loans.name: Irene Amarilis

texts.en:
Irene Amarilis S. N. is 25 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has three children, ages 6, 3, and 2 years old. 

Irene is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. There are 15 members of the group, the majority of whom work in agriculture. 

Irene also works in agriculture. She earns on average $150 per month. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde. 

Irene plans to use the loan to invest in the business of raising pigs. Her dream is to have her own plot of land and to own a car. Her business struggles when her animals occasionally die. 

In her free time, she likes to watch television and listen to music. Her favorite community tradition is the festival of San Francisco.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Lane Kuru Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “Lane Kuru” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With the help of this loan they will each be able to expand their business, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Wara T. is the leader of this group. The forty-five-year-old is married to a businessman and they have three children. Wara has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells locally dyed cloth (gara lappers) and cotton cloth. With her share of this loan, she will buy materials for making gara lappers like ink, caustic soda, powder, etc., so that she can produce dozens of gara lappers to sell.

loans.use: To buy materials for making more gara lappers to sell

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en: Khanh T. N. is 52 years old with one child who attends a vocational school.  She sells fresh vegetables and fruit.  Her business has grown over the past four years and her family's living conditions are directly linked to her business' success.  Khanh has always been a good re-payer.  Currently, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: Invest in her shop

loans.name: Segia

texts.en:
Segia P. is a 56 year old married woman who supports her family by operating a used clothing business. She lives in Yulo St., Brgy. 8, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her used clothing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. Segia is now borrowing PHP 30,000 so that she can continue funding her business operations. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Segia  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund operations.

loans.name: Las Palmas Ms Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Palmas MS se encuentra ubicado en L. ciudad D. Monte Salas, Fortín en el Estado D. Veracruz en México y está conformado por 9 integrantes. 

María Susana G. es L. presidente del grupo. Tiene 47 años, estudió hasta 5to. Año D. primaria, es casada y tiene en total 2  hijos. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. hoja D. platano que inicio hace 20 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más hoja D. plátano para asar y vender, porque las personas que hacen tamales le compran las hojas D. platano para hacer los tamales oaxaqueños, que se venden en varios estados D. México. L. señora María Susana necesita incrementar su ventas para mantener económicamente a sus hijos, dado que su esposo está enfermo y no pueD. trabajar. El sueño D. L. señora Susana y D. su esposo es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios. 

L. foto fue tomada en L. casa D. Rosalba L. otra integrante del grupo, se ve a las integrantes del grupo afuera D. L. casa D. doña Rosalba. ElL. se dedica a  venta D. cosméticos desD. hace 19 años. Solicita el préstamo para surtir su mercancía. Tiene 39 años, estudió hasta L. primaria, es soltera y tiene una hija.Sus vecinas D. L. comunidad L. conocen como una persona responsable y trabajadora.ElL. quisiera incrementar sus ventas en esta temporada para lograr poner su local.
texts.en:
The Las Palmas MS group is located in the city of Monte Salas, Fortin in the state of Veracruz, Mexico. The group is maD. up of 9 members.

Maria Susana G is the group president. She is 47 years old, married and has 2 children. She only studied through the 5th graD. of elementary school. For the last 20 years she has been selling banana leaves. She is taking out this loan so that she can buy more banana leaves to cook and sell. People that buy the banana leaves use them to make Oaxacan tomales that are sold in many states in Mexico. Maria Susana needs to increase her sales to continue to proviD. for her children. Her husband is currently sick and cannot work. Susana and her husband's dream is that their children finish their studies. 

This picture was taken in Rosalba's house. The members of the group are seen outsiD. of Rosalba's house. Rosalba has been selling cosmetics for the last 19 years. She is taking out this loan so that she can diversify her product line. She studied through the end of elementary school, she is single and has one daughter. Her neighbors know her as someone that is responsible and a hard worker. She wants to increase her sales this season.

loans.use: Buy banana leaves and sell them

loans.name: Rolin

texts.es: Rolin, de 21 años, es un hombre, que a pesar de los inconvenientes que tiene, lucha por salir adelante. Él, convive con Dora de 25 años, con la que tuvo un hijo; Jean Pier, de 11 meses de edad, al que cuidan con mucho amor en una casa arrendada, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Clara. A su corta, edad. ÉL tiene en claro sus objetivos, el nacimiento de su hijo le impulsa en su trabajo diario. Sus aspiraciones, se centra en la construcción de su casa propia, por ello hace 3 años que se dedica a sembrar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra, distintas variedades de papa, los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de su localidad. Pero como las fuerzas que tiene son muchas; cuenta que en sus tiempos libres trabaja en otros sembríos, las ganancias que obtiene, lo ahorra, con ello planea comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y asume, la responsabilidad de trabajar en un banco comunal, donde sus miembros son personas responsables y cumplidas. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono orgánico, para la variedad de papa “yungay”, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, los cuales cosechara en estos meses.
texts.en: Rolin, 21 years old, is a man who despite drawbacks, struggles to get ahead. He lives with Dora who is 25 years old, with whom he has a son, Jean Pier, who is 11 months old.  They care for him with much love in a rented house in the town of Santa Clara. At his young age he has very clear objectives, the birth of his son drives his daily work. His aspirations center around building his own home. Because of this, he has been planting his own agriculture for the past 3 years. He plants different varieties of potatoes, which after each harvest are sold in the central market in his area. But as the forces he has are many, he works on other crops in his free time.  With the profits obtained he saves and plans on buying his own farmland. This is his first loan with MFP, and he assumes responsibility for working in a community bank where it's members are responsible and accomplished. With the loan he receives, he will buy organic fertilizer for the "yungay" potatoes, which he will spread on the crops that he will harvest in recent months.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Phillip is a thirty-five-year-old married man, with three children. He is the breadwinner of the family living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He lives in his own house and his family dream is to see all his children have the highest levels of education. He has been in the transport business for the last twelve years as a taxi driver and has found minimal hindrances although his business dream is to have his own car. Phillip needs the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for the children.

loans.name: Jealyn

texts.en:
Jealyn S. is from the village of Pagalungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 27 years old. Jealyn is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Jealyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. She  also has transportation business using a motorela or habal-habal (a hired motorcycle which carries less than eight persons including the driver) with her husband as the driver. Jealyn has been engaged in her businesses for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jealyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jealyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to repair the transport vehicle used in the business. Jealyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Jealyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the sari-sari store business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Twizerane Group

texts.fr: Anastasie Mujanamariya est agricultrice, et elle est un membre du groupe Twizerane.  Elle a 53 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 3 enfants entre 19 ans et 25 ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 5eme primaire, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter un champ pour son agriculture, acheter 100kgs de pommes de terre, 10 kgs de mais, et aussi pour le paiement de ses travailleurs.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’acheter beaucoup des champs et cultiver les différents produits.  Elle voudrait autofinancer elle-même, et devenir une grande agricultrice dans le secteur.  Elle voudrait aussi développer sa famille, lutte contre la pauvreté, et financer les études pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Anastasie Mujanamariya is a farmer and a member of the Twizerane group. She is a 53 years old, and married with three children aged between 19 and 25. She left school after the 5th year of primary school. She will use the loan in order to purchase a field for farming, 100kg of potatoes, 10 kg of corn, and also to pay her workers. Her growth strategy for her business is to purchase a number of fields and cultivate various crops. She would like to finance the business herself and become one of the most successful farmers in the area. She would also like to see to her family's needs, fight poverty and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of a field for cultivating 100kg of potateos, 20kg of corn and paying labour cost

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia H. is from the village of Brgy. Mauan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya.  She is 58 years old. Aurelia, is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Aurelia owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community.  Aurelia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aurelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Aurelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Aurelia from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa A. is from the village of Liong, Guisiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Narcisa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Narcisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Narcisa is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like biscuits and snack foods. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Maria Teresa Albertina

texts.es: Maria Teresa Albertina: tiene 64 años. es casada tiene un hijo, ella de dedica a la elavoracion de prendas de vestir desde que tenia 15 años ella es reconosida por sus clientes por la calidad de prendas que confecciona, tambien ella se dedica a la elavoracion de uniformes escolares, todo los años a principios de año ella tiene mucha demanda de su clientes, porque le hacen pedidos por mayor, es por eso que ella solicita este credito para compra de tela para elavorar prendas de vestir, para damas, caballeros y niñoz, y uniformes escolares, el sueño de ella es poder agrandar mas su negocio y poder surtir su mercaderia a sus clientes y a si segir ayudando a su familia y salir adelante.
texts.en: Maria Teresa Albertina is 64 years old, married, and has a son.  She works making clothing and has done so since she was 15 years old.  She is well-known by her customers for the quality of the clothing that she makes.  She also makes school uniforms and at the beginning of every year, she has a lot of demand from her customers because they make wholesale orders.  This is why she is requesting this loan to purchase fabric to make the clothing for women, men and children, as well as school uniforms.  Her dream is to expand her business and to be able to stock her merchandise for her customers in order to continue to help her family and get ahead.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothing items and school uniforms

loans.name: Memusi Ole

texts.en:
Memusi Ole N. is a 41-year-old farmer. He is married and a father of six schoolchildren. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last ten years.

Memusi learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET-registered client. This will be Memusi's second loan, and he plans to use the entire loan amount to prepare land for planting and to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his twenty acres of maize. He plans to use the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of the loan to develop his own plot of land and to lease more land for farming so he can increase his maize output.

Memusi's dream is to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant maize on a large scale.  Memusi is punctilious, and with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To prepare land for planting and to buy chemicals and fertilizer for twenty acres of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes for the upcoming season

loans.name: Nelson Edgardo

texts.es:
Nelson M. quiere agradecer a los financiadores de Kiva y dice: “gracias Kiva por el apoyo a mi taller, porque se logró dar un paso adelante en el proyecto de la prendería” . Nelson recibirá su segundo credikiva y está muy satisfecho porque con él comprará materiales para elaborar nuevas joyas y accesorios  especialmente en oro y plata y también reparará su mesón de trabajo que se encuentra algo deteriorado. Con su anterior financiamiento compró una máquina de galvanotecnia para baños en oro y el motortul para pulir las prendas. Si usted quiere ampliar la historia de Nelson ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/180041
texts.en:
Nelson M. would like to thank Kiva lenders.  He says "Thank you Kiva for the support that you have given my workshop.  It has enabled me to take a step forward in my jewelry business".

Nelson is receiving his second Kiva loan and he is very satisfied because he will use it to buy materials for making new jewelry and accessories, especially in gold and silver.  He will also mend his work counter which is in a fairly bad state of repair.  He used his previous loan to buy an electroplating machine for making gold plating and a 'mototool' for polishing pieces of jewelry.  If you would like to know more about Nelson's story, click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/180041.

loans.use: to buy materials for making new jewelry and accessories, especially in gold and silver

loans.name: Silvia Ines

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Atahualpa Valle D. los Incas en el distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura. Vive en la parte rural D. este distrito y aún no cuentan con los servicios básicos como luz o agua.

Silvia se dedica a la crianza D. aves D. corral los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Realiza esta actividad en una parte posterior D. su casa. También se dedica a la agricultura contando con un pequeño terreno agrícola donD. siembra limón. Cuenta con más D. 10 años D. experiencia en estas actividades. 

Silvia planea usar su crédito para la compra D. alimentos balanceados para el engorD. D. ganado, con la finalidad D. obtener un buen peso y tamaño D. sus animales y venderlos a un mejor precio. También invertirá su crédito en la compra D. abono y equipo para el mantenimiento y poda D. su cultivo D. limón. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 500 nuevos soles. Silvia quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos y lograr mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is 58 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in her own home in the village of Atahualpa Valle D. Los Incas in the rural section of the District of TambogranD.-Piura. Silvia and her family do not receive basic services such as electricity or water.

She raises and fattens poultry to sell later at the local market. These animals are kept in an area behind her house. Silvia also cultivates a small plot of land where she grows limes. She has been engaging in these business activities for more than ten years.

Silvia plans to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals in hopes that they attain a good weight and size so that she can sell them at a good price. In addition, she will invest in the purchase of compost and equipment to maintain and prune her lime trees. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Silvia wants to continue growing her business so that she can increase her income and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for her birds and compost for her lime trees.

loans.name: Alou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alou Traoré est un homme marié de 32 ans et père de 5 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, très vite il commença des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté plusieurs activités, mais sans succès.C’est ainsi qu’il décida de mener des activités d’achat et de vente de poissons de mer qu’il a appris auprès de son ami. Avec une expérience de10 ans il maitrise bien son activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de commerce, il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 20 cartons de poissons de mer.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et la vente se fait au marché de Torakabougou.
Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. Il est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
Avec ce prêt il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il compte rembourser les intérêt du prêt, améliorer son entreprise et aider son père à assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Alou Traoré is a 32-year-old married man and father of five children. He lives with his wife and children in his father’s home in the district of Torakabougou, in Bougouni.
