He did not attend school, but started to earn a living at an early age. He attempted several activities without success. He eventually became involved in the purchase and sale of fish, a trade learned from his friend. With ten years of experience, he has a good command of his activity. 

In need of working capital, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to purchase 20 cartons of fish. He stocks up in Bamako and conducts his sales at the Torakabougou market. His clientele is composed mostly of women. 

This is his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having repaid the first one without problems. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which he will use to pay the interest on the loan, improve his business, and help his father with the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Madalene

texts.en:
Madalene is 35 years old. She has two children who are 2 ½  and 4 ½ years old. Her husband is a driver. 

She sells food stuffs. She has done this business for one year and this business has enabled her meet her family needs.She wishes to start up a clothes business as well.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes in addition to the food stuffs she sells.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jaime De Jesús

texts.es:
Jaime de Jesús A. G. es un luchador incansable pues además de trabajar por días en algunos restaurantes del municipio de Santa Bárbara al suroeste de Antioquia como mesero, en la parte trasera de su casa ubicó algunos corrales para el engorde de cerdos, negocio que le ha permitido mejorar los ingresos para él, su esposa y su hija y aunque como él mismo lo afirma no son muchas las ganancias por lo menos tiene la tranquilidad de contar con los recursos para cubrir sus necesidades básicas. 

Poder construir un mejor corral donde pueda ampliar el número de cerdos de engorde con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos para brindarle a su hija la oportunidad de estudiar en la universidad es el sueño de este emprendedor que trabaja día a día para lograrlo. 

Actualmente, Jaime de Jesús necesita de un préstamo para comprar concentrado para alimentar sus cerdos lo que le permitirá nutrirlos mejor y así recibir un mejor pago por ellos.
texts.en:
Jaime de Jesús A. G. is an untiring fighter who, aside from working days as a Waiter in some of the restaurants in Santa Bárbara in southwest Antioquia, has also set up some corrals in his back yard to raise pigs, a business that has allowed him to improve income for himself, his wife and his daughter and, like he himself states, profits aren’t many but at least he has the peace of mind knowing that he can count on sufficient resources to meet basic needs.

To build a better corral to increase the number of pigs he raises with the goal in mind of improving income to provide his daughter with the opportunity to go to university, this entrepreneur works hard daily to attain this dream.

Currently, Jaime de Jesús needs a loan to buy concentrated pig feed that will lead to improved nutrition and better prices for them.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. One of the major challenges that Mwanaidi faces in her business is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business and increasing her stock in the future.

With her loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of mangoes, tomatoes, potatoes, and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of mangoes, tomatoes, potatoes, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 34 year old married man and father of two  children, living and working in Bint Jbeil.  Moustafa has worked in hardware selling since 2005. His business has expanded through the years and his customers are increasing more and more.  Moustafa needs to increase his capital, in order to fulfill his customers needs and requests. To do so, Moustafa has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner. This is Moustafa's third cycle with Al Majmoua. All his previous loans have had a positive impact on his business, and he has been a good standing borrower. 

Moustafa hopes to improve his business more and buy a new truck, in addition to providing his family the best living.

loans.use: To increase his Capital

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia forma parte del banco comunal “Esperanza para todos”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Ella se dedica a la preparación de comida rápida específicamente, empanadas, papas fritas, entre otros alimentos. Lidia prepara todos los alimentos en su casa y los fríe en un carrito ubicado cerca de su casa. Durante las mañanas se dedica a realizar las compras de mercadería, durante la tarde prepara los alimentos y en la noche se dedica a freír y vender su comida preparada. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 5 años.
El crédito lo invirtió en uso personal, específicamente una impresora para el estudio de su hijo y para su negocio compró mercadería.
Sus metas son seguir creciendo en su negocio y sacar un permiso que le permita tener una mayor tranquilidad para vender sus productos.
Ella vive junto a su hijo de 20 años y uno de sus nietos de 9 años de edad, Lidia es el único ingreso económico familiar. Su hijo está estudiando ingeniería en prevención de riesgos, en la universidad, por lo tanto Lidia debe costear las mensualidades de los estudios de su hijo. 
Su sueño es que su hijo termine su carrera y sea independiente económicamente. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos otorgados por fondo esperanza.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Communal Bank “Esperanza para Todos” (Hope for All) which is in the city of Valparaíso. She prepares fast food such as empanadas, French fries, and other snacks. Lidias prepares the food at home and then fries it at her cart located near her house. She buys her supplies every morning and then spends the afternoon preparing food. At night, she fries the food she has prepared before selling it. Lidia has been in business for five years.

Part of this loan will be designated for personal use, since she will buy a printer for her son to use in his studies. The rest of the money will be used to buy supplies for her business. Her goals are to continue growing her business and to acquire a permit so that she can sell her products with greater peace of mind. Lidia lives with her 20-year-old son and one of her grandchildren who is 9 years old. She is the only breadwinner in her family. Her son is studying engineering and risk management at the university, so she is responsible for paying his monthly tuition. Lidia’s dreams include seeing her son finish his degree and become financially independent. She is pleased with and appreciative of the loans from Fondo Esperanza.

Valparaíso is situated 120 kilometers northwest of Santiago. It is the regional capital and seat of the national legislature. Valparaíso is the main port of Chile and offers a wide variety of beautiful and picturesque places to visit, such as the home of poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her food business and a printer for her son.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is age 36 and married with five children who all attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and employs two farmhands. Her mixed farm produces vegetables, maize and beans which are all sold locally. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of poultry.

Zipporah has made a loan request of 41,200 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that with the dairy cow she will acquire, her family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra proceeds from the sale of milk will help improve her family's living standards. 

Her major challenges have been diseases and insufficient animal feeds which affects her production. She plans to improve both her poultry and dairy farm in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El Sr. Leonardo es una persona que labora en una compañía desde hace ya diez años, el y su apreciable esposa viven   solos   ya  que  sus   hijos  han  formado  su  propia  familia ,  día  con  día   se  han esforzado  para    comprar   su  vivienda y  en esta  ocasión  ellos  requieren  acondicionar  su  domicilio ya que  desean  instalar  la  barda  a su  hogar, agradecen  el  apoyo para  la realización de su proyecto  ya  que  ven  en  el  crédito la  posibilidad   de   ver  realizado  su sueño    y  de  proteger  su  vivienda.
texts.en: Leonardo has worked at his company for 10 years now. He and his esteemed wife live alone now that their children have their own families. They have worked hard day after day to buy their home and now they need to fix it up. They want to install a high fence around the house.  They are thankful for the support to make this project happen since they can see that this loan gives them the possibility to see their dream realized and to protect their home.

loans.use: to build a fence around their home.

loans.name: Esmeraldo

texts.en:
Despite hardships in life, Esmeraldo strives hard and sacrifices a lot to earn his living. He is 55 years old and has four adult-age children. He has worked as a farmer and a hog-raiser for almost 15 years earning a net profit of about P8,000 (~$200) per month.

He is asking for a loan of P8,000 to be used in buying feeds and vitamins for the pigs to sustain their growth and development. He hopes that through patience and hard work, he can raise and sell more pigs and increase his income to support his family needs and save for their future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with three children; one attends school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a carpentry business, selling to her neighbours. She also does farming, her other source of income. Her major challenge is seasonality in the business. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to expand her business to sell wholesale and purchase lumber. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To expand her business to sell wholesale and purchase lumber.

loans.name: Nisa

texts.en:
Nisa  is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Nisa  has a shop where she sells bananas and other fruits. She has had this business for 6 years and has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy bananas and other fruits for resale.

Nisa became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and other fruits for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old, married to Joyce. They have been blessed with seven children. He has been selling milk for six years. He has been loaned KES.30,000 to purchase more goats for rearing.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to open a ranch in the near future. He hopes to be the best cattle dealer in Kitengela.

loans.use: To buy more goats for rearing

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en la parcialidad de Vaquería,  distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está  separada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos son independientes.  Cuenta con educación primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, con su primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles compró tres unidades de ovinos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles comprará seis ovinos para su respectivo engorde por dos-tres meses.  Ella trabaja sola en el negocio, los animales los compra  y vende en la localidad de Ilave.
La señora desea tener ganados mejorados para incrementar su ganancia.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y la unión entre las socias.
texts.en:
Petrona is a member of “Central Vaquería”, a Communal Bank of Vaquería, a neighborhood located in Ilave, a district of the El Collao province in the Puno department. She is 42 years old, she is separated and has 3 children, 2 of them economically independent. She has a primary level education.
She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year, and with her first loan of 500.00 PEN she has bought three sheep.
She is now requesting a new loan of 1,000.00 PEN, and she will use it to buy six sheep to fatten them for two or three months. She runs her activity alone, and she buys and sells the animals in the Ilave community.
She wants to improve her animals to increase her income.
What she likes about the Communal Bank is the easy access to loans and the unity among its members.

loans.use: To buy six sheep.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Rocio nació en la ciudad de Arequipa y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Salvación del departamento de Madre de Dios.   

La señora Rocio tiene 30 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene una oficina de radio transferencia donde las personas realizan envíos de dinero y otras  cosas más, ella también se dedica a la venta de cerveza, gaseosas, helados, salchipapas y gas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Rocio requiere el préstamo para comprar un carrito salchipapero. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 
La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en: Rocio was born in the town of Arequipa and currently lives in the town of Salvación, in Madre de Dios department. Rocio is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband. She has one son. Rocio is a hard-working mother who supports her family. She has a wire transfer office where people send money transfers. She also sells beer, soda, iced treats, salchipapas (traditional Peruvian fast food) and gas. She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well. On this occasion, Rocio needs a loan to buy a cart for selling 'salchipapas'. The 'Nueva Generación' community bank meet once a month in the town of Salvación. The depths of the rainforest in Madre de Dios are home to many natural riches. The forests offer an abundance of remarkable beauty. In the large and mysterious forests of Madre de Dios, animals abound. The rainforest is crossed by majestic rivers where it is possible to sail in canoes or boats.

loans.use: to buy a cart for selling 'salchipapas'

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Electine

texts.en: Electine is 26 years old and married.  To earn a living, she runs a cafeteria.  She has been in the business for two years and has employed four people.  She also relies on her husband for support in the business.  Through Faulu Kenya's trainings on financial management, she has also learned how to manage her finances.  This has helped her to improve her business. Her desire is to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as beans, maize and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as beans, maize and maize flour.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 58 years old,married with five children. She is from Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur.
Nenita owns and operates a  fish selling business  to earn a living and had this business for more than 30 years. Each month, she earns Php 10,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 20,000.00 to purchase additional fish to sell.

Nenita has been a member of GDMPC for almost 2 years. Nenita wants to improve the general living conditions of her family and also to  educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Vivian Yolany

texts.es:
Vivian Yolany, de 21 años de edad, casada, con un hijo de un año  de edad, vive en la Esperanza Intibucá, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada.

Hace mas de cuatro años que se dedica al negocio de venta de variedades, como Ropa, calzado,  cosméticos  y  accesorios  para damas de plata y enchapado. Su negocio lo inicio con ayuda del esposo. Es estable y esta ubicado en una buena zona comercial. 
Este préstamo es el primero que solicita y es para surtir de más productos para vender, como Ropa nueva y calzado.
Su meta es hacer crecer mas este negocio, para mejorar su  situación económica y en un futuro comprar su propia vivienda, ya que donde viven es una casa familiar.
texts.en:
Vivian Yolany is 21 years old, married, and has a one-year-old child. She lives in Esperanza Intibucá. Her husband works for a private company.

For the past four years, she has been managing a variety store where she sells clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and women’s accessories made of silver and metal plating. She started this business with help from her husband. Her business is stable and located in a commercial area.

This is the first loan she has requested and she will use the money to restock her store with more products to sell, such as clothing and shoes. Her goal is to grow her business even more so that she can improve her financial situation and her future. She wants to buy her own home since she currently lives at a relative’s house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Naana

texts.en: Naana sells wakye (a spiced rice and bean dish), rice, and stew at Kwahinkrom. She has been selling wakye and rice for the past ten years now. Naana is married to a farmer and has four children. She assists her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, beans, and fish. Naana will use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans, and fish.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 51 years old and has nine children between the ages of 8 and 32. She sells cassava in a store she has run for 30 years. She would like a loan to buy a plantation of cassava to sell in her shop. Any profits will be used to provide for her family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cassava for sale.

loans.name: Efracia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Efracia;  La socia tiene 34 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 2hijos; La socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la socia administra y trabaja en la tienda vendiendo todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y un poco de librería, la socia trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche de corrido, la socia desea implementar su tienda y comprar al por mayor productos ya que estos meses se han incrementado mucho ella desea abastecer a sus clientes y para ello requiere el préstamo para comprar al por mayor y vender. La socia comprara arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, harinas, leche, panetones, entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de abrrotes.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Introducing Efracia, a member of ”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORA, a Communal Bank located in the Ccorao district, Cala province and Cusco department.
Efracia is 34 years old, she is married and she has 2 children. She runs a general store. She manages and works in the store selling any kind of basic necessities as well as some stationery items. She begins at 6 am and works all day long until 10 pm; she wants to implement her shop and to buy products at wholesale price, as in these last few months her sales have increased a lot and she wants to satisfy her customers. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy products at wholesale price and then sell them. She will buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil, flour, milk, panetone bread and other products. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of products for her general store.
She is grateful for this loans and she commits to complying with repaying her dues in accordance with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy  rice, sugar, noodles, oil, flour, milk, panetone bread and other products for her general store.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte vendiendo materiales de construcción. El siempre ha sido un padre responsable que se preocupa por su familia el arduo trabajo que realiza le ha brindado alimento, vestimenta y educación a su hijo. El solicita este crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, bloques, zinc, clavos entre otros las mejoras que quiere realizar en su vivienda son de acondicionar un cuarto, pues desde hace tiempo quería hacerlo y porque no tenía el capital suficiente para realizar las mejoras.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel dedicates himself to providing transportation services selling construction supplies.  He has always been a responsible father who cares for his family.  The hard work he carries out has provided food, clothing and an education for his son.

He requests this loan to buy cement, sand, cinder blocks, zinc, nails and other supplies.  Among the improvements he would like to make to his house is  the completion of a room. This is something he has wanted to do for some time, but has not had enough capital.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, cinder blocks, zinc, and nails, among other items.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Analiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary wants a loan to buy chicken feed. She is a widow aged 51 years and lives in Masindi, Uganda. Mary is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her three children. She started with 10 chicks seven years ago, but now has 300 birds. Her desire is to educate her children and her dream is to diversify her business and buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 13 years, Amina has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, rice, bread, toothpaste, detergent, oil, Vaseline, and battery cells. 

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, rice, bread, toothpaste, detergent, oil, and Vaseline, and will help Amina to generate greater profits and improve on her stock. Amina hopes that in the future she will be able to boost her business. 

Amina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, bread, tooth paste, detergent, oil, and Vaseline

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero O. is a 54 years old woman with five (5) children who lives in a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, has no formal knowledge of the business but started her own business in the year 1981. She needs the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, beads and baby things for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to purchase a hybrid dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more feed for his cows

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en: Lubov is an experienced entrepreneur, having had her own business for thirteen years. She currently has a small kiosk where she sells children’s clothing and door lock sets. Lubov is divorced and has raised her nineteen-year-old son almost entirely by herself. Her business has been a vital source of funds for them to live on. After graduating from college, her son had difficulty finding a job so she helped support him financially. Aside from meeting her own basic needs, Lubov would like to see her business provide the means to help her son get established in life. She has requested a loan of $200 to purchase some seasonal children’s clothing. She hopes that the summer time will be profitable for her business and it will bring in necessary income.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Mashavu Yange And

texts.en: Mashavu Yange (right) is 55 and A. S. is 29 (they call themselves Songambele) and they are business partners who have been working together for the past 4 years. They both sell used clothes and traditional attire (commonly know as vitenge), and both have received business training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. Together they want to open up a bigger shop in the Buguruni area which they will share to sell their items. Together they are in need of USD700, which they will share equally so as to achieve their goal.

loans.use: Asha and Mashavu would like to expand their businesses selling clothes.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a dedicated 38-year old community health worker (CHW).  She is a widow and lives in Rongo town with her three children.  Through her own initiative and hard work and aided by one previous KMET microfinance loan, Linet managed to expand her business and build a successful community pharmacy.  She moved her business to a more prominent and spacious location (pictured) three years ago in order to meet growing demands.  Her friendly demeanor and approach to her clients and customers has earned her respect and a good reputation.  The community likes her work and has grown accustomed to her, thus ensuring the successful continuity of her business.  Linet requires US $800 in order to further expand her pharmacy, purchase drugs in bulk in order to boost her profits; and partly pay school fees for her children’s’ continuing education.

loans.use: Expand and purchase more stock of drugs

loans.name: Agakarim

texts.en: Agakarim is a 26 year old single man who lives in Khachmaz town. He has 5 years of experience in the business of building houses. Now he needs a loan of $600 to buy necessary materials for building the houses.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for building the houses

loans.name: Kosimboeva

texts.en:
Kosimboeva S. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has 5 children.  Kosimboeva S. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and she recommended herself as a serious and strongly-motivated client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Loan sums are continually increased, which shows business stability and income increase.  

Mrs. Kosimboeva S. is very experienced in this business (about 14 years) and it is the family business.  She is engaged in the business of the livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out.  She dreams to purchase a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and sour-milk goods production (she supplies it to the bazaars).  It is planned to include in the assortment the following milk and sour-milk products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc.

Now Mrs. Kosimboeva S. requests a loan of $900 for business development that will permit her to significantly increase the family income and improve the existing business.  It will also increase the family income and permit her to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en: Hafiz S. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 30 years old and married. He rents a small food-market in Beylagan, and he started this business two years ago. Hafiz needs a loan in the amount of $350 to purchase more kinds of goods and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
As a fifth year member of TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 34 years old, has borrowed and successfully repaid many loans. Since the market is right close to her house, Mrs. H. opens a butcher store. Her work is developing quite well. When Mrs. H. is free, she also makes and sells mats, so that her income is very stable. Her two children are still in school. She spends a lot of time taking care of her children. This time she wants to borrow 400USD to buy pork for her store. Her income from the store is 200USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Là thành viên năm thứ 5, chị Nguyễn Thị Hòa, 34 tuổi, đã trải qua nhiều vòng vốn. Chợ ở ngay gần nhà, chị Hòa tận dụng lợi thế này để mở một quầy bán thịt lợn. Công việc buôn bán rất phát triển, những thời gian nhàn rỗi chị lại đan chiếu bán nên thu nhập hàng ngày rất đều đặn. Các con chị 2 cháu còn đang độ tuổi đi học, chị Hòa cũng rất chăm lo và đầu tư cho con. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 400USD đầu tư mau lợn về thịt. Thu nhập bình quân từ bán thịt lợn là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supply her business with merchandise

loans.name: Argash

texts.ru:
Argash R. lives in the Jomi region. He is 52 years old, is married and has 7 children. He works in agriculture and farms. Argash plants wheat. Right now he needs to pay rent for his land, but he cannot afford to pay it before he collects his harvest. Argash would like to get a loan to pay the rent. He will pay back the loan over a 10 month period. The loan will help his family to solve their difficult situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Равшанов Эргаш житель района Джоми. Возраст 52 года , он женат и имеет 7 детей. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. Засеивает землю пшеницей. Сейчас ему необходимо оплатить аренду за землю. Но пока он не собрал урожай его финансовое положение не позволяет ему оплатить аренду. Поэтому сейчас он хочет получить кредит. Погасить его он сможет в течении 10 мох. Кредит поможет его семье выйти ихз трудного положения.

loans.use: Rent land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase special equipment for handling milk

loans.name: Surita

texts.en: Surita I., 32, is married with three children. She has many years of experience in the handicrafts business and her husbands helps her with the business. She sells to the village and general public 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~$250 USD). SPBD loans are Surita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve her crafts business and help out with family expenses.

loans.use: Surita would like to upgrade her crafts business and help repair her family's house.

loans.name: Thi Quang's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. D. Thi Quang (ID Number 040001) is an enthusiastic member of the Women Society. She is also very active in doing business. That is why she joined the SEDA Fund T. expand her inventory for her business. Currently, her family also makes ropes, thus the income is quite stable. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Cu (ID Number 040002), borrows 3,186,000VND T. produce toilet paper
  • Mrs. T. Thi Lan (ID Number 040003), borrows 3,186,000VND T. sell confectionery
  • Mrs. C. Thi Lien (ID Number 040004), borrows 3,186,000VND T. sell wooden furniture
  • Mrs. D. Thi Thuy (ID Number 040005), borrows 3,186,000VND T. buy scrap materials T. sell
  • Mr. V. Van Quy (ID Number 040006), borrows 2,006,000VND T. produce rice papers
  • The total amount requested is 1,100.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    chị Dương thị Quang MS 040001 là một cán bộ hội phụ nữ rất nang động, ngoài hoạt động xã hội ra, chị còn rất năng động trong việc làm kinh tế. Chính vì vậy mà chị tham ra vay vốn của chương trình để có thêm nguồn vốn để kinh doanh, hiện tại gia đình chị làm thêm nghề đan dây thừng, mức thu nhập cũng khá ổn định. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Cừ MS 040002 vay mức 3.186000 VND để sản xuất giấy vệ sinh
  • chị Tô thị Lan MS 040003 vay mức 3.186000 VND để kinh doanh kẹo bánh
  • chị C. thị Liên MS 040004 vay mức 3.186000 VND để kinh doanh đồ gỗ
  • chị Đặng thị Thuỷ MS 040005 vay mức 3.186000 VND để mua sắt vụn
  • anh Vũ văn Quý MS040006 vay mức 2.006000 VND để tráng bánh đa nem

loans.use: Invest in retail activities

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is 53 years old and a former teacher. Her one daughter is now an independent adult. Mercedes lives with her husband Pedro, who is also an active teacher and farmer. She now gives reinforcement classes, as well has helping her husband with the farming duties, scattering corn or different grains depending on the season. When their product is ready, Pedro gives it to Mercedes, and she is then in charge of contacting a buyer. They have been doing this for 2 years, and enjoy it! It gives them to the chance to gain experience and socialise with others. With the loan money, she wants to buy more grain to scatter, as well as build a shelter (with a roof made of branches and sticks to block out the sun) for her small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Mercedes, de 53 años, es profesora cesada, madre de una hija mayor e independiente, ahora vive con su esposo Pedro, quien es también profesor (activo) y agricultor. Ahora ella se dedica al dictado clases de reforzamiento, adicionalmente ayuda a su esposo en las tareas agrícolas, siembran de maíz o diferentes granos de acuerdo a la temporada. Cuando el producto está lista, Pedro se lo entrega a Mercedes, ella es la encargada de contactar a un comprador. Esto lo vienen realizando desde hace 2 años, lo que le gusta, es ganar experiencia y socializar con otras personas. Con el dinero del préstamo, quiere comprar granos para sembrar, como también mandar a construir una ramada (techo hecho a base de ramas y palos para protegerse del sol) en su chacra.

loans.use: To buy grain and to build a shelter made of branches to protect their land from the sun.

loans.name: Alma Gloria

texts.es:
Alma inició el negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante y ayudar a su mamá ya que tiene una enfermedad que no la deja moverse y es por eso que ella vende ropa. Comenzó vendiendo ropa en su casa y poco a poco se fue metiendo a los mercados rodantes y es así como a podido mantener a su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $925 que pagara en 6 meses resurtir mercancía de temporada.
texts.en:
Alma started her business out of necessity and to help her mother afflicted with an illness that doesn't permit her to freely move. This is why she started selling clothing. She started selling clothes from her home and slowly but surely she started selling in the markets around the area and this is how she managed to support her family.

She requires a loan in the amount of $925, which will be repaid in 6 months. With these funds she wants to restock her merchandise with seasonal clothing.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim P. is a villager in Samraong Village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns 2 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile, which badly affects her crop. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Sim P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Mon Vuth, assists his wife with the agriculture. Mrs. Sim P. is 36 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer, while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria T., a 38-year-old trader, is married with three children. All her children are currently in school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family. Victoria supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing.  She has been in this business for the past five years. In Ghana, brand new clothes are very expensive, so selling used clothing has created opportunities for many women. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children's future and also to rent a store in which to trade. She is member of the group called Saints. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 39 years old and married, with 4 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She started this business in 2003. She is requesting a loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: La Sra.: Martha, es una diligente madre preocupada por mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Comerciante de 32 años de edad, casada con tres hijos, habitante del Barrio La Fuente en la ciudad de Managua se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdo desde hace dos años se unió al negocio de la familia ya que su mamá inicio con el destace y venta de cerdo. Sus planes son apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y que estos tengan un futuro mejor. Como también llegar a tener un criadero de cerdos más grande y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias. Para llevar a cabo el cumplimiento de sus metas esta solicitando un  préstamo con un periodo de devolución de ocho meses, que  le permitirá la comprar de tres cerdos para destace y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, gracias a la ayuda que le brinda AFODENIC, podrá lograr cumplir sus metas
texts.en:
Señora Martha is a diligent mother who is concerned about improving her family's quality of life. She is a merchant, is 32, is married with 3 kids, and lives in the La Fuente neighborhood in Managua. She has bought and sold pigs for 2 years. She joined her family's business since her mom started butchering and selling pigs. Her plans are to support her children in their education so they can have a better future. She would like to have a larger pig farm some day and in this way increase her profits. To accomplish her goals, she is requesting a loan with a repayment period of 8 months, which will allow her to buy 3 pigs to raise and cover the demand of her customers. Thanks to the help that AFODENIC is offering her, she will be able to accomplish her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Nia Moja Group

texts.en:
Siasa is a breads seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She has done this work for seven years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80, working each day for 12 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more breads for her business. She is hoping that through this loan she will be able to expand her business, improve her home and pay school fees for her children. Siasa is 46 years old, married, and has three children, 19, 16 and 12 years old. She also cares for one additional dependent.

Siasa will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Bibie, Mwanaisha and Amina. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more breads for her business.

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es: Yudy tiene 22 años de edad, vive hace 3 años con su pareja, y hace tres años migró al pueblo llamado Huasahuasi donde vive en una casa alquilada. Luego que su padre fuera a trabajar de peón a las chacras del pueblo de Huasahuasi (zona denominada “Capital de la papa del Perú”), notó que no habían negocios de comida, como por ejemplo desayunos para los agricultores; entonces de regreso a su hogar comunicó a su familia la idea de ser pioneros en la venta de comida; como jugos de maca, quinua, leche y sándwich diversos, para de ese modo captar ganancias para su economía. Se inició con una carreta pequeña preparando desayunos al paso, logrando una  buena aceptación, debido a ello, su madre migró hacia ese lugar y puso otra carreta, pero esta vez de guisos. Es así que Yudy sigue con el negocio familiar que en todo este tiempo le ha resultado muy rentable, por ello empieza su actividad de dos y media a cinco de la mañana, instalándose en el parque de la zona, donde todos sus clientes la esperan, hasta las diez de la mañana que es cuando termina con la venta. Yudy se siente muy contenta con su negocio, sus metas próximas son de aperturar un nuevo negocio con la venta de bebidas en un local alquilado. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y le han delegado el cargo de vocal, que promete cumplir con mucha responsabilidad, del mismo modo hace el compromiso de pagar todas sus cuotas en las fechas programadas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de harina de maca y de soya para sus mates y jugos, y otra parte la usará para iniciar su negocio de venta de bebidas.
texts.en:
Yudy is 22 years old and has lived with her partner for the past 3 years. She migrated to a town called Huasahuasi 3 years ago, where she lives in a rented house. When her father went to work as a labourer in the farmland of Huasahuasi (a region known as the potato capital of Peru), she noted that there weren't any businesses selling meals, for example breakfast for the farmers. When she returned home she told her family her idea that they could be pioneers in the sale of food, including the juice of maca (a nutritionally rich root vegetable which grows in the high mountains of Peru), quinoa, milk and a variety of sandwiches. In this way they could gain income. She started with a small cart preparing quick breakfasts. Achieving a good response, her mother then migrated to the town to run another cart, but this time selling stews. It is in this way that Yudy continues with the family business that has been very profitable during all of this time. She starts working between 2.30am and 5.00am, locating her cart in the neighbourhood park where all her customers wait for her. She works through until 10.00am, when she finishes her sales for the day. Yudy is very happy with her business. Her goal for the near future is to open a new business selling drinks in a rented shopfront. This is her first loan with MFP, and she has been delegated the role of a member, and is committed to responsibly fulfilling this role. In the same manner she is committed to making all of her repayments on the designated dates. The money she is seeking is to purchase maca flour and soy for her hot drinks and juices, while she will use another part of the money to start her new business selling drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her meals and invest in her new business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sukepen

texts.id:
Modal usaha yang didapat melalui lembaga yang ada didesanya lewat kerja sama dengan Yayasan Dinari sedang berjalan untuk yang kedua kalinya.Modal ini sangat dibutuhkan untuk menujang sarana dalam usahanya sebagai pembuat banten untuk sembayang adat Bali.

           Untuk memenuhi dan melengkapi bahan baku. Hampir setiap hari Ketut Sukepen belanja aneka macam  bunga, janur di pasar untuk keperluan usahanya.pengeluaran untuk usaha canang cari dalam satu hari mencapai Rp.50.000,- dan memperoleh pendapatan bersih sekitar Rp.20.000,- .dari usaha inilah Ketut Sukepen dapat membantu menambah pendapatan suaminya Komang Tersen yang sebagai seorang tukang bangunan.  Selain melayani acara sembahyang kecil yang dilakukan setiap hari,Ni Ketut Sukepen juga melayani pembuatan banten secara paket besar seperti odalan merajan,otonan,galungan dan kuningan.biasanya pesanan dalam pakaet besar satu bulan hanya dua sampai tiga kali,dan keuntungan dapat mencapai Rp.300.000 s/d Rp.500.000,-
texts.en:
Business funding received through the village agency by way of cooperation with Dinari Foundation is the second time around. This funding is necessary as a means in her business as ‘banten’ maker for the Balinese traditional prayer. To attain and equip with raw materials, almost everyday Ketut Sukepen buys a variety of flowers, young coconut palm fronds from the market for the business needs. Daily expenditure for the business is approximately Rp.50.000,- and the attainable net income is about Rp.20.000,- from this effort. Ketut Sukepen is able to supplement her husband’s, Komang Tersen, earnings as a construction craftsman. Besides serving small prayer ceremonies daily, Ni Ketut Sukepen also serves ‘banten’ making on the large package method for ceremonies/festivals like Odalan Merajan, Otonan, Galungan and Kuningan, usually the large package method orders are limited to two or three times a month, and earnings attained range from Rp.300.000,- to 500.000,-

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: be the capital

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios L. is a 52-year-old mother of eight. Her husband, Rudy, is a farmer.  She worked very hard to raise her big family.  Despite the many difficulties she encountered, she was able to send three of her children to college, two to high school, and three to elementary school.  She always has had hopes of getting out of poverty, the very reason why she wants all her children to finish their studies. 

Remedios applied for this loan to buy one piglet, pig feed, and assorted foods for her variety store. She dreams of putting up a bigger piggery in the future and being able to get a stall in the market for her store.

loans.use: To support a piggery and a variety store.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es: A sus 51 años, Micaela ha luchado mucho para sobresalir en la vida, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Alipio de 48 años y sus 4 hijos; Guido de 18, David de 16, Hilbert de 24 y Gladys de 26, a los que desea, con todas sus fuerzas, tengan un futuro más prometedor. Micaela tiene 10 años trabajando en la crianza de ganado, se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para sacar a pastar a sus animales, los cuales cría con mucho cariño y dedicación, ya que sabe que de la buena crianza depende la ganancia que obtendrá por venderlos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es caminar por los inmensos verdes campos por donde pastea a su ganado. Micaela espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y así aumentar sus ingresos, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que llevar las reses hasta Huancane, que es donde vende su ganado, aun así ella está dispuesta a trabajar duro con tal de mejorar su vida. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los 500 soles solicitados planea incrementar el monto necesario para poder comprar un toro, el cual le costará al rededor de 3000 mil soles.
texts.en:
Micaela, 51 years old, has worked very hard to excel in life, and she believes that those who have dreams and pursue them with all their energy will have a more promising future. She lives in her own home with her husband Alipio, 48, and her four children, Guido, 18, David, 16, Hilbert, 24, and Gladys, 26.

For ten years, Micaela has worked raising cattle. She gets up at five in the morning to let her animals out to pasture, and what she likes most about her work is walking in the vast green fields where her animals graze. She raises her animals with much care and dedication, and she knows that this effort results in better prices when she sells them. Micaela hopes to increase the number of animals she has and thereby increase her income. Although she is willing to work hard to improve her life, what she likes least about her work is having to take her cattle all the way to Huancane in order to sell them.

This is Micaela's first loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is committed to being on-time with her repayment. She feels a responsibility to the other members of her community bank, where she is very respected due to the level of organization she brings to their meetings.

She will use this loan for 500 Peruvian nuevos soles as a down payment on a bull, which will cost about 3,000 nuevos soles.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
La señora Hermenegilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Fronterizas” ubicado en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (1ro de secundaria).  Vive en la Av. Panamericana s/n.
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos  soles. La señora Hermenegilda se dedica a la venta de golosinas.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará galletas, dulces, enlatados, gaseosas, caramelos y otras golosinas,  para aumentar su negocio.
Desea que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.  Mas adelante ella piensa poner una distribuidora de golosinas al por mayor y bien surtida, pero necesita mas capital.
A la señora Hermenegilda le gusta las facilidades que brinda Manuela Ramos y los ahorros.  También le gusta las charlas que les imparten a manera de capacitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hermenegilda is a member of the Community Bank “Las Fronterizas” located in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito Province, in the Department of Puno. She is 36 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children. She did not complete her secondary studies (just the first part of secondary school). She lives on Panamericana Avenue. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organisation for three years. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles. Mrs. Hermenegilda sells sweets for a living. With this loan of 1,000 soles she will buy biscuits, sweets, canned items, fizzy drinks, caramels and other sweets that will increase her business. She would like both of her children to be successful professionals. In the future she is planning to be a well-stocked, wholesale sweet distributer, but she needs more capital. Mrs. Hermenegilda likes the facilities and savings offered by Manuela Ramos. She also likes the training lectures.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy biscuits, sweets, fizzy drinks, canned items, caramels, etc.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn Y. is from the village of Duanguican, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Ginalyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ginalyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While it is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Ginalyn has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ginalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ginalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Ginalyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan Ginalyn has taken out through PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Señor De Lagunas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Los Andes, a este pertenece la asociación “Señor de Lagunas”, formada por trece mujeres.
Un grupo muy alegre que  junto  a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con mucha responsabilidad en actividades internas del centro.
La mayoría de las integrantes de  este grupo se dedican comercialización de ropa, por ejemplo Vicky vende pantalones para todas las edades, otras de  ellas se dedican a la venta de chamarras, ropa para invierno, ropa para niños y bebes, además también elaboran y venden comida. 
Solicitan mayores créditos con el fin de ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, de este modo sus ganancias serán mayores,  con el único de objetivo de mejorar el estilo de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The thirteen women who make up the Señor de Lagunas Association are all members of the Los Andes Community Center, which is located in the city of El Alto. It is a very cheerful group that works very responsibly on the center's internal activities in cooperation with its loan officer. Most of the group members sell clothing. For example, Vicky sells pants for all ages. Other group members sell jackets, winter clothing, or baby and children's clothing, while some prepare and serve meals. The group members are requesting larger loan amounts in order to buy more merchandise so that they can increase their sales and their incomes. They all share the ultimate goal of improving their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise (clothing, ingredients to prepare meals)

loans.name: Frevisminda

texts.en:
Frevisminda O. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Frevisminda is separated from spouse and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Frevisminda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Frevisminda is just starting this business.

In 2009, Frevisminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Frevisminda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Frevisminda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental.Its membership composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pig  feed & other supplies

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señorita Maria cristina es originaria del departamento de Totonicapan a su edad ha emprendido su propio negocio la estuvo trabajando cinco años como operaria y lo que ganaba hera muy poco a comparacion de su trabajo hace tres años ha iniciado con su propio negocio  y la dificulta que encuentra es la falta de capital para poder surtir su producción hoy necesita de un credito para aumentar su caìtal y poder satisfaser la necesidad de los clientes, en los bordado.
texts.en:
Miss Maria Cristina is from the department of Totonicapan. At her young age, she has started her own business. She was a garment worker for five years, but her income was too low compared to what she produced. Three years ago, she decided to start her own business, but the biggest problem she faces is the lack of working capital to increase her inventory. She now needs a loan as working capital that will help her meet all of her customers’ embroidery needs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn and peanuts

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny es madre soltera, vive con su hija en la casa de sus padres a quienes trata de apoyar con los gastos del hogar, tratando siempre de progresar junto a su familia. Desde que se casó inicio su negocio de venta de ropa junto a su pareja, esta actividad la realiza en el puesto que adquirió en el mercado de su distrito, donde vende todos los días desde las nueve de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche. Asimismo, vende prendas usadas por las noches y son las que tienen mayor demanda a esa hora. Y debido a los peligros nocturnos, su esposo la ayuda por las noches. Sus planes a futuro son de adquirir un puesto más en el mercado para incrementar sus ingresos. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP y con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para llenar su puesto con nuevas prendas de temporada.
texts.en:
Jenny is a single mother who lives with her daughter in her parents home. She tries to help them with household expenses, ever attempting to progress together with her family. When she married she began selling clothes with her partner in a market stall which she acquired in her district market. She sells every day from 9 in the morning well into the night. In addition, at night she sells used garments which are in great demand at those hours. Due to nocturnal dangers, her ex-husband helps her at night.

Her plans for the future are to acquire another stall in the market in order to increase her income. This is her sixth loan from MFP. With the $350 she is requesting, she will buy a larger quantity of merchandise and fill her stall with new seasonal clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INCREASE HER MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Josephat Musyoki

texts.en:
Josephat is 35 years old and is married to Priscah Kaluki. They have one child who is six years old. Josephat has been operating a grocery store in a densely populated area within Nairobi, but without any competition for his type of business. He relies on customers who are residents from within the area.

The client has never serviced a loan from any other Microfinance Institution before and he was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a KADET client. He wants to use the loan to open another green grocery store in another strategic location which will supplement his daily earnings. With the extra profit, he plans to stop paying rent for the current kiosk and build his own kiosk.

His future hopes are to become a reliable vegetable and fruits supplier.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used in starting another green grocery kiosk in an indentified strategic location

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en:
Hope is a group of 5 borrowers led by Marie F., 51 years old, a widow with 5 children aged 21-31 years. Their educational levels are 12th grade-University graduates. She also cares for 2 orphans and 4 siblings.

Marie lives and works in the New Matadi community south of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. Marie's business is buying charcoal and fufu (local Liberian food) wholesale from rural Liberia and selling it to the residents of New Matadi, Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for 19 years and is grateful to the business for funding her children's education throughout these years.

Marie started by selling prepared food but later decided to get involves in out-of-town business. She also sells good products to her customers to retain them as customers. Marie is hoping to establish a store in future. And she dreams of her and her children being successful in the future.

Marie needs this loan in order to purchase more goods that can cover her customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods that can cover her customers' needs

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa G. is from the village of Talisay. She is 33 years old. Nelfa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nelfa runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, such as fish and shrimp, in the local community. Nelfa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nelfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nelfa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This will be the third loan taken out by Nelfa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to support the education of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Hameda Group

texts.en:
This is Hameda group. There are four female members in this group. These women would like to progress and develop their businesses. 
Hameda is the group leader. She wants to take a loan for her husband who has car parts shop. Hameda’s husband needs to cover all the necessities for his family and pay for all the expenses. He wants to buy some tools with the Kiva loan. He is confident that, after the loan, he can increase his business. 

Shakiba wants to receive a loan for her husband, who has fuel-selling shop. Shakiba’s husband wants to buy more fuel for his business. 

Khmela wants to take a loan for her husband who has oil-selling shop. Khmela’s husband wants to buy all the materials he needs for his business. 

Amina wants to take a loan for her husband who has general store. Amina’s husband wants to expand his business and to buy some more materials for his shop to attract more clients. He wants to buy all the required materials to have a well-organized shop. They are requesting a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. They admire this effective process.

loans.use: For business progress.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith, de 27 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos del hogar, aunque para eso tenga que trabajar muy duro.

Desde muy joven se dio cuenta que tenía que ayudar en las labores de su hogar para que su familia pueda tener una mejor economía. Con muchos sacrificios sus padres pudieron pagar todos sus estudios universitarios y ahora ella ha conseguido trabajo como nutricionista, pero su trabajo no ha hecho que deje de apoyar a sus padres, es por eso que los fines de semana sale a vender la leche que producen las vacas de sus padres a los distintos mercados de la ciudad, para que su familia pueda tener un ingreso extra.
Judith disfruta mucho realizando esta actividad, ya que siente que de esta manera aporta al desarrollo de su familia, lleva 7 años haciendo esto y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar por las calles de la ciudad en busca de clientes. Para más adelante, desea juntar el dinero necesario para implementar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, la cual genere un ingreso económico para su familia.

Es el tercer préstamo de Judith con MFP, sabe que este dinero le ayudará mucho en su trabajo, pero también tiene presente que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, para no meter en problemas a su banco comunal. Con los dos mil soles solicitados comprará más y mejores alimentos para sus vacas, porque sabe que su negocio depende de ellas.
texts.en:
Judith is 27 years old and she is a very happy and hard-working young woman. She lives with her parents and she wishes to help them with the household expenses, even though she will have to work very hard to this end.

Since she was very young she noticed that she needed to help out in her house so that her family will enjoy a better economy. Through great sacrifice her parents were able to cover all of her university tuition and now she has gainful employment as a nutritionist. But her work has not taken her away from helping her parents, so an extra source of income she goes to the difference markets of the city on the weekends to sell milk from their cows.

Judith loves her business, especially because she is contributing to the support of her family. She has been carrying out her business for the past 7 years, stating that the most difficult part is to have to walk through the streets of the city looking for clients. In the future she hopes to have saved enough money to set up a store from her home, in order to generate an income for her family.

This is Judith’s third loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she knows that this support will help her a great deal with her work. She is also very conscious of making payments on time, so that she will not put the community bank into a difficult situation. With the two thousand soles she will purchase more and better feed for her dairy cows, knowing that her business depends on them.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.en:
Froilan P. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Froilan owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Froilan has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Froilan joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Froilan is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila A. is from the village of Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old, is single, and has one adult child. Teofila owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling gas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Teofila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teofila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José  tiene una movilidad tipo vagoneta que trabaja como trufi en la ciudad de La Paz en la zona sur el trufi le ayuda para poder tener ingresos  y solventar las gastos familiares.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pedregal de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la reparación completa del vehiculo
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito ya que se gano la confianza financiera.
texts.en:
José has a station wagon, which he uses as a taxi with a fixed route in the southern area of the city of La Paz. The station wagon helps him be able to have an income and pay the family expenses. His home is located in the Pedregal area in the city of La Paz. The loan is to do complete repairs on his vehicle. It is the third time that he has asked for a loan with Impro. His history classifies him as client 1, which means good completion of his payments. This permits him to access this loan because he has gained the confidence of the financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs on his vehicle

loans.name: Sebastian Alberto

texts.es: Sebastian es originario del municipio de Acoyapa Chontales, se dedica al destace de res y comercialiacion en pie, lo que le permite mantener el sustendo familiar compuesto por 3 personas.  Su esposa se levanta muy temprano a preparar la alimentacion de su marido para que este inicie sus tareas muy temprano, a la vez envia a su hija de 9 años al 2do grado de primaria, su anhelo es sacar adelante a su pequeña hija y prepararla para el futuro. Esta solicitando su 1er credito para concluir una habitacion en su casa de habitacion y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Sebastián is from the Acoyapa Chontales municipality. He butchers beef, and he sells it on foot. This allows him to support his family, which is comprised of three people. His wife gets up very early to prepare her husband’s food so that he can start his work very early. At the same time, she sends her nine year old daughter to second grade at the elementary school. His goal is to get his little daughter ahead and prepare her for the future. He is asking for his first loan to be able to finish a room in his house. That way he will improve the family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an addition to his house

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma  M. G. de 34 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 11, 10 y 9 años de edad, los cuales dependen por completo de ella, ya que Irma es madre soltera, quien no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda por parte del padre de sus hijos. Es por esta razón que ella trabaja muy duro para poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos, los cuales le ayudan en el negocio y también se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado de la Colonia Las Margaritas, ubicada en el Municipio de Soyapango, su negocio es uno de los más surtidos y que cuenta con mayor cantidad de clientes, tanto por su excelente servicio como por sus precios accesibles. Irma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para invertir más en su negocio, aumentando la cantidad de cada producto, y de esta manera poder atender a mayor cantidad de clientes. Ella es una mujer muy responsable quien se siente muy agradecida por el hecho de poder contar con un negocio propio el cual le permita brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma M. G., 34, lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department with her three children, who are 11, 10, and 9 years old. They are completely dependent on her because Irma is a single mother who doesn't receive any help from the father of her children. For this reason, she works very hard to provide her three children with all they need. They, besides going to school, help her out in her business, which is a small grocery store located ín the market of Soyapango's Las Margaritas neighborhood. Her store is one of the best stocked ones so she has many customers thanks both to her excellent customer service and for her fair prices. Irma is asking for funding to invest in stock items for her store, increasing the amounts on-hand of each item so that she can take care of a larger number of custoemrs. She is a very responsible woman who is very grateful that she can have her own business that allows her to provide for her children's every need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D. C. is from the village of  Mambajao,  Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old and married, with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling  food and daily use products in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

Yolanda joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a  loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Boula

texts.en: Mrs. Boula U. is 52 years old and lives in Bam village in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is an animal breeder and her husband, Mr. Kon Kou, is a farmer who owns four hectares of land where he cultivates rice to support his family. But their rice field has infertile soil and is a long way from the irrigation system. So to increase production, Mrs. Boula U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine and to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and have the field plowed. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local public school, and the other is a low-salaried driver.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and plow the field

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José Andrés R. Velazquez, quien  Labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y  estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado siete crédito con CEPRODEL durante siete  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de Persianas de Vidrio para su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Andrés R. Velazquez works as a collector at the Roberto Huembes Market in Managua. He is married and has two dependent children who are in school. José Freddy has received seven loans with CEPRODEL over a seven year period and invested the proceeds in making improvements to his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy venetian blinds to install throughout his house. His goal is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase venetian blinds

loans.name: Boudy

texts.en:
Boudy S. is a 44-year-old married mother of one child. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE for two years and has paid back her previous loans on time.

Madame S. runs two businesses: a small restaurant and a stand where she sells jewelry products and fabrics when the restaurant is closed. With this loan, she will buy food for her restaurant and products to bolster her shop. The earnings from these activities will help her to pay for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase food for her restaurant and products for her shop
