loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.es:
El Sr. Tiburcio  es casado  con 4 hijos  todos en edad escolar.
El tiene una despensa, además de esto  tiene una empresa denominada T.G.V. Servicios  (recolección de basura).
El consiguió con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo todo lo que tiene.
Con la ayuda de su esposa y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante.
Hoy día el es un microempresario exitoso con muchos clientes.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como, panificados, lácteos, enalatados.
texts.en:
Sr. Tiburcio is married and has four children who are all of school age. He manages a food pantry and also owns a business called “TGV Servicios” (which provides trash collection services). Everything he has was achieved through much effort and sacrifice. He has the support of his wife and everyone in his family is able to move forward. Today he is a successful micro-entrepreneur with many customers.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as baked goods, dairy products, and canned goods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baked goods, dairy products, and canned goods

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: La Sra. Georgina es nacida en la cuidad de la Paz, pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Santa Cruz zona Pampa de la Isla  donde tiene su familia, vive en la casa de su esposo el cual fue heredado de sus padres, cuenta con una tiendita en su mismo domicilio, el cual lo trabaja desde hace tres años, ademas cuantan con un vehiculo (vagoneta), el mismo que lo trabaja su chofer y este les da renta diaria, su esposo el Sr. Juan se dedica al servicio de transporte con  una camioneta, el cul de su propiedad, es una pareja joven, son muy luchadores para conseguir su objetivo, el prestamo solicitado es para invertir en su tiendita, compra de mas mercaderia y asi poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, "agradecemos a EMPRENDER y KIVA por brindarnos su apoyo". comentaron.
texts.en:
Georgina was born in the city of La Paz. She currently lives in the city of Santa Cruz in the Pampa de la Isla area, where she has her family. She lives in her husband’s house, which he inherited from his parents. She has a small store in her house. She has been working in the store for three years. Also, they have a vehicle (a station wagon), which they rent to a driver. This gives them daily income. Her husband, Juan, provides transportation service with the van that he owns. They are a young couple. They are very tenacious in order to achieve their objective. The requested loan is to invest in her store. She will buy more merchandise. That way she will be able to increase her working capital. They say, “We are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for giving us their support”.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Chatty

texts.en: Chatty A. is from Barangay San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Chatty owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling halo-halo (a kind of dessert which is made of different kinds of fruit such as banana, cassava, coconut and other ingredients such as sugar, milk and ice) to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Chatty joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Chatty plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Juana es madre de familia de  dos hijos, tiene la edad de 43 años, desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de tortillas, que  inicio con iniciativa de poder ayudar a sus hijos, ya que su esposo gana poco y apenas se ajusta para la canasta básica.
Para ella no es fácil pero como madre tiene la responsabilidad de apoyar a su familia. Desde horas tempranas se levanta para ir a moler el maíz al molino, luego comienza  a palmear las tortillas para vender en el desayuno, también palmea al mediodía y en la tarde para lograr obtener mejores ganancias.
Con el crédito anterior logro  mejorar del porche, lo que le da mejor espacio. Ahora con este financiamiento construirá un cuarto que le hace falta para estar en mejores condiciones de comodidad personal. Sus planes es poder seguir aumentando su producción en tortilla.
texts.en:
Doña Juana is the mother of two children. She is 43 years old and has been selling tortillas for several years. Juana took the initiative to start this business so that she could help her children because her husband earns very little, which is barely enough to feed their family.

Even though it is not easy for her, Juana feels she has the responsibility to support her family. She wakes up in the early morning hours to begin grinding the corn. Later she forms the tortillas that she will sell for breakfast. She also prepares tortillas at noon and in the afternoons to earn extra income.

Her previous loan was used to remodel her porch so that she would have more space. This loan will be used to build a room that is currently lacking and will help provide more comfortable conditions. Her plans include increasing her tortilla production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.ru:
Nurlanu 22 qoda. On ne jenat. Seychas on jivet v Absheron regione s semyoy. U neqo yest 2 sestri kotoriye mladshe neqo. On ochen pomoqayet svoyey semye s pomoshyu etoy raboti. On transportiruyet qruzi uje 2 qoda. Et mashina bila eqo dyadi kotoriy uvedel chto on nujdayetsya v rabote  i podaril eqo Nurlanu chtob tot rabotal i pomoqal semye. 

Seycahs Nurlan nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN cto bi kupit nujniye zapchasti dlya eqo mashini. Kak vi videte na fotoqrafii mashina staraya i nujdayetya v remonte chtobi bilo leqko perevozit tovari.

V budushem on zarabotav bolshe deneg xochet pomoch svoyey semye sdelat remont v dome.
texts.en:
Nurlan is 22 years old. He is single. He currently lives in the Absheron Region with his relatives. He has two younger sisters. He helps his family a lot thanks to this job. He has been transporting cargo for two year already. This truck used to belong to his uncle, who saw that Nurlan needs work and gave the truck to Nurlan as a gift, to make it possible for Nurlan to work and help his family. Now Nurlan needs 2000 Azerbaijani Manats in order to buy the necessary spare parts for his truck. As you can see on the photo, the truck is old and needs repairs in order to make it easy to transport goods. In the future he would like to earn enough money to help his family renovate their home.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar lives in a small city called Borewala in Pakistan with her family. She is the mother of five children, but only two of them could get an education due to financial problems.

Her husband is a truck driver and one of her sons also drives a truck. Kosar makes handmade fans to supplement her income and to support her family financially. 

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her second son. With the loan amount, he will enhance his scrap business. He is running out of stock these days and wants to put more stock in his shop to increase his income. 

Kosar is hopeful that with the loan assistance, her son will be able to stand on his own feet and will start making a positive financial contribution to his family.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Denny Martin

texts.es:
Denny tiene 35 años de edad, es separado y vive junto a un familiar en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, un distrito mayormente agrícola ubicado dentro de la provincia de Chepén, en la región La Libertad, la zona de encuentra ubicada a una hora y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en una combi, el suele cubrir la ruta Chepén – Pueblo Nuevo. Su rutina de trabajo empieza desde muy temprano por la mañana hasta muy avanzada la tarde. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad el sostiene sus gastos personales, y se mantiene a su pequeño hijo. Denny es consciente de la responsabilidad que implica el trabajar transportando personas por lo que siempre realiza su trabajo con el mayor esfuerzo posible.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación, para poder realizar estas reparaciones ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Denny es una persona tranquila y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su menor hijo a tener una buena eduación. Sus vecinos y compañeros le consideran alguien honrado y de confianza.
texts.en:
Denny is 35 years old. He is separated and lives with a relative in the district of Pueblo Nuevo, a mainly agricultural area within the province of Chepén, in La Libertad region. The zone is located one hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. His work is providing transportation services for passengers in a van. The route he usually covers is Chepén – Pueblo Nuevo. His work routine starts very early in the morning and continues until quite late in the evening. With his income from this activity, he covers his personal expenses and also supports his young son. Denny is aware of the responsibility involved in transporting people, so he always carries out his work with the greatest possible care. Due to the continuous use of his vehicle, it has begun to suffer from some problems that require urgent repair. To undertake these repairs, he has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles. Denny is a calm and responsible person. His greatest desire is to continue working so that he can help his young son get a good education. His neighbors and friends consider him an honest person and someone they can trust.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing and maintaining the vehicle he uses to transport passengers

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es: El señor Rudy  es un cliente que ya saco dos secuencias su crédito en la institución y demostró responsabilidad, es un cliente con buena actitud, el es de profesión odontólogo tiene su consultorio en la ciudad de el alto específicamente en la zona 16 de julio, el trabaja en sociedad con uno de sus colegas de la universidad así le sale mas barato el pago del local de su consultorio, el cliente conto con la gran ayuda de su hermana que le ayudo mucho par que el estudie como también sus padres, en la compra de la silla quirúrgica como también sus instrumentos el financiamiento lo realizo con la ayuda de su hermana y también la de sus padres como también al sacar crédito en emprender para compra de material para las curaciones , el actualmente es soltero pero quiere en un futuro forma una gran familia, el destino del crédito es la compra de instrumentos quirúrgicos para su consultorio.
texts.en:
El señor Rudy handled his two prior loans responsibly. He is a customer with a positive attitude. He is a dentist and has his office on the top floor in the "16 de Julio" zone. He works with one of his colleagues from the university; this helps reduce office expenses. The customer received a great deal of support from his sister and his parents when he was in school and also with the purchase of his surgical chair and instruments. His family also helped him obtain loans in order to commence purchasing dental supplies. He is currently single but wishes to have a large family. This loan will be used to buy dental instruments and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dental supplies

loans.name: Celtina Auxiliadora

texts.es: La  Sra. Celtina Auxiliadora H. P.  ella es Trabajadora de la empresa ENACAL desempeñándose como cajera tiene  cuatro  años de trabajar para esta empresa es casada actualmente, tiene un hijo en la universidad. Ha tenido  cuatros créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno  los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Celtina Auxiliadora H. P. works for the ENACAL company as a cashier. She has worked for this company for four years. She is currently married, with one son at the university. She has had four loans with CEPRODEL, and she has used each one of them to buy construction materials and to improve the house where she lives. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly, because they have allowed her to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sand, cement, stone and stone blocks

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan L., 26, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. L. is a housewife while her husband is a laundry supervisor at a hotel in the town, earning an income of USD 220 per month. L. is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta I. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store, and raising livestock. She lives in Crossing Area Sts., Maayong Tubig, Dauin, Negros Oriental. She became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon earlier this year and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000.  Aniceta is borrowing PHP 12,000 to increase her inventory.   This will be her second loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 3,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Aniceta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: increase her inventory

loans.name: Marlene Margarita

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar. Este lugar es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.
 
En este hermoso  lugar encontramos a la señora Marlene, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos de 19 – 17 y 9 años, estudian uno en la universidad, otro en el colegio y el ultimo en la escuela. El esposo es comerciante de mariscos.

Es artesana y elabora infinidad de diseños y tejidos, realiza tejidos de nido de abeja en almohadas y edredones los mismos que son muy apreciados por los turistas que llegan hasta ese lugar, la pagan muy bien ya que son un bonito detalle para llevar de recuerdo, también hace trabajos bajo pedido y los vende a  comerciantes que llevan a otros lugares, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00 y en algunos días hasta más tarde cuando tiene muchos pedidos.

Este crédito es para comprar materiales para la elaboración de sus productos. Tiene 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta por las facilidades de pago.
 
Su sueño  es tener un gran taller para elaborar mayor cantidad y poder mostrar su arte en otros países.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the Esperanza Para Esperar [Hope to Overcome Communal Bank] meets in the beautiful San Jacinto coastal resort town, surrounded by a beautiful beach. At this place the Portoviejo River meets the sea. Many tourists, both national and foreign, visit this place.

In this beautiful place we find Marlene. She is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 19, 17, and 9. One is studying in university, anoother in high school, and the youngest in primary school. Her husband sells shellfish. She is an artisan of cloths and makes countless designs and woven items.

She crochets designs of honeybee nests into pillows and quilts, which are highly valued by tourists who arrive there. They pay her very well, as they are pretty things to take home as souvenirs. She also makes goods of lesser demand, which she sells to vendors who take the goods to other places. She works Monday through Friday from 8:30am until 4:00pm, and sometimes later on days when there is high demand. 

This loan is to buy materials for the creation of her products. She has had 4 loan cycles in the Communal Bank and is very happy for the ease with which she has paid them back. 

Her dream is to have a big workshop to make a greater quantity of products and to be able to show her art in other countries.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, quilts, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Eva

texts.en:
Ma. Eva L. is a married woman who lives in Bliss, Brgy. La Paz, Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Videoke and Candle-vending businesses. Her husband Eduardo Lemosnero, who is 54 years old, is a retired policeman and works as a driver to earn his living.  They have eight children who are between  9 and 28 years old. 

Ma. Eva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Eva has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 1500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use as extra capital for her business operation so that she can continue to save up for future education of her children. 

Ma. Eva L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for her business operation

loans.name: Machor

texts.en:
Machor S. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 21 years old. Machor is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Machor operates a family member's business venture: a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling different kinds of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Machor has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Machor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Machor is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as capital for raising chickens. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Machor from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as capital for raising chickens

loans.name: Yunuke

texts.en:
Yunuke B. is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya where she has been doing mixed farming for 15 years, producing maize, beans and millet, which are sold locally. She has five children between 20 and 12 years old. She employs one farmhand.

Yunuke has applied for this loan of 45000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income will enable her to clothe as well as pay school fees for her five children, who are still in school. She is aiming at having five cows in five years time.

Her continuing challenges are insufficient funds and poor road networks.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Suipacha Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento SUIPACHA es un banco que ya está en su cuarto ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 9 Integrantes 7 Mujeres y 2 Varones y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta ropas y otros, y la Sra. EVELIN ROCIO es la presidenta del Banco y  tiene una hija y ella se dedica a la venta D. tenis en la feria D. desaguadero y con el préstamo a lograra comprar más mercadería y aumento D. su capital D. trabajo y la Sra. MARIBEL es la secretaria en el Banco y ella se dedica a la venta D. edredones, sabanas y camas a facilitad y con el préstamo comprará más mercaderías para su negocio D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos económicos y aumento D. su capital D. trabajo, y la Sra. MERCEDES ella es la tesorera del banco y tiene 6 hijos y se dedica a la venta D. ropa americana ropa usada y víveres y el préstamo se invertirá en compra D. mercaderías y D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos, y su calidad D. vida y aumento D. capital D. trabajo para poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Suipacha community bank is already in its fourth loan cycle.  The bank has 9 members: 7 women and 2 men.  The ladies work in sales, selling clothes and other items.

Mrs Evelin Rocio is the bank's president.  She has a daughter and she sells sneakers in Desaguadero Market.  She will use her loan to buy more merchandise and increase her working capital.

Maribel is the bank's secretary and she sells comforters, sheets and beds on credit.  She will use her loan to buy more merchandise for her business and thereby increase her income and her working capital.

Mercedes is the bank's treasurer and she has 6 children.  She sells American clothes, second-hand clothes and food.  Her loan will be invested in buying merchandise so that she can improve her income and her quality of life, and increase her working capital so that she can get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of sports shoes

loans.name: Turtsetseg

texts.en: Turtsetseg N. is a 25-year-old single mother who lives with her daughter in Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. She and her daughter live together in a rented apartment. Turtsetseg operates a sewing business in her town. From her home, she produces a variety of traditional clothing items and embroideries on household items for her customers. She started her sewing business in 2000 after graduating from training courses as a seamstress. For the future, Turtsetseg hopes to progress her business and open her own sewing factory. She is a modest person and says, "All I want is to improve my skills." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase fabrics and materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn T. is from the village of Madalag. She is 31 years old. Charlyn is a group member of PMPC. Charlyn is married and has six children. To make a living, Charlyn operates a food-vending business in the local community. The main source of income for the business comes from  agar-agar, a jelly made from seaweed. 

Charlyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Charlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to finance agar-agar. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Charlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To finance the harvesting of sea weed for agar-agar

location.town: Liloy-Madalag, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy snack foods, softdrinks, cookies and cooking items

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Mariam faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase hair chemicals and hair weaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair chemicals and hair weaves.

loans.name: Ma. Hennie

texts.en:
Ma. Hennie is a married woman who lives in San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a pig fattening business. Her husband Jonathan, who is 48 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have 10 children who are 3 months old to 22 years old. Ma. Hennie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Hennie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to purchase more pig feed so that she can continue to save up for the future education and needs of family. Ma.Hennie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La señora Carmen Rosa se dedica al comercio de ventas de herramientas de trabajo, como martillos, entornilladores, palas, picos, clavos, etc.; el crédito lo necesita para aumentar el capital de trabajo y comprar más mercadería. Vive  en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto; es casada y  tiene dos hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2009.
texts.en: Carmen Rosa's business is selling work tools such as hammers, screwdrivers, shovels, picks, nails, etc.  She needs this loan to increase her working capital and buy more merchandise.  She lives in her parents' home which is located in Río Seco neighborhood, in the city of El Alto.  Carmen Rosa is married and has two children.  She has been a client of IMPRO since 2009.

loans.use: to buy work tools to sell retail

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a young man from Gaza Strip. He runs a mobile phone store where he sells mobile phones and phone accessories. Ahmed took out a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of mobile phones he bought. The store is the only source of income for Ahmad and his family. Ahmed is in the photo above.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones to sell in his store.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La señora Silvia tiene un taller de serigrafía con la ayuda de su esposo, que es el arte de impresión en cualquier material. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de acrílicos, tela, pintura, pinceles, para su negocio, que es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de las Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que Silvia obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Silvia, with the help of her husband, has a silk screening workshop. Silk screening is the art of printing on any material. She needs this loan for the purchase of acrylics, fabric, paint, and paintbrushes for her business, which is her source of income for maintaining her family. She is married, has three children and rents a home in the Las Pampahasi zone of the city of La Paz. This is the first time that Silvia has received a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase acrylics, fabric, paint, brushes, and other items for her silk screening workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shelving and gas tanks.

loans.name: Collita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COLLITA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Francisca. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Francisca,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer, e ingreso por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de polleras. Nos cuenta que este negocio lo inicio hace veinte años como, por iniciativa propia, luego fue a un instituto, por obtener el certificado.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de forros, ruedas y trecillas (materaial para la elaboración de las polleras), los que comprará de la ceja y los comercializará en la feria de San Luis. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la salud
texts.en:
The “Collita” communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Villa Adela. It is made up of eight members and it is directed by its leaders. The leader of the group is Francisca. The businesses of the members differ; among them are sales, production, and services. 

Francisca tells us this is the first loan cycle that she has participated in with Pro Mujer, and she got into the group by invitation. She currently has a business selling traditional skirts. She tells us that she started her business twenty years ago on her own. She later went to an institute to get a certificate.

The loan she will get is for buying lining fabric, rings, and fabric for making the skirts, which she will buy and then sell in the San Luis market. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family as much as possible, because she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health [training].

loans.use: to buy lining fabrics, rings, and fabric for making traditional skirts.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a widow with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nadzua has operated a retail shop for the past three years; she sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her products include household consumable products like maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, tea leaves and rice. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El señor Nicolas es casado con la señora Justina más de 13 años, tienen 5 hijos dependientes de diferentes edades que estudian en nivel primaria y secundaria, la familia vive en la comunidad de 2da Candelaria hace 18 años atrás, se dedican a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, papaliza, como también cuentan con cabezas de ganado vacuno 1 lechera y 4 de engorde.                                                                                                                                           
El señor Nicolas y su familia son de bajos recursos económicos que a veces apenas cubre los gastos para el estudio de sus hijos, por esta razón se apersonaron a solicitar un préstamo para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) mas 2 cabezas de ganado vacuno (yunta), ya que ellos necesitan la yunta para utilizar en las faenas agrícolas y tener en cualquier momento que el necesite arar o cultivar en el terreno, por que acudir a otros bancos de la ciudad les queda muy lejos, de este modo el señor Nicolas se siente feliz de tener la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito en el momento que más necesitaba.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Finalmente el señor Nicolas nos comenta, con todo esto tendrá mejor calidad de vida y luchar siempre para salir adelante económicamente hacia el futuro.
texts.en:
Nicolas has been married to Justina for more than 13 years, and they have 5 dependent children of different ages who study in primary and secondary school. The family has lived in the community of Segunda Candelaria for 18 years. They grow potatoes, broad beans, okra, and red potatoes, and they also have cattle -- 1 milk cow and 4 other cattle being fattened.

Nicolas and his family have limited economic resources and at times, can barely cover the costs of educating their children. For that reason, they are soliciting a loan to buy organic hen droppings, plus 2 head (a yoke) of cattle. They need the yoke of cattle to prepare the fields for planting and to be available when needed for plowing. Other banks in the city would be too far for them to go. 

Nicolas is very content to have this opportunity for access to a loan at a time when it is most needed. Finally, he says that with the loan, he will have a better quality of life and can continue in the future to struggle to get ahead economically.

loans.use: buy organic manure and other crop supplies.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun, 42, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

Sokun and her husband are employed at the garment factory, earning an income of $3.3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

Sokun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: C9231 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 49 years old and married with four children between the ages of 4 and 18 years old. She owns a business selling food crops. 

Jacqueline is the leader of this group, which is called " TWISUNGANE" in the local language.  In English it means "BEING TOGETHER". She is the third person on the right side. Jacqueline has been in this business for about one year and her business is open from 7 am until 6 pm every day.

Jacqueline and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their food crops. Jacqueline and her team will reinvest any profits in their businesses and save for their family's future.

loans.use: To purchase more food crops to sell.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 41, is a worker. His wife is a cook in a hotel. Their income is $6 per day. He has two children, 12 and 9 years old. Every month, he has to spend $60 on food, $7 on electricity, $20 on school fee and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $400 to repair his house so that he can have a better house to live in. In the future, he plans to sell groceries in the market with his wife because they are getting older. He just wants to get a shop to make a living. For his children, he wants to support them in their study so they at least finish high school.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a hardworking father of three school-aged children. He is 49 years old and married to Joy who is engaged in a retail business. She is helping him to improve their way of living. Benjamin has been farming for 30 years.  

He earns a net income of PHP 50,000 every cropping, usually during April and November for rice. However, due to so many expenses for his family, especially in providing for the education of their children, his farming capital was affected. To purchase rice seed and fertilizers and for labor costs in farming, he is requesting PHP 20,000. 

In addition to rice farming, he raises pigs to add to their profits in order to improve their way of living. He aims to lift his family from the hardship of the life they've been through in the past years and give all the needs of his children in their studies for them to finish completely and assure a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Tujimbere Group

texts.fr:
Claudine est une commerçante  âgée de 29 ans . Elle habite au centre-ville  de Gitega au centre du Burundi.  Elle fait marcher un restaurant  depuis 10 ans,un commerce qu’elle commence alors qu’elle vendait les bananes  à côte du métier de cultivateur. 

Elle a fait les études jusqu’au niveau du primaire. Elle est mariée  à Leonidas,un fonctionnaire et  ont ensemble 3 enfants dont 2 étudient a l’ecole primaire .
 
Le crédit de Kiva de 300,000 Fbu va lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter  une plus grande quantite de produits alimentaires consommés dans le restaurant pour réaliser  de grands bénefices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “TUJIMBERE”
texts.en:
Claudine, 29 and a small-scale merchant, lives in the center of the town of Gitega in the middle of Burundi.  She has been running a restaurant for 10 years, a business she began when she was still selling bananas and working as a farmer. 

She attended school up to the primary level. She is married to Leonidas, a civil servant with whom she has three children. Two of them are in primary school. 
 
The Kiva loan of 300,000 Fbu will permit her to increase her working capital in order to buy a bigger quantity of the foodstuffs consumed in her restaurant, so that she can make more profit. 

She is a member of the community group “TUJIMBERE”.

loans.use: to grow her working capital and buy a bigger quantity of the foodstuffs consumed in her restaurant.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 44 years old and married to a farmer. They raise and educate two siblings. The family lives in the peaceful village of Alcala. The village's income depends on farming businesses. Virginia and her spouse plant and harvest rice and sell it to traders. With her half hectare rice field, she usually earns about P23,000. The net income from the business is not enough to sustain all their needs. She pays electric bills and buys food and grocery items for the family. 

For the next planting season, she needs additional capital of P13,000 to buy pesticides and to pay for labor to help with cultivating the rice field. She is now requesting a loan from ASKI and all the generous KIVA lenders to help her in maintaining her farming business.

In the future, Virginia hopes to achieve a plentiful harvest to generate more income to use for house repairs.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and pay for labor for land cultivation.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is married with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nilda is 40 years old and one of her children is in school. She has a business buying and selling clothes in the Philippines. Nilda requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy more blouses, pants etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants and other clothing for resale

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El Señor Claudio es casado, tiene 49 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, tiene casa propia, donde posee todo lo básico para desarrollar sus actividades dentro del seno familiar y movilidad propia (moto).
Él se dedica a la venta de recuerdos hechos en cuero, cintos y otros . Desarrolla esta actividad hace como 6 años, posee la infraestructura necesaria para el desarrollo de esta actividad y su local es muy reconocido ya que esta situado en el centro mismo de la ciudad.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de cuero, que es su insumo primordial, ya que tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes con los que le gustaría poder cumplir. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Claudio is married, 49 years old, and lives in the city of Pilar in his own home. There he has all the essentials to run his business and within the family as well as his own transportation (moto). 

He sells souvenirs made of leather, belts, and other products. He has been in this business for about six years. He has the necessary set-up to run this business and his neighborhood is very well-known since it is situated in the center of the city. 

He is asking for a loan to buy leather which is his main material since he has several client orders which he would like to be able to fill. He thanks the Fundación

loans.use: to buy leather to make souvenirs and belts.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 28 años habita en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Ahí formó su familia junto a Justina, su esposa desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Fiorela y Emanuel a los que cuidan en su casa propia. Él es un hombre sincero y amable, todas las mañanas se dirige a sus tres terrenos productivos, donde siembra, café, achiote y plátanos en la misma proporción. Cuenta que en temporada de cosecha pasa la mayor parte del día cultivando, limpiando y fertilizando sus sembríos. Los mismos que después comercializa en la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde tiene gran acogida; pues sus clientes son conocedores de la calidad de sus cultivos, en especial del grano de café. A pesar de tener ingresos fijos con la cosecha de plátanos cada 15 días. Él se dedica también al trabajo de peón en otros terrenos de cultivo, donde le pagan una suma considerable de dinero cada fin de semana. Ahora sus intensiones son mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos, en especial de plátanos; por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brinda su banco comunal, donde ahora pertenece y espera encontrar el socio para su progreso. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad que le brindan. Pues está seguro cumplirá con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Manuel, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 300 mamones (plantitas de plátanos), para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Manuel, 28, lives in the community of Santa María.  He formed his family there with Justina, his wife of 7 years.  They have two children: Fiorela and Emanuel who they care for in their own house.  He’s a sincere, kind man.  Every day he heads out to his three fields where she grows coffee, achiote [annatto] and bananas in equal proportions.  He relates that during growing season he spends most of the day cultivating, weeding and fertilizing his crops which, once harvested, he sells in the city of Pichanaki where they are well received because his customers are aware of the quality of his crops, especially his coffee beans.  

Despite having steady income with banana harvesting every two weeks, he also works as a field hand on other fields where he’s paid a considerable sum of money each weekend.  Now, his intention is to improve the quality of his crops, especially the bananas, and this is why he appreciates the support he gets from the communal bank that he belongs to and hopes will become his partner for progress.

He belongs to the “Los Amigos Cafetaleros” communal bank and this is his first MFP loan; he’s thankful for the opportunity he’s being given and he’s sure that he’ll reach his objectives.  Besides, he promises to be punctual with his payments.  If Manuel were to receive your support, he’ll invest the requested money in the purchase of 300 “mamones” (banana seedlings) for this next planting.

loans.use: to buy 300 banana plants.

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
This is Medy, 41, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Govanie, a tricycle driver, and the mother of six children. Two of the children are in college, two are in high school, and two are in elementary school. Medy shares the responsibilities of wife, mother and businesswoman. 

Medy owns a junk shop that purchases scrap materials, plastics, bottles, steel, paper, and other recyclable materials. There are junk shop boys who do the routine rounds in their community to buy scrap items from neighborhood. Other people do the selling directly in her junk shop. She purchases plastic items by the kilogram, as well as paper, bronze and steel. Other items, like bottles, are bought per piece. She also sells these scrap items back to their manufacturers. From her business alone, she earns 200 PHP per day. 

Medy is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 that will help as additional capital. She will spend it to purchase scrap items being sold in the junk shop. The loan will definitely help her to have a better profit, the more amount invested, the better the profit. 

Medy dreams that her business will become bigger. She wants to have more carts that will be used by her helpers. Having a junk shop is her way of helping the community understand the value of trash. She believes that people just need to know how to recycle items that they believe to be worthless.  The weekly fellowship* of CCT continuously inspires her to have an optimistic attitude in life, she sees every individual has a worth in this world just like the scrap items that she recycles. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials needed in her business

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is married, 29 years of age, and has three children. She lives in Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur. Cristy owns and manages a general store to earn a living. She has had this business for more than six years. Each month she earns Php 7,000 doing this type of work. Cristy requested a loan of Php 30,000 to purchase additional products to sell. 

Cristy has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand and she will be able to sustain her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Yessenia Marlene

texts.es: Yessenia, necesita otro préstamo, para invertir en el negocio surtiéndolo D. mercadería y comprar: cosméticos, peluches, telas para confeccionar vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños, el propósito D. ella es mejorar en sus ventas y debido a la época D. graduaciones le permitirá tener más ingresos, y por consiguiente podrá darles a su familia lo mejor que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Yessenia needs another loan to invest in her business, by stocking it with merchandise and buying cosmetics, stuffed toys, and fabric for making women's, men's, and children's clothing. 

Her aim is to improve her sales, and because it is graduation season, this will allow her to have more income, and consequently she will be able to better meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, stuffed toys, and fabric.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is a farmer from the village of Boriti, West Georgia. She is 38 years old, married to David, and has four children – three daughters (18, 17 and 5 years old) and a four-year-old son. Tamar’s mother-in-law also lives with the family. 
The family's only source of income is agriculture. They have one milk cow. Tamar produces cheese and sells it in Zestaponi (a nearby town). The family also has three pigs and sells on average 30 piglets in the village. In addition, Tamar and David grow vegetables and corn on the 0.8 hectare of land that the family own. They sell harvested vegetables and corn on Zestaponi market. Their total average monthly income is 400 GEL, which includes Tamar's mother-in-law's monthly pension. 
Tamar has requested credit for purchasing chickens. She will raise them and sell eggs as well as hens. She will also use a small part of the funds to renovate the henhouse. Tamar has experience in running a poultry farm and she will use it to set up the new business. She says that it will be profitable and the family will have more income, which will be used for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chickens plus materials for henhouse renovation.

loans.name: Oulèye

texts.fr: Madame Oulèye est une femme mariée. Elle habite au Sénégal. Elle est  âgée  de 32 ans. Elle est mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre un et huit ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et vend de l’huile de palme depuis plus de 5 ans. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion mais dan le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle est sociétaire dans un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2008. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’huile de palme destiné a renforcer son activité de commerce. Son intention est d’augmenter ses profits pour mieux contribuer  a l’amélioration des conditions d vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oulèye lives in Senegal. She is 32 years old, married and the mother of 3 children aged between 1 and 8. She is involved in commerce and has been selling palm oil for over 5 years. She chose this line of work because she had an affinity for it and she needed to earn a living.

Oulèye has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since July 2008 and is requesting a loan of 75 000 francs so that she can restock on palm oil for resale. She would like to increase her profits so that she can contribute more towards improving her family´s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for resale.

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Despertar, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que desde 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy hábil con sus manos y el arte de la joyería tiene vida propia, la gastronomía variada cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Doña María tiene 49 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 27, 26, 24 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente,  su tercera hija estudia en la universidad y su ultimo hijo  en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

La Señora María es profesional en el área de la docencia y dicta clases en un colegio, lleva 20 años en esta actividad y trabaja de lunes a viernes. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a  la venta de joyas, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y trabaja sin horario fijo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de joyas para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es crecer cada días más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community bank “Despertar.” She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city which was named a World Heritage Site in 1999. Its people are very skilled with their hands and the art of jewelry has taken on a life of its own there. Its varied gastronomy captivates the palates of its visitors, and its people maintain the culture and traditions of its villages. 

Maria is 49 years old, married, and from her conjugal union has had four children, ages 27, 26, 24, and 12. Her oldest two children work and help her financially, her third child is in college, and her youngest son is in high school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not have their own house, so they are renting. 

Maria is a professional teacher and gives classes in a high school. She has been doing this for 20 years and works Monday through Friday. In her free time she makes a living selling jewelry, which she has been doing for ten years, working without a fixed schedule. 

She has been a member of her community bank for 7 years, and she will put her new loan towards the purchase of jewelry so that she can continue with her business. 

Her goal is to expand her business each day.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Elisa; ella tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 8, 4, ella vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa,  de forma independiente, la socia viaja a la ciudad de Cusco para comprar ropa y trae para verder a sus diferentes amistades y clientes; la socia desea invertir en la mercaderia para incrementar sus ventas.


La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank.  She lives in the district of Urcos in the Quispicanchis Province of the department of Cusco.  

Her name is Elisa; she is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children who are 17, 8, and 4.  She lives in the district of Urcos.  She buys and sells clothing on her own for a living.  She travels to the city of Cusco to buy clothing and brings is back to sell to her different friends and clients.  She wants to invest in merchandise to increase her sales.
	
She values and is more than thankful for the loan she has been granted because it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.  She promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to increase her sales.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a 24-year-old married woman with two young children, age 4 and 2. She and her husband run a fishing business in their town.

According to Bibiana, this business has been running for five years now. Her husband operates their fishing boat and Bibiana sells his catch at the market. Each month, they earn about 7,000 PHP with their business. Bibiana does her best to improve their income and take care of her children. 

She has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials.

In the future, Bibiana hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Mrs. Clara I. who specializes in milling cassava for processing of Garri, learnt how mill cassava for 3 months before she started hers in the year 2000. She is married with 6 children, lives in semi-rural area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria, solicits that if the above $500 is been given to her it will enable her expand her business

loans.use: To buy addition-milling machine

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a specialist in local soap (Azuma) making. She produces on a large scale and distributes to retailers in her community. She says she has been unable to produce on a large scale recently because her production costs have increased. She is seekng a Kiva loan of $850.00 to enable her to get back to business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a mechanic. He is 30 years old. He has a big family which consists of his wife, three children, and his mother and father. Because of his poor family, he didn’t get any education. He works with his partner in the industrial area in Kirkuk. Five guys work with him.

When he started his business, he went with his partner to his garage and waited for the customers to come. He works 12 hours in the day without rest. This is his first loan. He wants to buy new engines and sell them to his customers. As he said, "I'm looking for a better future."

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Buy a new engines

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
PASCUALA is 45 years old, a widow, and has five children. She is dedicated to raising and fattening pigs. With the loan she will buy food and medicine to protect her animals. She sells them among the people of her community; sometimes they are sold alive or ready for consumption. She is a member of the group "Puente (Bridge) 1" along with doña Leonor de la Cruz Gómez (who is a seamstress) y doña Julia Díaz Hernández (who sells pastries). The two hope to invest the loan by buying Leonor more fabric to make more clothing and Julia more flour and sugar to make more pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

PASCUALA tiene 45 años, viuda, cinco hijos. Ella se dedica a la crianza y engorda de puercos, con el préstamo comprara alimento y medicamentos para proteger a sus animales, y los vende entre la gente de su comunidad algunas veces vivos y otras para consumo. Pertenece al grupo Puente 1 junto con doña Leonor de la Cruz Gómez (costurera) y doña Julia Díaz Hernández (venta de pasteles). Ellas dos esperan invertir comprando Leonor mas tela para confeccionar mas prendas y Julia comprara harina y dulces para elaborar pastelitos.

loans.use: Raising and selling pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second hand ladies clothes to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị V., 46 years old, is unmarried but determined to to work hard for a better future. She joined TYM fund in 2002. Her first loan was only 75 USD, she bought goods to resell. After 5 years, she now owns a general store selling all kind of goods. The revenue from the store is 110 USD a month. Her plan is to apply for a loan of 375 USD to buy more stock for her store to better serve her customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị V., 46 tuổi, là một thành viên đơn thân nhưng với sự vươn lên cố gắng của bản thân năm 2002 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn làm ăn. Vòng vốn ban đầu chỉ có 75 USD chị đã đầu tư vào mua những mặt hàng phục vụ nhân dân sau 5 năm kinh doanh đến nay chị đã có một gian hàng phục vụ tương đối đầy đủ các mặt hàng với mức thu nhập 110 USD/tháng. Dự định của chị là sẽ vay 375 USD để mở rộng các mặt hàng kinh doanh phục vụ nhân dân và tăng thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia belongs to the communal bank Mujeres Virtuosas (Virtuous Women). She lives on 578 San Fernando Avenue in the Manantay district in Ucayali. She is 56-years-old and is the mother of four children. Her husband is a merchant, but his income isn't enough to cover all of their home's expenses. This is why Sonia, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles ($100), decided to start a small business of buying and selling used clothing in her home.

Currently, Sonia has a store where she buys and sells used clothes and shoes for women, men, and children. It's going well for her without any problems. Thanks to her earnings, she has enough to pay the installments of her loan in a punctual manner.

With the recent loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 2,000 nuevos soles ($669), which will be repaid in 6 months, she bought more second-hand clothing, 30 shoes, 10 wallets, 3 mannequins, 2 sales counters, and 30 hangers. Sonia feels very happy with the work that she does because she puts in a lot of affection and persistence to accomplish her goals. Thanks to this business, she can offer her family and herself economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Virtuosas, vive en Av. San Fernando 578, del distrito D. Manantay del departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 56 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero sus ingresos no alcanza para solventar los gastos del hogar, es así que Sonia, con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 (US$100.00) deciD. poner un pequeño negocio D. compra y venta D. ropa usada, en su propio domicilio ubicado en el distrito D. Manantay.

En la actualidad, Sonia tiene una tienda D. compra y venta D. ropa y zapatos usados, para damas, caballeros y niños. Le va muy bien y sin ningún inconveniente. Gracias a sus ingresos tiene lo suficiente para pagar las cuotas del préstamo en forma puntual.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 2,000 (US$ 669.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compró mas ropa D. segunda mano, 30 zapatos, 10 carteras, 3 maniquíes, 2 mostradores y 30 colgadores.

Sonia se siente muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza, por lo que le pone mucho cariño y empeño para lograr sus objetivos y metas trazadas. Gracias a este negocio brinda a su familia y así misma estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale used clothes, footwear, mannequins, and a sales counter

loans.name: Toshmatova

texts.en: Toshmatova G. lives in Nausky rayon. She is married and has 2 children. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006, and she is a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in the business of sales. She sells linens such as tea and bath towels, women's headscarves and tablecloths. Mrs. Toshmatova has a direct supplier. That is why she works with clients of different income levels. Working in the trade sphere, she has stiff competition. That is why she wants to provide the new assortment of goods. She is ready to work intensively to ensure a happy future for her children. Her stable business and income helped to repay her previous loans and to increase her new loan sum. Now Mrs. Toshmatova requests a loan of $925 for business development. She wants to import new designs and increase her family income level.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Mrs. Duch R., 34, works on her rice paddy growing crops and also raises pigs. She typically makes on average around $3 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a policeman earning about $3 each day. Mrs. Duch R. would like to request this loan to purchase another plot of farmland to expand her crops.

loans.use: To purchase another plot of farmland to expand her crops

loans.name: Capullo De Rosa Group

texts.en:
Micheline (pictured far right) is a soft-spoken 27-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in the suburb of Los Alcarrizos on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She has started a business of selling undergarments, and has named it Exclusividades Micheline. She is asking for this loan so that she can purchase a larger quantity of undergarments and likewise be able to sell more to her community members.

Her dream is to continue extending her progress and business growth into the future, so that it is a reliable and long-term source of income for her and her family. She hopes to see her children move forward, continue their education and always advance as people and leaders in her community. She says her biggest challenge right now is to fight against the widely held belief in her particular community that they will always be poor, and that no one in her community has the potential to really improve. To advance, she has to not only work hard in her business, but also work hard to stay positive and optimistic.

In her free time Micheline likes to study and work on her business. On behalf of Micheline and everyone in her Capullo de Rosa Bank of Hope, thank you for your support of their loan and your interest in helping them overcome the odds to improve their lives in ways they only dreamed of before!

loans.use: Purchase undergarments for retail

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es:
Thelma Agüero is a both a college student and mechant. She, her parents and two brothers own a small family business.

Themla runs the general store/butcher shop along with her parents, who have owned the store for more than 15 years. On top of running the store, her mother buys vegetables at the wholesale market and resells them throughout the Misiones area, from Villa Florida to Ayolas. She sells the vegetables on a truck, which the family was able to purchase with the revenue brought in by their shop.

Thelma has requested this loan from our institution to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables for resale, due to the high demand that exists for these items.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Thelma Agüero, es estudiante universitaria y comerciante a la vez, ella posee un negocio familiar con sus padres y 2 hermanos.

Sus padres poseen el negocio hace ya más de 15 años, el negocio específicamente es una despensa y carnicería el cual es atendido por sus padres y ella. Además de esta actividad su madre se dedica a la compra de verduras del mercado de abasto para su posterior venta por todo el Dpto. De Misiones desde la ciudad de Villa Florida hasta la ciudad de Ayolas en cual lo realiza en un camioneta que pudieron adquirir gracias a las ganancias obtenidas por el negocio.

Thelma solicita el préstamo en nuestra institución para la compra de verduras, frutas entre otros para la posterior venta debido a la gran demanda que posee.

loans.use: Buy merchandise (fruit, vegetables, etc.)

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been operating a hair dressing salon in her town for the past ten years. She has two apprentices currently learning the trade. Beatrice is thirty three years old and the mother of two children.

She wants to use her loan to buy more hair products to expand her operation. She is a member of the group called Solace. Members agree in principle to support and guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Beatrice is dressing a customer 's hair.

loans.use: To buy more hair products

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is married with six children. She also has three adopted children who are currently living with her.

Joana has been selling hardware for 18 years in the local market. Currently people are putting up buildings and the demand for roofing sheets, paint, nails, door locks and other hardware is very high in her town. She wants to use this loan to buy more hardware to increase her inventory and sales.

Joana is a member of the group called “Abusua Kronkron” meaning Holy Family. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy hardware like roofing sheets, paints, nails, door locks, etc.

loans.name: Pom

texts.en: Mrs. Pom S., 37, lives in Deok Peang Village in Kampong Speu Province, where she is a Chinese noodle seller and grocer. Her husband, Mr. San Sou, is a construction foreman. They have four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while two others are attending the local school. The youngest is of preschool age.  Since her grocery business is doing very well, Mrs. Pom S. is requesting a loan in order to expand the products she can offer to her customers.  Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 35 years old, married, and has 8 children. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$175.

Asha now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items, such as rice, maize flour and bananas, for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Mr. Khoem B. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Mr. Khoem B. is a 43-year-old widower with five children who are all attending the local school.

He is also a farmer who works hard on his small piece of land growing rice. He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to produce a better crop. Mr. Khoem B. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve his rice crop

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala K. was born in 1958 and comes from Gračanica. She is married and lives with her husband. Sala has been working in shoe manufacture in Gračanica for a long time. She is very good at her job but, like everywhere in the shoe industry, she doesn`t earn much.

Sala also works at home to increase her home budget. She repairs shoes manually and she thinks that now is the right moment to buy a machine and make her job easier. She is requesting her second loan through WWI in the amount of 600 KM to buy machine for shoe repair.

loans.use: To buy a shoe repair machine

loans.name: Arn

texts.en:
Mr. Arn K. is a 38-year-old motorcycle taxi driver, who supplements his income by raising pigs from his house in the Ti Brammuoy Village, Kompong Cham Province. He earns around $3 per day. His wife, Mrs. Keo Chanthy, is a 33-year-old cleaner at the Mettapheap Hotel in the Kompong Cham Province. She earns around $1.66 per day. They have three children, two of whom attend school and the other is married.

In order to cover his family’s living expenses and support his children’s study, Arn now asks for a loan of $500 to purchase piglets to raise and to purchase materials to make ice-cream to sell for another source of income. Arn’s wife is pictured because he was not available.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and to purchase materials to make ice-cream to sell for another source of income

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir N. is a 49 year-old man living in Bourj El Barajneh, in the suburbs of Beirut. He is married and has four children. During the July war in Lebanon in 2006, Samir lost his sewing factory. Since then, he has been working as a taxi driver to support his family. Today Samir wants to borrow $1200 to change the tires of his vehicle as well as perform maintenance on his taxi.

loans.use: To buy new tires and perform vehicle maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and a vegetable vendor. She is married to Juanito, a rice farmer who manages their small rice field in Barangay Minallo Naguillan, Isabela. They have five children:  Lorelie – 32 years old, married, a vocational course graduate; Arnel – 31 years old, married and also finished a vocational course; Girlie – 29 years old, married, high school graduate; Madeline – 25 years old, married, high school graduate; and RJ – 12 years old, a graduating elementary student.  

She started her vegetable vending business when her husband started to plant vegetables in their backyard.  She is in charge of harvesting the vegetables and sells them in the neighborhood and other nearby villages for extra income. 

However, their income is not enough so she is planning to buy a piglet to start her hog raising business, which would increase her income and support the basic needs of their family and education of their youngest child.  She is now asking for financial assistance to pursue her plan. Aside from buying a piglet, she is also planning to use the loan to purchase different vegetables that she can sell in their village.  

“I always believe that our family will survive from the challenges of life, of course through the help of God and the members of our family who serve as my inspirations,” Teresita concluded.

loans.use: To buy a piglet for a hog raising business and purchase different vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mr. Sarom Rous Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people living in Preak Treing village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. For example, Mr. Sarom R., the 43-year-old village bank president, is a motorbike taxi driver. He now faces a problem because his motorbike is an old one and he usually pays a lot of money to repair it. Thus, he is requesting a loan to fix his motorbike. His wife, Mrs. Ngon Chanthon, is a housewife. Mr. Sarom R. is the father of a child who is attending the local school.

Three members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to fix the motorbike he uses to earn a living

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr:
Ablaye S. produit du charbon de bois qu'il vend aux ménages. Cet exploitant forestier basé à Bignona, au nord de Ziguinchor, a une expérience du secteur.
Grâce à cette activité il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille restée au village. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Ablaye S. makes charcoal and retails it to households. This forest worker based in Bignona, north of Ziguinchor, has some experience in his field.

Thanks to this business, he manages to support his family who have stayed behind in the village. He is requesting this loan to bolster his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La señora Dorotea vive en casa propia con su esposo en la calle Gutiérrez de la zona de alto chijini de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de calzados de cholita en la calle Max Paredes de la zona central , con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia ya que su esposo  esta mal de la vista y no puede trabajar, tan solo le ayuda a cargar y llevar y traer la mercadería.
El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital para comprar más calzados, ofrecer mayor variedad  y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2000 y por el buen historial que tiene puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Dorotea lives in her own house with her husband in the Alto Chijini neighborhood in the city of La Paz. Her business activity is selling shoes in the traditional "cholita" style on Max Paredes street in the city center. She this activity she is able to support her family; her husband has vision problems and cannot work and can only help her loading and carrying the merchandise. The requested loan will be used to increase her business capital to purchase shoes to offer a wider variety of style and thus increase her income. She has been a client of Impro since 2000 and due to her good repayment history is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes to sell

loans.name: Chhou

texts.en: Chhou C. is 43 years old and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She is a local doctor and works in a grocery store, making approximately US$25 in revenue per day. Her husband is a mechanic and earns US$7 per day. This couple has three children and all of them are in school. Chhou C. would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products. (She is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy more products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fagamalama

texts.en:
Fagamalama S., 43, is married with three children. She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public one day per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately 140 USD).
