She has no previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Fagamalama’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy her new garden spray and chemicals to kill insects.

loans.use: To buy tools like a shovel, a rake, a garden spray and chemicals to kill insects

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa  de sus padres. Desde hace 19 años se dedica a la venta de papa, ella tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra principalmente este producto, su esfuerzo más grande es la época de cosecha durante los tres primeros meses del año. Su esposo siempre está con ella y ambos trabajan para la manutención de los hijos que tienen. Hasta el momento, Irene considera rentable su negocio, porque ella vende lo que produce y tiene mayores márgenes de ganancia, sin intermediarios. Paralelo a eso, su esposo tiene un motocarro que le sirve para transportar su mercadería, así como para ofrecer servicio de transporte a sus vecinos. Es la segunda vez que Irene tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está con muchos ánimos de continuar forjando un trabajo en unidad con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando lo podrá invertir en la compra de sacos de papa, abono para su próxima siembra y el mantenimiento de su motocarro.
texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old and lives in her parents' house with her husband and their four children. For 19 years, Irene has been selling potatoes, which she grows on her own land. Because she plants her own crops, most of her work takes place during the first three months of the year. Her husband is always by her side; they work together and care for their children together, too. Irene believes that her business is profitable these days because she sells what she produces, without any middle-man. Her husband also maintains a small vehicle, which he uses to transport merchandise and courier items for their neighbors. This is Irene's second loan with MFP, and she is excited to continue building relationships with other members of her community bank. With this loan, Irene will buy more potato sacks and fertilizer for the next planting season. Some of the money will also go toward vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer, vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Dulia

texts.es:
La señora Dulia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Vive en el Barrio Alto Florida  Jr. Zepita S/n,  ella posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de fruta, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 2200.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para comprar variedades de frutas, (plátanos, naranjas, peras, mandarinas, manzanas, uvas) y venderlos en el Mercado 15 de Agosto. Su sueño es poner su tienda de abarrotes o una jugueria propia.
 
Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucho los ahorros  y la facilidad de pago que ofrece Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Ms. Dulia is a member of the communal bank “ Yunga Uyo,” which is in the Puno area of the province of Chucuito. She is 23 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. She lives in the barrio Alto Florida Jr. Zepita S/n and has completed her high school studies. Dulia buys and sells fruit and has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her firs loan was for 300.00 soles. Currently she would like an additional loan of 2,200.00 soles, to purchase various fruits like: plantains, oranges, pears, mandarins, apples, and grapes. She will sells them at the 15th of August market. Her dream is to have her own grocery or juice store. At the same time, she tells us that she loves to save and Manuela Ramos’ terms of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: para comprar, plátanos, naranjas, peras, mandarinas, manzanas, uvas

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо девушка, которой 24 года. Она замужем , имеет двоих детей, основной доход имеет с завоза и продажи женских кофт и верхней одежды. Но с сезоном она хочет в кредит пополнить свой товарооборот летним ассортиментом  женской одежды. Мархабо по бизнесу помогает её муж, он работает частным таксистом на своей автомашине марки «Опель».Поэтому за товаром её муж ездит с Мархабо на своей машине, что им обходится дешевле. Мархабо устраивают условия Фонда и она на снимке она в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Marhabo is a young, 24 year old woman. She is married, has two children and her main income comes from bringing to town and selling women’s cardigans and outerwear. But for the season she would like to expand her summer women’s clothing inventory on credit. Marhabo’s husband helps her in her business; he works as a private taxi driver using his car whose brand is “Opel.” This is why her husband travels with Marhabo for products in his own car, which is cheaper for them. Marhabo likes the terms of the Fund; she is in the photo on the day that she received her loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of women's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cultivating maize

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila operates a sari-sari store business (a sar-sari is a community-based general store). Sometimes she also sells vegetables for additional income. She aims to become a successful businesswoman someday, which is why she is doing her best to maintain her enterprise. Prescila asking Kiva to to support her by granting her loan request of PHP 5,000.

Prescila is 39 years old. She is married to Elmer Sr. and they are blessed with four children: Elmer Jr., 18 years old and a high school graduate; Merbin, 16 years old, and an elementary school graduate; Elsie, 13 years old, in her second year of high school; and Erika, eight years old and in the second grade.

Prescila hopes that she can gain enough capital to make her business grow to the point where her daily income is increased.

loans.use: To gain business capital

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El señor Julio O. P. trabaja como mesero en un Restaurant de la Ciudad, su esposa no ha podido encontrar un trabajo estable por su edad en estos momentos esta trabajando temporalmente para una empresa por un periodo de 3 meses. El señor  O. y su esposa tienen 3 hijos 2 estan estudiando la preparatoria y uno la primaria. Este matimonio recurre a nosotros para que se le pueda otorgar credito  para la compra de utiles escolares y uniformes de sus hijos, ellos se preocupan mucho por la educacion de los niños, ya que estas personas  cren que es la mejor herencia que pueden darles.
texts.en:
Julio O. P. works as a waiter in a restaurant in the city. His wife has not been able to find stable work. She is temporarily working for a business for three months. Mr. O. and his wife have three children. Two are in high school, and one is in elementary school. This couple is asking for a loan to buy school supplies and uniforms for their children. They care a lot about educating their children. They believe that education is the best inheritance they can give them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 56-year-old widow who lives in the same house with her daughter, her daughter’s husband and their children. Nada works as a babysitter at home and can earn round 200 KM monthly. This is the only income she has and it is enough for her basic needs.

Nada has worked for a many years as a tailor in a big factory but that factory is closed now. Nada has one old sewing machine and, from time to time, she uses it to fix some clothes.

Nada has a long experience in tailoring and she has decided to buy a new sewing machine and needs a loan to purchase it. That is the reason Nada has requested her first loan from WWI (Žene za Žene International) in amount of 600 KM. She hopes to increase her income and provide a more comfortable life for herself.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina B. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Marcelina owns and operates a business selling charcoal, manufacturing and selling charcoal products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Marcelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials such as coconut shells for manufacturing charcoal. This loan will be her 23rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as coconut shells to manufacture charcoal

loans.name: Yvette Delia

texts.en:
Yvette is a member of The Wheatfield village bank. She is 26 years old, single, and has no children. 

Two years ago, Yvette studied a course in handicrafts and now has her own business of making handmade toys for children with imitation pearl and jewelry materials. She also sells chocolates and bonsai trees. She sells her handicrafts to shops and stands in the market. With her loans from FINCA she is able to invest in her business and buy more merchandise. 

Yvette needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy thread and imitation pearls and material to make imitation jewelry. Her dream is to have a shop where she sells all her handicrafts.

loans.use: To buy materials for making imitation jewelry

loans.name: Tumurdorj

texts.en: Tumurdorj is 26 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic ten, in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He operates a dairy trading business, where he purchases dairy products from a nearby small village and transports them to the market in his town. Tumurdorj started his business in 2000 with working capital of 50,000 tugrug (~35 USD) and it soon reached 800,000 tugrug (~560 USD). Since his business has become increasingly profitable, he has been able to provide for himself and his wife. Tumurdorj’s main goals are to provide for his family and deliver quality dairy products to the market. He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~490 USD) loan to purchase more dairy products in order to increase his sales in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Rhoda's Group

texts.en: K. Rhoda is a hard working and determined lady. She is 38 years old and married with four children, two in secondary school and two in primary school. She takes care of one other dependant. She has a retail shop in Bukari Cell Kashenshero that she has been running for six years and she is able to make 120,000/= profit a month. This is because there is a lot of competition. She started her retail shop using her personal savings from teaching and she does not regret it. She has learned to take care of her customers with her good customer care skills. She hopes to grow the business much bigger and the family will be much happier. Rhoda needs a loan to help expand her business by purchasing more stock since this will bring in more income.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop.

loans.name: Ireda Agali 2 Okello Lucy Group

texts.en: O. Lucy is forty-two years old, widowed and blessed with six children of whom, five are schooling. She operates a local brewing business which she has been running for  ten years so far. She is requesting this loan to purchase local brewing ingredients such as maize flour, yeast, etc.. She is trying to improve her business to make more profit so that she will be able to pay school fees for her children. She is not worrying because there is some thing to eat. She is active and her dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase local brewing ingredients such as maize flour, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca, de 44 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive es su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Su tienda de abarrotes es una de las más visitadas en su barrio “Villa el Paraíso”, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su local en espera de que sus clientes lleguen a comprar los comestibles que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y está dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 8 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. 
Para más adelante, espera poder hacer ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos.

Es el cuarto préstamo de Rebeca con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los seiscientos soles solicitados comprará más productos para surtir mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Rebecca, 44, is a very unassuming and happy woman. She lives in her own house. What she wants most of all is to have a better quality of life. Her grocery store is one of the most frequented stores in her neighborhood, Villa el Paraíso. She opens her store very early in the morning waiting for her customers to come and buy the food they need. She is a happy and attentive saleswoman. She always greets her customers with a smile, and she is always ready to help them with their purchases. What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers. She has been in this business for eight years. The most difficult part is staying in her store all day without being able to leave. Later, she hopes to be able to expand her store and fill it with more merchandise. This way she will be able to offer her customers a better variety of products. This is Rebeca’s fourth loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank. She is much loved by her colleagues. She will use the 600 PEN she is requesting to buy more products to better stock her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: El Nuevo Amanecer De Ventanilla Group

texts.es:
Cuando era muy pequeña la señora Rosa siempre vio a su padre como criaba y cuidaba sus cerdos en la pequeña granja que tenia, con ese trabajo su padre pudo sustentar a su familia ella siempre lo ayudo en ese oficio, al transcurrir el tiempo ya casada a ella le nace la idea D. dedicarse a ese negocio porque heredo el amor por los animales que su padre le enseño. La señora con el tiempo se compro un terreno en un lugar adecuado para la crianza empezó con dos cerditos no muy finos le fue tan bien que empezaron aumentar y tuvo que adecuar sus corrales. 
Con los prestamos D. EDAPROSPO ella ha logrado muchas cosas por ejemplo mejorar la raza D. sus animales y ambientar los corrales, siente que cada día le va mejor y su granja ha crecido mucho lo cual la hace feliz, también se siente contenta saber que su trabajo no ha sido en vano porque sus hijos están siguiendo sus pasos, en el futuro ella quiere construir con material noble todo sus corrales para la comodidad y seguridad D. los mismos ya que actualmente es D. aboD. con madera y no tiene la seguridad que requiere, con el tiempo modernizara su granja para poder estar a la par con otros negociantes que se dedican al mismo rubro. Por otro lado la señora Rosa también trabaja en la Municipalidad D. Ventanilla en el área D. reforestación y forma parte del comedor D. su zona es así como conoció a EDAPROSPO y se animo a formar el grupo “El nuevo amanecer D. ventanilla” con las socias. Este préstamo le servirá D. mucho porque lo usara para mejorar  el comedero y bebedero D. los cerdos ya que con el tiempo se han deteriorado la señora se siente feliz porque trabaja con toda su familia y se apoyan unos a otros. 

*la Sra Rosa es la cuarta D. la derecha
texts.en:
When she was very small, Rosa always watched her father care for his pigs on his small farm. With this work, her father was able to support the family. Rosa would help him with his work. Later in life, Rosa, now married, decided to go into this business herself, as she had inherited the love for the animals from her father.

Rosa bought some land adequate for raising pigs and began with two small and not very good pigs. Her business began to grow and she had to enlarge her enclosures.

With loans from EDAPROSPO, she has maD. many improvements, such as improving the breeds of the animals and arranging the enclosures. The farm is growing and getting better every day, which makes her happy. She also is happy that her children are following in her footsteps. In the future, she plans to reconstruct all the enclosures with good materials, as they are now maD. of wood and adobe and are not secure. With time, she will modernize the farm to be on a par with others in the same business.

AsiD. from the farm, Rosa also works for the city of Ventanilla in the department of reforestation and also at a dining room in her neighborhood. This is how she came to know of EDAPROSPO and was motivated to form the “El Nuevo Amanecer D. Ventanilla” [“The New Dawn of Ventanilla”] loan group with the other members.

This loan will be used to improve the food and water troughs for the pigs, as they have deteriorated over time. Rosa feels happy because she works with her whole family, and they support one another.

In the picture, Rosa is the fourth from the right.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve water and food troughs on her farm

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita T. is a business-minded woman. She is 65 years old and the mother of two daughters and one son. Her husband passed away so she is now the single mother of her children. She lives in Jala-jala, in the province of Rizal, Philippines. She belongs to a poor family that needs help to change their standard of living and she is grateful to ASHI for support, even in all the challenges in life.

With her belief and faith in getting out of poverty, Lolita decided in 2009 to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with a chance of having start-up capital for generating income. During her first loan from ASHI, she carefully invested in her sari-sari store (a small retail store selling different goods). The profit is what she uses for daily expenses.

Now on her 2nd loan, Lolita proposes Php 10,000 to create a broader business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase sacks of rice, powdered milk, frozen foods, canned goods, candies, etc. She is very determined and disciplined to use the money which is lent to her. 

Lolita still dreams of the best for her family: to provide the best education for her children and to have a happy family. During her almost one year in ASHI, she has shown herself to be industrious and determined to make her dreams come true. She would love to have her own house someday.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her shop

loans.name: J Trinidad

texts.es: El señor J Trinidad  M. tiene poco de estar pensionado aunque el recibe dinero por esto, el quiere sentirse una persona útil; que a pesar de su edad puede trabajar para seguir ofreciéndole una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa. La señora siempre lo apoya en los proyectos de su marido en el que desde hace 8 meses instalaron un negocio de comida en una avenida muy transitada de la ciudad donde venden tacos de barbacoa y menudo por las mañanas. Ahora ellos quieren mejorar el puesto para que se vea bien y les agrade a los clientes.
texts.en:
Señor J Trinidad M. has little to be a pensioner. Although he receives money for this, he wants to feel a useful person, and notwithstanding his age he can work to continue offering a better quality of life to his wife. His wife always supports him in his projects and 8 months ago he installed a food business in a very busy avenue of the city where they sell barbecued tacos and food in the mornings. Now they want to improve their stand so that it looks good and pleases their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of food stand

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos: Leida tiene 15 años y Lisbeth tiene 10 años. Eduarda se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y mandar a sus hijos menores al colegio. Eduarda y su esposo se dedican a la venta  de pollo congelado. La socia vende condimentos en el mercado antiguo de Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Eduarda requiere el préstamo para comprar más condimentos como pimienta, comino, sal, ají seco y muchos más condimentos. 

Eduarda pertenece al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANNIYOC” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. La ciudad de Rayanniyoc esta ubicado a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Eduarda is 32 years old; she lives with her common law husband and has 2 children: fifteen year old Leida and ten year old Lisbeth. Eduarda gets up very early each day to do her household chores, such as preparing breakfast and sending her children to school. She and her husband earn a living by selling frozen chicken. She sells spices in Urubamba’s old market and has had this business for several years. It has gone well thanks to her effort and dedication. Eduarda will use the loan to buy more spices, such as pepper, cumin, salt and dry chile. She is a member of “VILLA RAYANNIYOC”, a communal bank of the Arariwa Association, and is very grateful for this opportunity. She promises to pay back the loan according to the payment schedule. The city of Rayanniyoc is half an hour away from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Eduarda will use the loan to buy more spices, such as pepper, cumin, salt, dry chile and others.

loans.name: Julia Lilly

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de Chinandega, se ha destacado la señora Julia Lilly P. por vender los productos de madera tales como mesas, sillas, cunas, entre otros. También ella vende productos metálicos como pailas, cucharas, entre otros.
A pesar de su avanzada edad, hay mucho que aprender de ella porque es una dama muy trabajadora y siempre busca la manera de llevar e l sustento a su hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de los productos de madera y los productos metálicos con el fin de continuar ofreciéndolos en el mercado y así satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs.Julia Lilly P. stands out in the central market of Chinandega because she sells wooden goods such as tables, chairs, and cribs. She also sells products made from metal such as frying pans and spoons. Despite her advanced age, there is a lot to learn from her since she is a very hard worker and is always looking for a way to support her home. The loan she is requesting will be used for the purchase of wooden and metal products so that she can continue to sell them in the market and satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wooden/metal goods

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom P., age 62, is married and lives with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia. They have three children. He is in the business of raising animals and growing crops, earning approximately US$ 2 per day. By doing so, he is able to cover his family expenses. He has been in business since 1999. His wife is a housewife who stays at home to look after the children and the household chores. Their standard of living has improved since P. began this business, so he wants a loan to expand it further. He is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work at a local garment factory. This is his first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the children to travel to work

loans.name: Soraida

texts.en:
Soraida B., 49, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Freddie B., a vendor, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own hamburger stand for quite some time now.

Soraida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 12 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrowed to expand and improve her hamburger stand.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying raw ingredients needed to continue production of her hamburgers and other products.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for her hamburgers and other products.

loans.name: Jean Marie

texts.en:
Jean Marie C. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Jean Marie is single. To make a living, Jean Marie owns & operates a business buying & selling fish to the local community members. Jean Marie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jean Marie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean Marie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jean Marie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks, wine and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo L. mena es un señor de 49 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Toda su vida Don Fernando se ha dedicado a la Agricultura, principalmente a la siembra de Hortalizas, lo cual siempre le ha dado buenos resultados. Pero debido a la falta de dinero para mantener en buen estado su finca esta ha dejado de producir buenas cosechas.

 Es por eso que Don Mateo necesita un crédito de ¢605.000 (seiscientos cinco  mil colones), para comprar semilla de pasto, abono, herbicidas y todo lo necesario  para darle al terreno las condiciones optimas para que vuelva a producir igual que antes y así mejorar su venta de Hortalizas.


Don Mateo  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. El está muy agradecido por el acceso al crédito brindado por este tipo de empresas.
texts.en:
Mateo L. is a 49 year old man. He lives with his wife and their child in a community called Santa Fe. It is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community stands out as being a mountainous area and for being very close to the northern border of our country. Its primary economical activities are livestock and farming. The specific agricultural activity is planting basic grains, sugarcane, and oranges. Mateo has farmed all of his life. He primarily grows vegetables, which have always given good results. But, due to the lack of money to keep his farm in good shape, it has stopped producing good harvests. That is why Mateo needs a loan for 605,000 colones to buy grass seed, fertilizer, herbicides, and all that is necessary to get the land in optimal condition to start producing like it used to and improve his vegetable sales. Mateo is a member of the Manatial de Santa Fe Communal Bank, one of the 100 organizations that are part of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and he plans to use it to grow more on a personal level and economically. He is very grateful for the access to the loan provided by this type of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grass seed and wire for a fence

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María de 40 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento, tiene cuatro hijos de 23, 19, 13 y 9 años que aun estudian. 

María empezó a vender comida por pedido a los trabajadores del puerto de embarcaciones de la Perimetral desde que lo abrieron. Poco a poco fue incrementando su clientela con el ingreso que obtuvo pudo alquilar un local y vender su comida con un mejor servicio.

Sus hijos cuando llegan de la escuela le ayudan a vender los almuerzos. Ella trabaja desde las 06h00 haciendo la comida hasta las 15h00pm.  El préstamo lo quiere utilizar para comprar los útiles escolares de sus hijos ya que entraron a clases y le piden muchos libros y cuadernos. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
María, 40, lives in a periurban area along Guayaquil’s beltway; her house is cement. She has four children who are still students; they are 23, 19, 13 and 9 years old respectively. María started out selling prepared meals on order to employees of the beltway’s shipping dock since it opened. Gradually her customer base grew and the income she earned made it possible for her to rent a space in which to sell her food with better service. When her four children come home from school they help her sell lunches. She is open for business from 6am until 3pm. She will use the funds to buy school supplies for her children because the new school term has started and they are asked to provide a lot of textbooks and notebooks. In the future, she would like to build her house better and that her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For notebooks and textbooks.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Khem S., 54, is widowed and lives with her two children in Preyveng Province; the name literally means "long forest" in Khmer. She is a hairdresser and earns an income of about USD 8 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a truck so one of her children can operate a business as a taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a truck for her child to operate a taxi business

loans.name: Virginia Delmira

texts.es:
Virginia de 59 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, ella para tener el taller de costura que ahora tiene tuvo que trabaja por muchos años como ayudante de costura en un taller. Pero al ver que sus hijos necesitaban mas útiles escolares decidió independizarse y comprar con sus ahorros una maquina de coser y telas. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo y noches sin dormir pudo tener su taller de costura en su casa. Ahora hace ropa por pedidos de sus clientes, el promedio que gana por prenda es de $ 6.00 a $ 25.00. Para tener un mejor taller con mas diversidad de telas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, botones, y arreglar mejor la maquina de coser.
 
En el futuro ella quiere tener uno de los talleres mas grandes de todo su sector.
texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old. She lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. She had to work for many years as an assistant in a sewing workshop in order to have the sewing workshop she owns now. When she saw that her children needed more school supplies she decided to become independent and buy a sewing machine and fabric with her savings. Little by little, with hard work and sleepless nights, she was able to have her sewing workshop in her house. Now she makes clothing to order for her customers. The average she makes for each article of clothing is $ 6.00 to $ 25.00. To have a better workshop with a bigger variety of fabrics, she wants to purchase fabric, buttons and fix her sewing machine with the loan. In the future, she wants to have one of the biggest workshops in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Telas, botones

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 1  est un regroupement  de femmes mariées du village de Dah de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, au moins 4 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
MINATA C. utilisera son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants,  au grand marché de San ville. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte  est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Dah, San  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 1 is a group of married women from the village of Dah in the San Prefecture of the Segou region (4th administrative region of Mali) who live in traditional extended families. On average, the women are 36 years old and have at least four children. They grow peanuts. Because of concerns about the profitability of their farm, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. This is their third farming loan and they have repaid their previous loans. Minata C. will use her loan to buy peanut seeds, small agricultural tools and soil additives, at the general market in the town of San. After the rainy season, the crop will be stored for it to gain value and then sold at the general markets in Dah, San and in surrounding markets, in stores (often in bulk), or to cash customers from large cities. The members of the group each expect to make a revenue of 35 000 CFA Francs from selling this agricultural product, which will be used to repay the loan and cover the family's expenditures.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs, seeds and small agricultural tools.

loans.name: Lenyvel

texts.en:
Lenyvel C. is from the village of Calaran Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, married and has 2 infants. Lenyvel owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily use products such as noodles, brown sugar, shampoo, soap & toothpaste, candies and canned goods. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lenyvel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. Lenyvel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Lenyvel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. K., 32, owns a small hand-cart that she uses to sell snack food around her community. She typically makes around $3 USD of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. In addition, she and her husband always buy used goods to resell, and they are able to generate $7 USD a day from this business. The couple has been married for years and has two teenage children. One of their children is employed in a garment factory. Mrs. K. will be using her loan to buy a trailer to connect with her existing motor so that she can pick up more used goods.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to connect with existing motor

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es casada con Francisco,ella trabaja en San Martin Jilotepeque,se dedica a la vanta de maiz por quintal
Y, por libra en el mercado Municipal, y parte de eso realiza blusas tipicas borda solo lunes y miercoles los jueves y domingo vende en el mercado, por ahora no tiene quien la ayude pero piensa colocar una trabajadora. Solisita el credito para comprar maiz por mayor,telas. Agradece a fape por el apoyo brindado, sueña con tener otro negocio de maiz, para ayudarce ella y al mismo tiempo ayudar a su esposo con sus hijos ya que estan en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Rosario is married to Francisco. She works in San Martin Jilotepeque, selling corn by the quintal [100-pound sack] and by the pound at the municipal market, and creating traditional blouses. She embroiders only on Mondays and Wednesdays, and on Thursdays and Sundays she sells at the market. At present, she has no one to help her, but she is thinking of employing a female worker. She is requesting the loan to buy corn and fabric on a wholesale basis. She is grateful to FAPE for the support provided to her. She dreams of having another corn business, so that she can gain resources for herself and help her husband to support their children, who are already of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies to make clothing, and also corn

loans.name: Aidee Maricela

texts.es:
Aidee de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. Tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Hace unos años atrás comenzó con su tienda de ropa vendiendo ropa de niño ya que por su sector no había, poco a poco con esfuerzo y la motivación de mantener a sus tres hijos invirtió sus ahorros en ropa y vitrinas, ahora tiene su pequeña tienda de ropa en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Ella quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y bisutería y así surtir mejor el local. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y darle un mejor financiamiento a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aidee, 25, lives in a periurban zone in El Paraíso, Guayaquil, an area noted for its hilly streets. She has a small clothing store in the front part of her house. A few years back she started with her clothing store selling children’s clothes that were unavailable around her neighborhood. Gradually with much effort and needing to support her three children she invested her savings in clothes and display cases. Now she has her small clothing store in the front part of her house. She needs a loan to buy clothes and costume jewelry to better stock her store. In the future she’d like to finish building her house and provide better income for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Wendelyn

texts.en:
Wendelyn T., from the village of Tabon, is 42 years old, married, and has six children. To make a living, Wendelyn owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Wendelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 3000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph Mbodo is a 70 year old married man. He was introduced to KADET LIMITED by a Credit Officer and this is his 1st loan with the company. Joseph owns a farm in the Lamu area of Nairobi.
The farm business which he operates has been in place for the past 34 years now. Joseph plans to use his loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy more goats to grow his business.
His customers are mainly residence of Nairobi area where the farm is situated. Joseph hopes to use the anticipated profit that will come from the sales to grow his business into large scale farming and later venture into mixed farming.

loans.use: Buy more goats to sell for a profit

loans.name: Yu

texts.en:
Yu T., 42, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia: an area known for palm products. T.’s husband is a driver and provides transportation services to people in the province, earning an income of about USD 7 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 40 on children’s education, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  

T. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband so that he can operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

T. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
Six people are forming this group loan. They are located in Kbal Kaoh Thmei village, Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Dy K. as the group leader. Each members of the group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Dy K. owns a small store in the local market where she sells pickle fish (Khmer cheese called Prohok) and fish sauce. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it so she would liK. to ask for a loan to buy more pickle fish for her current business activity. Beside from this business, she is also farmer who owns a plot of land to grow different kinds vegetable. Mrs. Dy K. is a widow with four children; two of whom are banana sellers, and the others are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more pickle fish to enlarge her business activities

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 60 years old. Avelino is married and has 1 child. He is a rice farmer and supports his family through farming. His wife helps him sell his harvest to the market. Avelino says he wants to improve his earnings so he can keep up with the increasing needs in his household.

Avelino joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelino is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is married with one child and is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya. For five years, she has been practicing mixed farming. Evaline produces eggs, tomatoes, and vegetables that are sold locally.

Evaline has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase poultry. This will be her second loan with Juhudi Kilimo. Evaline says her family will have eggs for consumption and will earn income from selling eggs. Her challenges include food shortages and poultry disease. In the future, Evaline is focusing on expanding her poultry farm to one thousand hens to be the major supplier of eggs in her local market.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Virginia Rita

texts.es: Sra. Virginia es cliente antigua que esta retornando después de mas de tres años, su familia solo compone de su hija de 20 años y ella, ya que sus hijas mayores tienen ya familia y ya no viven cerca de ella solo la visitan de vez en cuando los fines de semana, Sra. Virginia como la conocen todos tiene un almacén en la zona de Cota Cota esta cerca de su  casa esta aproximadamente de  2 cuadras y media de la tienda, además que ella con su hija participa en la venta de artesanías y también vende sándwich y refrescos en en la cancha de césped sintética los fines de semana ya que requiere de una buena inversión ya que solo en refrescos lleva 20cajas cada fin de semana, ella en este momento solicita el crédito para hacer un pedidos de panetones que solo se hace una ves por mayor y además solicita el resto para la compra de abarrotes de por lo que se solicita el financiamiento kiva.
texts.en: Ms. Virginia is an old client who has returned after more than three years. Her family is only made up of her 20 year-old daughter and herself. Her older daughters already have families and no longer live near her, only visiting from time to time on the weekends. Ms. Virginia, as everyone knows, has a grocery store in the Cota Cota zone approximately 2 and a half blocks from her house. As well, her and her daughter participate in the sale of crafts and also sell sandwiches and soft drinks at the synthetic grass playing field on the weekends. This requires a good investment since she handles 20 cases of soft drinks alone each weekend. At this time she is requesting a loan through Kiva financing to make an order of panetones, which are only made once for wholesale, and the rest she is requesting for the purchase of groceries.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (panetones and groceries)

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Pangobilian, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by fishing and with a general store business. Her husband, Cornelio, age 60, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 30 to 39 years old. Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Lolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 16,000 PHP, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing 22,000 PHP which she intends to use to buy a new engine for the fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for the improvement of her business and for her family's security. Lolita B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Miriam Victoria

texts.es:
Miriam Victoria C. es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de gaseosas y chiverías. Ella con la ayuda de sus hijos puso este pequeño negocio el cual gracias a los préstamos y la ardua labor de ella, su nuera y nieto ha ido creciendo.

La meta de C. de 64 años desea aumentar su negocio hasta convertirla en una miscelánea.
texts.en: Miriam Victoria C. is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a small grocery shop which she began by selling soft drinks and snacks.  She established the business with the help of her children, and thanks to loans and the hard work by her, her daughter-in- law, and her grandson it has grown.  Carillo, age 64, wants to enlarge her business until it is converted into a general store.

loans.use: To purchase dried grains, snacks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gozalo C.: trabaja actualmente en su terreno cultivando maiz y frijol tiene venta de carbon, y leña tiene 5 hijos a el le encargan tareas de leña por mayor el es muuy solicitado porque se a caracterizado por la venta de leña y venta de carbon cuando viene la epoca de sembrar maiz, siembra y con eso se ayuda porque ya no compra maiz y ademas vende la mitad y saca muy buena ganancia, el solicita este credito para compra de una bomba para fumigar su siembra, el sueño de el es poder tener un vehiculo mas para transportarse facil mente.
texts.en: Gozalo C. works on his land, growing corn and beans. He also sells charcoal and firewood. He has 5 children. He receives wholesale orders for firewood and is sought after because he has become known for selling firewood and charcoal. When the season for growing corn arrives, he plants and this helps because then he does not have to buy corn and in addition he sells half of it and is able to make a good profit. This loan is to buy a pump to fumigate his crop. His dream is to have a vehicle so that he can transport himself more easliy.

loans.use: Buy a pump for fumigating his crops

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 31-year-old, industrious businessman from Pap Onditi, an upcoming town near the city of Kisumu. He is married to Alice who operates a money transfer business (known as M-pesa). 

Paul has been operating a motorcycle spare parts shop in Pap Onditi for the past two years. At the moment, Paul makes a monthly income of Kshs 30,000. He is taking his first loan of Kshs. 25,000 which he intends to use to buy additional stock of spare parts. 


He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into his business and to support his wife in her money transfer business. His hope is to stabilize his business and to become a leading businessman in his town.

loans.use: To buy stock of  spare parts.

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Шамсидин житель Вахшского района. Ему 59 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование - высшее, учитель. По профессии проработал 12 лет. Кроме того в свободное от работы время он занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Shamsiddin A. lives in Vakhsh district. He is 59 and married with four children. He has a higher education and has worked as a teacher for 12 years. In addition he raises livestock in his free time from work. Primarily he raises these animals for sale. He has been doing this for 12 years. Shamsiddin has applied for a loan to purchase additional livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Evidel Alexander

texts.es:
Evidel de 21 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus padres y hermanos, es soltero, no tiene hijos, en su familia todos trabajan para colaborar con sus padres, él por su parte se dedica a la ganadería, comenzó a dedicarse a esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres, no tiene un horario fijo de atención.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar ganado, ya que se le presenta la oportunidad de adquirir ganado por que él quiere realizar la compra.
El objetivo de Evidel es adquirir ganado cada vez que exista la oportunidad, para ir creciendo poco a poco y ayudar a sus padres para mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Evidel is 21 years old and resides in San Rafael Oriente in the Department of San Miguel. He lives with his parents and siblings. Evidel is single and has no children. He and his family work together. Evidel raises cattle and started in this activity with the help of his parents. He cares for his animals, but he does not have a fixed schedule.

Evidel is currently requesting a loan to buy cattle. He has been presented with an opportunity to acquire cattle, so he wants to take advantage of it. His goal is to obtain cattle through this existing opportunity so that he grow slowly and help his parents improve their financial condition.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Jacqueline Concepción

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Jacqueline, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de  7, 3 y de 1 año, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante de pescado.

Ella tiene un bazar y papelería en su casa en el cual vende regalos, peluches, tarjetas, útiles escolares y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). También los sábados y domingos ella prepara y vende los deliciosos encebollados, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 18h00. Tiene dos años con su negocio en el cual le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas, útiles escolares, peluches, tarjetas entre otros productos. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por el cumplimiento de sus compañeras.

 Su sueño es tener su casa con buenos acabados ya que lea que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres con Esperanza' (Women with Hope) community bank meet in Eloy Alfaro parish, in the city of Manta.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches which are popular year round with both domestic and foreign tourists.  It is one of the most important ports in the country and in America, and is situated on the Pacific coast.

Here we meet Jacqueline who is 24 years old.  She lives with her partner and they have three children aged 7, 3 and 1.  Her eldest is attending elementary school.  Jacqueline's husband is a fish seller.

Jacqueline has a stationery store in her home where she sells gifts, cuddly toys, cards, school supplies and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  On Saturdays and Sundays she also makes and sells delicious 'encebollados' (a traditional stew made with tuna, cassava, tomatoes and onion).  Jacqueline works every day from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  She has been in her business for two years and it is doing very well.

Jacqueline will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, school supplies, cuddly toys, cards and other products.  This is her second loan cycle as a member of her community bank and she likes the bank because her fellow members are reliable.  Her dream is to have a nicely finished home since her current home is made from cane.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, cuddly toys, cards, perfumes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Inmaculada Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se inició gracias a la Señora Bibiana, el grupo se llama ”Inmaculada”, fue ella quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en dicha zona.
La Sra. Bibiana B. es muy humilde, responsable y trabajadora, ella contactó con la Fundación, con el fin de participar del proyecto Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, con sus amigas y amigas de su barrio.
Gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya todas las integrantes mejoraron su calidad de vida satisfaciendo todas sus necesidades básicas y las de su hogar.
Las mismas mujeres se sienten muy orgullosas de estar formando parte del comité, porque gracias al apoyo, crédito y capacitación recibidas anteriormente por la Fundación se abrieron y sigue abriendo puertas en los distintos lugares.
El comité se encuentra en el Quinto Ciclo.
La sra. Bibiana se dedica a la venta de comestibles y desea poder adquirir otro crédito para comprar más bebidas, panificados, legumbres, entre otras mercaderías que sean de primera necesidad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The present committee started thanks to Bibiana.  The group is called “Inmaculada.”  She was the one who contacted her neighbors and friends to form the committee in that neighborhood.

Mrs. Bibiana Benitez is very humble, responsible and hard working.  She contacted the Fundación intending to participate in the Enterprising Women Committee with her friends and neighbors from the neighborhood.

Thanks to Fundación Paraguaya all the members improved their quality of life satisfying all their basic needs and those of their homes.

These same women feel very proud to be part of this committee because, thanks to the support, loans and training received previously from the Fundación, they opened and their doors are still open in various places.  The committee is in its fifth cycle.

Bibiana sells foodstuffs and wants to get another loan to buy drinks, baked goods and vegetables, among other groceries for her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: G.s. Moises Group

texts.es: La señora Tomasa ella se dedica al comercio de mercadería en general, la cual distribuye de manera ambulante. Su compañero de vida trabaja como sonidista en un conjunto musical. Tiene 3 hijos que estudian 1 en primaria y uno en secundaria.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería comopantalones, camisas, faldas, calzado, perfumes, cremas, tratamientos entre otros  así considera que su negocio incrementara con ayuda de los prestamos.  La señora Blanca Rosa además de trabajar en una zona franca también se dedica al comercio de  bisuterías en general, las cuales distribuye de forma ambulante. Ella es casada, su esposo es sastre y tiene 5 hijos, todos menores de edad y estudiando. Desea continuar invirtiendo en el negocio para que crezca y en un futuro solo dedicarse a su negocio. Atanacio Estanislao es un integrante nuevo del grupo, el tiene 58 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos estudiando en la universidad de 18 y 20 años de edad. El señor se dedica a la venta de artículos en general, los cuales distribuye en el M.. Antes elaboraba pantalones y los vendía en el M., sin embargo vender diferentes mercaderías es mejor para incrementar los ingresos. El inicio el negocio desde hace  18 años y ha sido duro ya que el capital inicial fue prestado, poco a poco ha ido haciendo su propio capital.
texts.en:
Tomasa sells general merchandise, which she distributes in an itinerant manner.  Her life partner works as a sound technician for a musical group.  She has one child in elementary school and one in high school.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise like pants, shirts, skirts, footwear, perfume, cream, and treatments, among other items.  This way her business will increase with help from the loans.

In addition to working in the free zone, Blanca Rosa sells general costume jewelry in an itinerant manner.  She is married, and her husband is a tailor.  She has five minor children, and they attend school.  She wishes to continue investing in her business.  She will do this so that it will grow.  Then she will only devote herself to her business in the future.

Atanacio Estanislao, age 58, is a new member of the group.  He is married and has two children attending the university.  They are 18 and 20 years old.  He sells general items in the market.  He used to make pants and sell them in the market.  However, selling different merchandise is better for increasing his earnings.  He started his business 18 years ago.  It has been difficult because his initial capital was borrowed.  Little by little he has been making his own capital.

loans.use: to buy  pants, shirts, skirts, footwear, perfume, cream, and treatments, among other items.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita de 38 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, es una mujer muy  trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Marcelino de 43 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Anita trabaja todos los días en sus tierras, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sean muy productivas, por lo que puede sembrar de todo un poco, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra cacao, café, y hojas de coca,  ya que estos son los productos que se venden en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar sus plantas, lo cual eso reduciría mucho sus ganancias, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, pues es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su segundo préstamo de Anita con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudar mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará mayas por rollo para combatir  los insectos quienes perjudican sus frutos.
texts.en: Anita is 38 years old. She is from Quimbiri City. She is a hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Marcelino who is 43 years old and her three darling children who she hopes to provide with the best quality of life. Along with her husband, Anita works each day on the land, which, with much effort, has been very productive work. They grow a little of everything. Everything they grow is of good quality. They mainly grow cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves, as these are what they mainly sell in the market. What she most likes about her work is protecting the seedlings from insects that can damage the plants. Damaged plants would greatly reduce her earnings. She has been doing this business for the past 20 years. The most difficult thing about her business is transporting her product to the city of San Francisco. They sell their products in this city. In the future she would like to save her money in order to buy more land. This is Anita’s second loan with MFP. This loan will help her a lot with her business. She is thankful for the institution that provides her with this loan. With this loan she will buy rolls of sticky bug tape in order to combat the insects that attack her fruit.

loans.use: to buy rolls of sticky bug tape in order to trap insects.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a Ugandan male, aged 44 years, who needs a loan to pay laborers for weeding his maize plantation. He hails from the Kyenjojo district, and is the father of three children, aged 14, 12 and 5. He dreams of educating his children and building a permanent house to replace the semi-permanent house that he now owns. A farmer for ten years, he acquired his start up capital from accumulated savings from his salary at a local tea factory.

loans.use: to pay laborers for weeding his maize plantation.

loans.name: Koutediomboulo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui habitent la même localité. Leurs différentes activités sont la vente d'huile de palme, de crevettes et de légumes.

Madame Khady qui est à droite de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a en charge cinq autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s'active dans la vente de crevettes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité, car elle l'a pratiqué depuis plus de dix ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son capital pour répondre à la demande de ses clients.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge des frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: The borrowing group was created on October 19, 2001.  It consists of 7 women who live in the same area.  Their different businesses include the sale of palm oil, shrimp, and vegetables.  Mrs. Khady, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the head of the group.  She is married and mother of one child.  She supports five other children entrusted to her by their parents. She is in the business of selling shrimp.  She has solid experience in this activity because she has been doing it for over 10 years.  This loan will allow her to increase her capital and meet the demand of her customers.  The profits will enable her to contribute to the payment of her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy shrimp.

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Sokhum, 41 years old, is a porter. Her husband is a chief of construction workers. Their income is $4 per day. They have two children, 11 and 5 years old. One is studying. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

Sokhum would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her sister for traveling to work. She wants to extend her business and make more products to sell in other provinces. For her children, she plans to send them to study until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her sister for traveling to work.

loans.name: Nunufar

texts.en: Nunufar works in a kindergarten. Most of the family’s income comes from the farm and beehives. To increase their income Nunufar would like to buy two head of cattle and forage for winter. The additional income will greatly assist Nunufar’s and her husband’s very modest living.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

loans.name: Mehrojidin

texts.en:
Mehrojidin is a hardworking man. He is married and the father of three children. His wife is a housewife. Mehrojidin is engaged in the buying and selling of cattle at a local market called “Vahdat”. He purchases cattle at 1800 to 2000 TJS then sells them at 2000 to 2200 TJS. With this premium he earns money and feeds his family. He has been running this business for ten years. With the loan that Mehrojidin has requested he plans to purchase cattle in order to make a good profit.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a very industrious mother and wife. She is a 48-year-old mother blessed with five children. Four of her children are already married and living separately away from them. Leonor is currently engaged in a business buying and selling fruit such as coconut and banana. She also raises pigs to meet her family needs completely. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase an additional head of piglets and feed for her hog raising business. Her youngest son is her helper in maintaining her businesses. He helps her every Saturday and Sunday since he attends school during the weekdays. Leonor hopes that she can provide all the needs of her youngest in school so that he will able to finish his education through college someday.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Daphne

texts.en:
Daphne is a farmer who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is 25 years old, married and has a 5-year-old child. 

Daphne's husband works as a farmer as well. They till their own land and grow rice crops to sell. Daphne does her best to support her husband in their business and in taking care of her child.

Daphne requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds. She wishes to build her family's dream house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna manages her sari-sari (variety store) for almost four years. Daily income from the business goes for daily meals and allowances for her children. She has eight children. Two of her children have already finished their college and are employed. She is now 57 years old and her spouse works as a local farmer.

Due to insufficient capital to diversify her business, Myrna is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy soft drinks, breads and canned goods to sell in her store. She would like to stock more groceries in her store to attract more customers and thus increase her earnings to sustain all the needs of her children for a better education.

In the future, Myrna would like to strengthen her business to earn more profits to make her family more economically stable and be able to save for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads and canned goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolás se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, tiene más de 18 años de tener este medio de vida. Fue por iniciativa propia que empieza este negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su vivienda a comprar sus productos pues es aquí que él tiene su negocio. Él solicita este crédito para la compra de leche, cuajada, queso, leche agria entre otros. El sueña con obtener un camión  que le ayude a repartir sus productos.
texts.en: Nicolás sells dairy products and has been in that business for more than 18 years. He began this business of his own initiative. The majority of his clients come to his house to buy his products and so it’s there that he has his business. He is asking for this loan to buy milk, curd, cheese, sour milk, etc. He dream is to have a truck which could help him distribute his products.

loans.use: to buy milk, curd, cheese, sour milk, etc.

loans.name: Tania Xilonem

texts.es: Tania de 30 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, trabaja para el supermercado Tiangue Cocibolca desde hace 8 meses desempeñandose como responsable de alimentos y verduras.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de comprar las puertas para su casa, pues poco a poco ha ido haciendo su casita y le falta instalar las puertas para brindar mayor seguridad a su casa y a su familia.  Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a sus hijos un hogar feliz y que cuando crezcan sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Tania is 30, single, and has two school-age children. She has been working eight months for the Tiangue Cocibolca supermarket, where she is responsible for the food and vegetables section.

She is applying for her first loan with the aim of buying doors for her house. She has been working on her small house little by little, and needs to install the doors in order to provide greater security for her home and family. 

Her greatest dream is to be able to offer her children a happy home, and that they be respectable people when they grow up.

loans.use: To buy doors for her house.

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru: Одил женат, отец троих детей. Для содержания и обучения своих детей он занимается предпринимательством, купле - продажей риса. Он в сезон закупает рис по низким ценам и в течении года продает его по доходным ценам. Полученные доходы помогают ему в содержании своей семьи. Полученный кредит он хочет потратить на расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Odil is married and is a father of three children. He runs his own business of buying and selling rice to support his family and for education of his children. During the season he buys rice at low prices and sells it throughout the year at more profitable cost. The received profit helps him to support his family. He wants to use the loan to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase rice.

loans.name: Arshaluys

texts.en: Arshaluys is from the village of Keti in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is happily married with three children – two daughters (eight and seventeen years old) and an eighteen-year-old son.  Arshaluys has a university education as an economist.  Ironically, with the difficult economic situation in Armenia, he is not working in his area of specialization.  To support his family, Arshaluys has been engaged as a farmer for the past ten years.  He is known for being a hardworking, honest person.  Arshaluys is looking for a loan to purchase livestock and feed.  He estimates that this investment will increase the family income by twenty percent.  Arshaluys wants to save enough money so his children will receive a university education.  He would also, someday, like to remodel the family home.  He likes his hometown of Keti, which has beautiful land and fresh water.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose, de 31 años, es una hombre bueno y amable. Vive con su pareja, con quien tiene un hijo de 9 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, y trabaja mucho para así brindar una buena educación y alimentación a su hijo. El trabajo de José consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, desde muy temprano se levanta a esperar a sus dos choferes, quienes llevan su mototaxi y trabajan dándole un pago en forma de alquiler a diario. Además de este negocio, él trabaja en una panadería,  ya tiene 5 años realizando esta actividad, y con los años fue ahorrando hasta lograr comprar su mototaxi. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que le permite tener un ingreso adicional a su economía, ya que a diario ingresa dinero a su casa, le esta yendo bien, además de tener el negocio de alquiler de mototax. Ahora desea dar mantenimiento a su vehiculo y cambiar algunas piezas. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.
