Se compromete en ser un cliente puntual y trabajar bien con el grupo al que pertenece. Con el monto solicitado, comprará piezas para la refacción de su vehiculo, además renovará la documentación del permiso de conducir ya que están a punto de vencerse.
texts.en:
José, 31, is a good, kind man.  He lives with his partner with whom he has a 9-year-old son.  They live together in their own house and he works very much to provide a good education and food for his son.  José works leasing out a mototaxi.  He rises very early to wait for his two drivers who take the mototaxi to work paying him a daily rental fee.   

Besides this business, he also works in a bakery.  He has had this activity for five years and with the passage of the years was able to buy his mototaxi.  What he likes about his work is that it allows him to have an additional source of income because money comes into his house daily.  He’s doing well in addition to having his mototaxi leasing business.

At present, he’d like to service his vehicle and replace some of its parts.  This will be his first MFP loan so he hopes for your collaboration to continue with his goals.  He commits to be very punctual and to work well with the group he belongs to.  He will use the requested amount to buy replacement parts for his vehicle and will also renew the driver’s license that is about to expire.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to renew his driver’s license.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: La socia tiene 2 hijos de 35 y 31 años de edad; actualmente se dedica  a la atencion de su negocio, la socia acaba de poner un pequeño local frente a la universidad Nacional de Cusco; y su local esta junto a una imprenta, ella esta acomodando su negocio y requiere implementarlo con vitrinas, y terminar de hacer la instalacion electrica, la socia se esta dedicando a la venta de mazamorras y arroz con leche, la socia en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de vitrinas para acomodar algunos kekes y contratar a un tecnico para terminar la instalacion de luz en su nuevo local.
texts.en: The client has 2 children ages 35 and 31 years old. Currently she is working to improve her business, and just installed a small shop in front of the National University of Cusco, near a printing store. She is trying to make her shop more comfortable, and so wants to install shelving units and electricity. She works selling porridge and rice with milk (a local dessert). She will invest the loan in the purchase of glass shelving to hold cakes and to hire a technician to finish installing lights in her new shop.

loans.use: to purchase glass shelving and to hire a technician to finish installing lights in her new shop.

loans.name: Francisca Adjoa

texts.en: Francisca Adjoa sells doughnuts at Besease near Elmina.  She has been selling doughnuts for 12 years.  Francisca Adjoa is a single parent and has three children.  She is responsible for raising her children. She will use this loan to buy flour and sugar. She hopes to use the profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Josephine has a retail shop where she sells dried squid. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy dried squid to sell.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried squid to sell.

loans.name: Yeny Marcela

texts.es: La joven Yeny a sus 23 años de edad ya es madre de cuatro hijos de 7, 5, 4 y 1 año de edad, toda su vida la ha vivido en el campo del municipio del Carmen de Viboral localizado al oriente de Antioquia, con la necesidad de brindar todo lo necesario a sus hijos y esposo, la joven Yeny adecuo en su pequeña finca un espacio para la cría y venta de cerdos. Actualmente, necesita de la compra de cuido y cerdos para poder seguir luchando y generando los ingresos suficientes para suplir las necesidades básicas de su familia. El sueño de la señora Yeny es ampliar su negocio y ver crecer junto con su esposo a sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Yeny is a young woman who is 23 years of age and the mother of four children (ages 7, 5, 4, and 1). She has lived her entire life on a farm in the town of Carmen de Viboral, which is located east of Antioquia. In order to provide everything that her husband and children need, Yeny set up a small space on her farm for raising and selling pigs.

At the moment, she needs to buy pigs and the supplies for their care so that she can continue striving forward and generating sufficient income to meet the basic needs of her family. Sra. Yeny’s dream is to expand her business and grow with her husband and their four children.

loans.use: to buy pigs and the supplies for their care.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen operates a shawls sales business to financially support her husband. She sells her shawls to different clothes shops in the market and earns good income. Her shawls are in high demand in her area as well. She sells a variety of shawls to her customers e.g. embroidered, simple and colorful. She makes good embroidery on her shawls, which helps increase her sales and get good profits. 
Her husband has a job that earns a monthly wage. Yasmeen has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her shawls sales business. With the loan investment, she will buy colored thread, beads and colorful shawls in bulk quantity that will allow her to increase her sales and profits. 
She is confident about her success as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy colored thread, beads and colorful shawls for selling.

loans.name: Horm

texts.en:
Most people living in rural areas prefer working in the farming business. Mrs. Horm is one of them, making a living by planting rice crops. She is now 64 years old and a single parent of two single children. She typically earns a net income of around $3.00 a day from her business. One of her children is involved in the construction sector. And he has a few laborers to help provide his service as well. He receives many orders from his clients to construct their houses. 

Lately, Mrs. Horm’s son has been very busy with his business due to there being many clients who need him to build their houses, but he still lacks construction materials. That is why Mrs. Horm has requested a loan as capital to buy extra construction materials to assist her son’s business.

loans.use: to buy extra construction materials to assist her son’s business.

loans.name: Aeysah

texts.en: Aeysah is a 62 year old widow woman who has 5 family members from Al Zarqa Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements, she would like to buy a new furniture. In the future she wants to expand her home and she hopes to provide for her family a good environment to live in .

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married with four children; all of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for seven years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality of green bananas. She is aspiring to educate her children to university level. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bunches green bananas

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. Rosemary U. is 36 years old. She lives in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells her goods to people in her environment; she is married with four children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO. She needs the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more video cassettes and CDs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to pay schools for her son in secondary school

loans.name: Elvia Teresa

texts.en:
Elvia is 23, has 5 children and for four years now has been raising pigs for a living. Her husband is a driver. At this time, they only have one animal, but her goal is to have between 10-15 pigs. They consume 2 bags of feed weekly to fatten and care for them. She sells the animals in her community (which is in a retirement community of the city, surrounded by mountains.), those living there being her customers. She belongs to the group P. 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

ELVIA TIENE 23 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS, HACE CUATRO AÑOS QUE SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS, SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER, EN ESTOS MOMENTOS SOLO TIENE UN ANIMAL, SU META ES LLEGAR A TENER DE 10 A 15 PUERQUITOS, SEMANALMENTE CONSUME 2 BOLSAS DE ALIMENTO PARA EL ENGORDAMIENTO Y LA CRIANZA. LOS ANIMALES LOS VENDE EN SU COMUNIDAD ( QUE ES UN LUGAR RETIRADO DE LA CIUDAD, RODEADO DE MONTAÑAS) LOS CUALES SON SUS CLIENTES. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO P. 2.

loans.use: Raising pigs.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta is fifty-three. She is divorced and has seven children. She meets household expenses by breeding and raising pigs. She belongs to the group Limonar 6. Her partner in the group also raises and sells pigs. Both would use the loan to buy more livestock and animal feed. They would also use the loan for vaccinations, so that the pigs will not become sick.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

ANTONIETA, tiene 53 años, separada con siete hijos, mantiene su hogar con la crianza y engorda de puercos. Pertenece al grupo Limonar 6 junto con doña Antonieta R. León (venta y crianza de puercos). Ambas esperan con el préstamo comprar más animales, alimentos y vacunas para evitar las enfermedades.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her pig farming business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James N. is 46 years old, married with one child. He lives and operates a butchery at Embakasi Division along the North Airport Road, within Nairobi. James started his business in the year 2004. This was after he researched butcheries in Embakasi Division and found that there was only one butchery in the whole neighborhood. Being a business-minded person, James therefore decided to take a risk and open his own butchery. In order to do this, he sold his old pick-up truck for Ksh.250,000 (US$ 3,680).

Using this money as his initial capital, James constructed a small stall on an undeveloped piece of land that he had purchased earlier. During this time, many residents in the neighborhood encouraged James to open the butchery quickly, since the only other butchery operator used to cheat his clients by selling less meat, since he purposely used faulty scales. Some of the customers also suspected that they were eating un-inspected meat, which during this time may have included donkey meat and some wild game, which is illegal in Kenya.

Due to James' honesty and friendly nature, many customers flock to his butchery, where he sells high quality meat. Apart from that, the area where his business is located is highly industrial, hence many company workers flock to his butchery to have some "nyama choma", "mbuzi choma" or "kuku choma", (these are traditional Kenyan delicacies of roasted beef, roasted goat meat and chicken respectively) together with ugali (a thick paste made from corn flour) and chips (potato fries), which James introduced some eight months ago upon the request of his customers.

Due to the increased number of customers, James intends to expand his business so as to satisfy his customers’ demand for beef, chicken and fish. James is kindly requesting a loan of US$ 1,200). Given this loan, James will be able to purchase a deepfreeze for storage purposes, a chips warmer, and chairs and tables, which will help him to cope with the increasing demand for quality meat. He promises to provide his loyal customers with better services. The repayment period for his loan will be 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase a deepfreeze, chips warmer, 15 chairs, 4 large tables, and a small tent

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya is divorced and lives with her son. She works as a private entrepreneur selling children’s clothing at the Dneprovskyi market in the city of Kherson, Ukraine. Lidiya decided to try her luck in business when she lost her previous job and had to find ways to support herself and her son. She first registered as an entrepreneur six years ago. Since then her working capital has increased to $3000 and her monthly net profit is about $350.

Lidiya has perfect credit history as a client with Nadiya Ukraine. She has promptly repaid three previous loans. Lidiya understands financial assistance is a valuable tool to promote the expansion of her business. That is why she has applied for a loan of $1000 that will provide her with ample capital and resources to develop her business venture and generate more profit.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Ida Luz, who is 48 years old, is a single mother of two children. Her 22-year old daughter is a college student and her 14-year old son is at studying at a prestigious secondary school in their city. Both children support their mother in everything she does. Ida Luz is also caring for her father Carlos S. who is 85 years old, retired, and at his advanced age needs the care of his loving daughter. When Ida was in school she studied jewelry making and for a long time she dedicated herself to the art. The benefit of this has been that she has been able to provide wellbeing and security to her children for a long time. Despite not having an appropriate shop, Ida formed a small center, along with a group of single mothers, to impart her knowledge and teach others the art. As time passed the group progressed and her students began to benefit medically and psychologically, thanks to Ida’s friendly oversight. Nonetheless, it all disintegrated due to her housing arrangement, and since then she has only been working at a conventional job making shoes, fine costume jewelry, and, as she is a good weaver, she makes singles, woven sandals and straps. She longs to start another club with the goal of helping these unselfish mothers and, most importantly, provide them with amenities and materials so they can learn and contribute to a better quality of life for their families. She also wants to open a store, and for each of these plans, she needs investment capital. She appeals to your generous hearts to obtain the amount she requests so she may put her plans into action. Her request will make it possible for many more mothers in Pucallpa to obtain rapidly redeeming and beneficial work.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Ida Luz, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera con dos hijos. Su hija de 22 años es estudiante universitaria y su hijo de 14 años cursa estudios secundarios en un prestigioso centro educativo de su ciudad, ambos hijos apoyan en todo a su madre; también está a cargo a su papá don Carlos S. de 85 años, quien es Jubilado y por su avanzada edad necesita de los cuidados de su cariñosa hija. Ida en un centro ocupacional estudió bijoutería y desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a este arte y con su desempeño a podido brindarle bienestar y seguridad a sus hijos durante mucho tiempo; a pesar de no tener un local apropiado Ida formó junto a un grupo de madres solteras un pequeño centro para impartir sus conocimientos y enseñarles este arte, con el transcurrir del tiempo su sociedad progresaba y sus alumnas empezaron a gozar también de atenciones médicas y psicológicas, gracias a las gestiones amistosas de Ida; sin embargo todo este afán se desintegró por el arreglo de su vivienda, desde entonces sólo se dedica a su trabajo convencional de fabricación de zapatos y joyerías de fantasía fina, a su vez es una buena tejedora ya que hace también individuales, sandalias tejidas y correas. Anhela volver a constituir otro club a fin de ayudar a estas madres desinteresadamente y lo más importante brindarles comodidad y materiales para que estas puedan aprender y contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias, también tiene el propósito de abrir una tienda y para cada uno de estos planes necesita de un capital de inversión, recurre a tu bondadoso corazón a fin de obtener la cantidad que solicita para poner en marcha sus planes. Posibilitemos su petición para que muchas más madres en Pucallpa obtengan una labor de desempeño rápido y provechoso.

loans.use: Buy materials for jewelry-making (stones, special wire, thread, nylon, Corrospun)

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah sells new shoes and is asking for this loan in the hope of expanding that little business. She wants to use the profits from her business to buy a plot of land as well as offer a wider variety of shoes.

She and her three friends, Jane, Sophia, and Francis, will each receive a share of this loan to invest in their individual businesses so as to earn increased profit that will enable them to better support their families.

loans.use: To expand each of their individual businesses

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
A 72-year-old widow with two children, Mrs. Sek O., works on her farmland growing rice and a variety of vegetables, earning on average around $0.50 each day. One of her children owns musical instruments and hires them out to the people in his area, specifically whenever a particular wedding is celebrated. It enables him to earn generally about $3 each day in profit. Her other child works with her in the rice field.

Mrs. Sek O. has humbly requested a loan to purchase more musical instruments for her son so that he can meet his rental customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more musical instruments for her son so he can meet his rental customers’ needs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hòa is 48 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She and her husband live with their youngest 2. Their other children are married and live on their own, some work far away from home. Her main occupation is raising pigs. Her income, from selling the pigs, is around 1000 USD a year. After joining TYM, Mrs Hòa had the opportunity to expand her animal husbandry business. Noticing that a cow would brings in more profit she has bought 1-2 calves to raise. She would sell the animals when the price is right. After a few successful rounds, she now applies for another loan of 525 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hòa, 48 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 người con út tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. 4 người con đầu của chị người đã có gia đình riêng, người đi làm xa. Công việc hàng ngày của chị Hòa hiện nay là chăn nuôi lợn. Mỗi năm thu nhập trung bình từ hoạt động này khoảng 1000USD. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ, chị Hòa có điều kiện để mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi của mình. Nhận thấy việc buôn bán bò đang mang lại lợi nhuận, chị đầu tư vốn mua 1-2 con bò về nuôi. Khi được giá chị bán bò thu lãi. Sau những lần thành công trước, vòng vốn này chị Hòa tiếp tục xin vay 525USD đầu tư cho hoạt động này.

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es:
Priscila is 55 years old and is a widow with three grown children, two boys and a girl, who are now independent. Her entire forty-year career has been spent building her own business. She learned from her parents when she was very young and, with the dream of getting a good job, moved to her country’s capital to find work and to study. However, she soon faced the sad reality that it wasn’t so easy and that there was a lot of competition and no shortage of employers waiting to take advantage of her. It was then that she decided to start her own business in market number four there in the capital and rented a stand where she could sell staple goods.

Later she married and returned to her hometown where she continued in the same business with much success. Today she has a general store where she sells staple goods and items for the home and her prosperous business continues to grow.

This loan will be used to buy sugar, pasta, baked goods, herbs, rice, fruits, vegetables, canned goods and items for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Priscila tiene 55 años de edad, es viuda con tres hijos, dos varones y una mujer; todos ya mayores e independientes. Ella se dedica al comercio hace más de cuarenta años, toda una vida dedicada a esta actividad.

Este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres desde muy joven, y con el sueño de obtener un buen empleo se mudó a la capital, para poder trabajar y estudiar, sin embargo se encontró con la triste realidad de que no era fácil ya que había mucha competencia y no faltaban empleadores que querían aprovecharse de ella. Fue así que decidió emprender su propio negocio en el mercado cuatro de la capital, alquilando un puesto en donde vendía mercaderías de primera necesidad.

Luego se casó y regresó a su ciudad, en donde prosiguió en el mismo ramo con mucho éxito, hoy día tiene un prospero negocio que crece cada vez más, el mismo es un almacén en donde vende productos de primera necesidad para el hogar.

El préstamo lo utilizará para compra de azúcar, fideo, panificados, yerba ,arroz, frutas, verduras, productos enlatados, artículos para el hogar, etc.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell including herbs, rice, fruits, vegetables, canned goods and items for the home.

loans.name: Mary's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and is a married woman with 6 children, ages 8-18 years old. Mary sells clothes. She started in 2001. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Marieta and Jenifa, who have tailoring and clothing sales businesses.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria A. is 67 years old. She is married and has five children. She hails from Adeloko in the state of Lagos in Nigeria. Maria sells foodstuffs and has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years. Her loan request of $350 will be used to buy more foodstuffs for her business. Maria thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Bui T. is 49 years old. Her family consists of 4 children, 2 of which are grown. Her husband is a construction worker and makes approximately 1.500.000d/month. The two eldest children are independent and have jobs of their own. She has been a member of this organization since 1997; her first loan was 300.000, in which she used to invest in buying pigs to raise. After seeing the success of her initial investment, she has been investing more into fixing the pig pens and the care of raising pigs. Besides raising pigs, she has been collecting recycling items and selling them to the big company in her town. With the income of her husband, children and businesses, her family is presently financially stable. Her family was able to build a house and their lives has been better. She is requesting a loan of 10.000.000d to remodel, fix and expand the pig pens and buy more pigs to raise. Her present income is 3.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị T. năm nay 49 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 4 người con trong đó có 2 con đã trưởng thành. Chồng chị làm nghề thợ xây cho thu nhập khoảng 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Hai con lớn của chị đã đi làm và có thu nhập ổn định. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997 với vòng vốn ban đầu là 300.000 đ chị đã đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Đến nay sau một thời gian dài sử dụng vốn có hiệu quả, gia đình chị đã đầu tư được nhiều hơn vào việc sửa sang chuồng trại phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi. Ngoài thời gian chăn nuôi tại gia đình, chị còn đi thu mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý trong vùng. Cùng với thu nhập của chồng con và công việc tăng thu nhập của chị hiện nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã rất ổn định. Hiện gia đình chị đã tích lũy và xây được căn nhà rất khang trang cuộc sống gia đình chị đã được cải thiện rất nhiều. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 10.000.000đ để sử sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in raising pigs

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is 43 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children aged 26, 18, 11 and 6. She became a juice and snack seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Hamida now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by buying more items

loans.name: Thoeung

texts.en:
Thoeung N., 42, is a fish vendor who lives with six of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She typically makes about US$4 each day, and her husband, Chhun Pich, makes about US$6 each day as a cow dealer. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have created a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. This couple together also got support from two of their children who work as a garment worker and a sculptor. Thoeung N. is asking for a loan of US$700 to make two investments. She would like to invest US$400 in her husband’s business and also put US$300 into her own business, increasing the number of fish to sell. She sees these investments as opportunities that will increase her daily income.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To increase the number of fish to sell and also to invest on her husband's business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice Madungwo owns a boutique for selling second-hand clothes. She buys the second-hand clothes form Lagos and Onitsha. Her stock is  small in quantity. She believes with the infusion of a Kiva loan she will be able to increase her stock, which means more customers and more profits. She is in need of $600 to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.  She is 48 years old and married with 6 children. 'I want to see my children get the best education.'  She says she will use part of her profit to pay their school fees. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Khakim

texts.en:
For many years Khakim has offered taxi services with his car. This is how he supports his family as the only bread-winner in his family.

His car is wearing out so he wants to borrow money in order to repair it. He can then serve more clients and offer a better quality service.

loans.use: To repair the car used for a taxi service

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr: Ce jeune commerçant tient un commerce dans le grand marché de Ziguinchor. Il constitue un véritable soutient pour sa famille resté au village. Il demande ce crédit pour renforcer son commerce et réaliser davantage de bénéfices.Il a déjà vendu des centaines de sacs au dos pour écoliers.
texts.en:
Mohamed G. is a young entrepreneur with a general retail shop located in the central marketplace of Ziguinchor. With this business he has been able to sell hundreds of school bags. He is a strong support for his family who live in his home village. He is requesting this loan to improve his business and increase his income.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business improvement and purchase of stock

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul H. is a 32-year-old married father of one child, who is currently in school. To support his family, Abdul has been selling beef in the busy market of Ashaiman to his loyal customers. Abdul has been in this business for the past six years; it is lucrative and therefore he wants to expand the business and include lamb and goat meat in his wares.  H. Abdul is a member of the community group called Wadala ("Enjoyment") Trust Group. Members of this group have agreed to guarantee each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cows, goats and sheep for their meat

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lường Thị L., 33 tuổi ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Trước đây kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn và các con còn nhỏ. Năm 2005 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để buôn bán chiếu . Công việc phát triển khá thuận lọi và đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập ổn định 4.000.000đ/ . Vòng vốn tới chị L. muốn vay 8000.000 để tăng thêm vốn kinh doanh, tạo thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luong Thi L., 33 years old, lives in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. Before, her family had a very difficult time because there wasn't enough fund to invest in any business, while her children are all small. In 2005 Mrs. L. joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to loan some money to sell mats. The business has been going pretty well and brought a steady source of income to her family, about 400,000VND (about 238 USD) per month. She wants to borrow 8,000,000 VND (or 475 USD) to have more funds to invest in her business and bring more income to her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.en:
A. Abdurazok is 45 years old. He is married with three children. Abdurazok is providing taxi services with his car. He has been in this business for the last 7 years. Abdurazok is always trying to provide high quality services at attractive prices. He is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable as he is the main bread-winner in his large family. He is ready to work from the early morning till late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. Today he is planning to replace the fuel supply system with one using gas, as gas is cheaper than petrol. For this reason he requests $800 US Dollars for the term of 10 months. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a kapron gas-cylinder for a fuel supply system for his taxi.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace D. is fifty–one years old. She is widowed and has seven children to care for - four sons and three daughters. She says one of her children has completed university, the others are currently in high school and junior high. Grace lives with her children in a house, she toiled to put up with her late husband, in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural dominated town. It is about forty – five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. 

Grace works very hard to provide for the family since she doesn't receive any help. She is a day nursery teacher/farmer. Apart from these busy activities, Grace is engaged in trading activities. She trades charcoal. She procures bags of charcoal from nearby villages and sells them in her community. Grace says she also deals in textile materials.  She has been in business for seven years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more goods. She hopes to improve upon her families standard of living and give all her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of charcoal

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma L., 48, is a housewife with two children. Her family resides in Plaridel Misamis, Occidental, a place where fishing is a primary activity for earning a living. Her husband is a fisherman and already owns a small boat and operates a little variety store. 

They have applied for a PHP15,000(US$325) loan to buy an additional motorized pumpboat. Elma hopes to earn additional income so she can fix their house someday and welcomes the thought of seeing their children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase additional boat for fishing

loans.name: Evgeniya

texts.en: Evgeniya is married. She has a retail business and sells various small home products. Evgeniya has been in this business for 15 years. Having this great experience in sales she knows how to choose and sell her products well. Evgeniya would like to borrow 1,700 UAH to purchase more goods. She is going to help her children and grand-children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for re-sale

loans.name: Mela Pela

texts.fr: Cette demoiselle a appris le métier de la coiffure, faute de moyens pour installer son atelier de coiffure, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des articles de friperie, elle s’approvisionne au marché local de hedrzanawoè. Elle est très dynamique et a une manière très attirance d’accueillir ses clients. Voulant agrandir son stock d’articles de friperie, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pou acheter 03 bals de vêtements et divers.
texts.en:
This is a young lady who learned the trade of hairdressing. Due to a lack of funds for establishing her own hair salon, she got started in the commerce of second-hand clothing and the like. She supplies herself at the local marketplace of Hedrzanawoè. She is very energetic and really has a way of attracting customers and accommodating them. Wanting to expand her stock of used clothing, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy three bales of clothing and various other items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing
